title: JPMorgan leaves BASF at 'Overweight' - Target 58 euros
full_text: NEW YORK (dpa-AFX) - U.S. bank JPMorgan left its rating on BASF at "Overweight" with a price target of 58 euros after final figures for the third quarter. These were in line with previously significantly reduced market expectations, analyst Chetan Udeshi wrote in a research note presented on Tuesday. Free cash flow from July to September, meanwhile, was strong, ten percent above his estimate./bek/ajx      Original study publication date: 10/31/2023 / 07:06 GMT. title: DERICHEBOURG :  price target lowered by Oddo BHF
full_text: Oddo BHF reaffirms its 'neutral' opinion on Derichebourg, but lowers its target price from six to five euros, following an adjustment of its estimates (-5.5% for EBITDA, -10.5% for EBIT 2023) for the services group."The Group's valuation remains particularly modest (3.8 times 2024 EBITDA, 6.3 times EBIT for a PE of 4.5 times), i.e. a 40% discount to its historical ratios", says the analyst in charge of the file.  However, visibility remains limited for the business, and the integration of Elior's results with a turnaround from 2024 remains a challenge that needs to be confirmed', warns Oddo BHF.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. full_text: FRANKFURT (dpa-AFX Broker) - DZ Bank lowered the fair value for Mercedes-Benz from 84 to 70 euros after the third-quarter figures, but left its rating at "buy." title: EUROFINS SCIENTIFIC :  Bernstein raises its opinion
full_text: On Tuesday, Bernstein upgraded its opinion on Eurofins Scientific shares from 'underperform' to 'perform in line with the market', with a target raised from 45 to 53 euros.In a research note, the research firm refers to a better-balanced risk/reward profile following the share's fall since the start of the year, a decline that neither third-quarter results nor the recent investor day have managed to stem.From Bernstein's point of view, the bio-analytics specialist's share price now incorporates earnings forecasts that can be considered 'very cautious'.While he stresses that his main concerns remain - preventing him from being more positive on the stock - the analyst says he perceives limited downside potential given current share price levels.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: BOUYGUES :  Oddo BHF confirms its recommendation following results
full_text: Oddo BHF is maintaining its 'neutral' rating on Bouygues shares, with an unchanged target price of 32 euros, as Bouygues reported this morning a 38% increase in nine-month sales (including +2% lfl), in line with consensus expectations (+38%). In addition, EBIT was 6% above expectations in Q3, thanks to Colas and Equans, and net income for the first nine months came in at 665 ME vs. 537 ME for 9M 2022. In view of this positive momentum, the Group has confirmed its full-year outlook, i.e. stable sales and growth in operating income compared with 2022.'Bouygues shares have performed rather solidly since the start of the year, in line with the market and the sector', analyzes Oddo BHF. title: SANOFI :  Oddo BHF remains positive, lowers its target
full_text: Oddo BHF reaffirms its 'outperform' rating on Sanofi, but lowers its target price from €105 to €94, believing that after last Friday's announcements, 'the share's defensive profile has been undermined, which could scald a short-term rebound'. The research department has lowered its expectations by more than 8% in 2024 and 8% in 2025, resulting in a Core EBIT ratio of 29% in 2024 and 30.3% in 2025. The growth momentum observed in recent years has now been broken", he judges."Given the new growth profile expected in the short term, the valuation is less attractive. Despite a PE 24 of 10 times, which represents a 21% discount to its peers, the PEG is two times compared with 1.5 times for the sector", adds the analyst.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: URW :  Invest Securities remains Buy, reduces target
full_text: Invest Securities maintains its 'buy' recommendation on Unibail-Rodamco-Westfield (URW) with a price target revised from 82 to 79 euros, 'due to the lower payout in the short term and slightly higher refinancing costs in the medium term'.  URW published very satisfactory third-quarter data in the wake of a good first half", says the analyst, who points to "impressive" like-for-like rental growth.  These good figures militate in favor of a return to distribution, which is still not certain, but probable, with a pay-out that we expect to be low. However, this should be sufficient to ensure a satisfactory return, given the low share price", he continues.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: BASF advance - 'Weakness was expected'
full_text: FRANKFURT (dpa-AFX Broker) - Weaker quarterly figures of BASF did not affect the share price of the chemical company on Tuesday. On the contrary, the shares recently gained 1.6 percent in pre-borsday trading on Tradegate compared to the Xetra close at 42.35 euros.      Because of its oil and gas subsidiary Wintershall, the Ludwigshafen-based company suffered a quarterly loss and is becoming more cautious for 2023. The cut in the forecast, however, had been an open secret, said a trader, who advises buying on price weaknesses.      With a minus of a good ten percent so far in 2023, BASF has fared significantly worse than the Dax. In the area of the mark around 40 euros, however, recently held again the support./ajx/zb----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: OL GROUPE :  Berenberg concerned about the Champions League
full_text: On Monday, Berenberg renewed its 'hold' recommendation and its two-euro target on OL Groupe shares, expressing concern about a possible absence of the Rhone-based club from the next Champions League.With OL currently in last place in the Ligue 1 standings, the intermediary points out that the group's long-term strategy is based on regular participation in the prestigious soccer tournament, due to the significant revenues it generates for participants.In his note, the analyst stresses that the club is currently surviving thanks to funds raised from CVC Capital Partners, but that this source of financing will dry up from next season onwards, leading him to post a cautious opinion on the share.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. full_text: Deutsche Bank on Monday raised its price target for Deezer from three euros to 3.1 euros, deeming the online music specialist's Q3 performance to be "encouraging".In a research note, the analyst explains that he expects the French music streaming group to see its growth accelerate in Q4 on the back of price increases and partnerships in the B2B sector.Against this backdrop, the analyst expects the company - which has confirmed its annual targets - to reach the upper end of its guidance range for 2023.Deutsche Bank is nevertheless maintaining its 'hold' recommendation on the stock, preferring to remain on the sidelines due to what it sees as limited visibility concerning the group's profitability trajectory.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: Dassault Systèmes: share price continues to rise, broker lends support
full_text: Dassault Systèmes shares continued to rise on the Paris Bourse on Monday, as JPMorgan upgraded its recommendation on the stock to take account of the major contracts recently won by the group.At 12:05 pm, the stock was up 2.7%, one of the best performers in the SBF 120 index.In a note, JPMorgan explains that it has upgraded its rating to 'overweight' from 'underweight', with a price target revised upwards from 35 to 46 euros, representing a potential upside of around 20%.In its study, the intermediary mentions the agreement recently signed with Jaguar Land Rover, which it believes represents almost the same annual contribution as the one signed with Boeing, as well as the partnerships sealed with General Motors and Apple.JPMorgan also highlights the stock's clear underperformance since the start of the year, with a gain of 13% compared to an average increase of 25% for its peers.This observation leads JPMorgan to consider the stock's valuation as attractive, with a PER 2024 currently standing at 28x, far from its peak of 55x, i.e. a 10% discount to other software publishers specialized in design.Dassault Systèmes had gained nearly 12% on the stock market last week after raising its earnings forecasts in a context of profit warnings.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. All rights reserved.

title: Deutsche Bank Research lowers target for Merck KGaA - 'Buy'
full_text: FRANKFURT (dpa-AFX Broker) - Deutsche Bank Research cut its price target for Merck KGaA to 166 euros from 205 euros ahead of the company's quarterly results, but kept its rating at "buy." The group is expected to report a weak quarter, analyst Falko Friedrichs wrote in a research note issued Monday. The lab division continues to suffer from declining Covid sales, customer destocking and subdued demand in China, he said. End-market headwinds also persist in the semiconductor segment, it said. Only the pharmaceuticals segment is expected to have performed well again./tav/mis  Publication of the original study: Date not stated in study / Time not stated in study / CET First disclosure of original study: 30.10.2023 / 06:54 / CET----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: DASSAULT SYSTÈMES :  JPMorgan upgrades recommendation to 'overweight
full_text: On Monday, JPMorgan raised its recommendation on Dassault Systèmes shares to 'Overweight' from 'Underweight', with a price target revised upwards from 35 to 46 euros, representing a potential upside of around 20%.In a research note, the intermediary explains that it has re-examined the dossier, which it now considers to be close to an inflection point with the return of "major contracts" for the 3D design software designer.The analyst mentions the agreement recently signed with Jaguar Land Rover, which represents almost the same annual contribution as the one signed with Boeing, as well as partnerships sealed with General Motors and Apple.In its study, JPMorgan also highlights the stock's clear underperformance since the start of the year, with a gain of 13% compared to an average increase of 25% for its comparables.This observation leads JPMorgan to consider the stock's valuation as attractive, with a PER 2024 currently standing at 28x, far from its peak of 55x, i.e. a 10% discount to other software publishers specialized in design.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: STMICRO :  price target adjusted by Oddo BHF
full_text: Oddo BHF has reiterated its 'outperform' rating on STMicroelectronics, with an adjusted price target of €58 to €55, in the wake of a downward revision of its forecasts for the Franco-Italian semiconductor manufacturer by an average of 6% over 2024/25.The face of 2024 is still uncertain due to the industry, but automotive should grow and consumer goods should start to rebound", says the analyst, who also points to a good control of margins and a probable tactical reduction of Capex in 2024.The research firm also highlights STMicro's 'abnormally low' valuation at less than 10 times forward-looking PE (price/earnings ratio), a discount of over 50% to Sox, an all-time high.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: RÉMY COINTREAU :  Stifel downgrades its recommendation
full_text: Stifel has downgraded its advice on Rémy Cointreau from 'buy' to 'hold', with a price target reduced from 150 to 115 euros, judging that 'its strong potential for revaluation still seems to be postponed' and stating that it prefers Campari and Diageo in the spirits sector.It's painful to throw in the towel after the fall in the share price over the last six months, but visibility is so low that we fear the stock could be 'dead money' for some time to come", warns the broker in the summary of his note.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: SOPRA STERIA :  Oddo BHF lowers its target price
full_text: Oddo BHF maintains its 'outperform' rating on Sopra Steria shares, with a price target lowered from €260 to €254 after the group reported Q3 organic growth 'slightly below expectations' (sales of 1,345, 1% below expectations). Management is referring to a gradual slowdown in activity during the quarter, which should continue in France, without any sharp drop, reports the broker. Against this backdrop, Sopra Steria's management has confirmed its 2023 guidance of organic growth and FCF of at least 300 ME. At this stage, the tone is relatively cautious for 2024. According to management, organic growth should be below the traditional 4-6% range (consensus is currently 4.2% for the org).  Overall, these figures remain solid in relation to peers and close to expectations', concludes Oddo BHF, for whom 'the share's decline therefore seems exaggerated, even if it has to be admitted that the share's momentum, like that of the rest of the sector, will remain mixed over the coming months'. title: Hauck Aufhäuser IB upgrades Stratec to 'Buy' - Target 50 euros
full_text: HAMBURG (dpa-AFX Broker) - Hauck Aufhäuser Investment Banking upgraded Stratec from "hold" to "buy" after quarterly figures, but lowered the price target from 55 to 50 euros. The diagnostics specialist's key figures signaled a reassuring development in gross margin, while sales were still negatively impacted by the "Covid hangover" in the IVD business, analyst Alexander Galitsa wrote in a study available Monday. However, the IVD market should remain intact and Stratec should gradually return to structural growth. In addition, profitability appears to be recovering faster than expected due to the good progress made so far in management's price adjustment efforts./edh/ajx  Publication of the original study: 30.10.2023 / 08:09 / CEST First disclosure of original study: 30.10.2023 / 08:09 / CEST----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: UBS downgrades Vitesco to 'Neutral' - Target up to 91 euros
full_text: ZURICH (dpa-AFX) - Major Swiss bank UBS downgraded Vitesco from "buy" to "neutral" on the occasion of the Schaeffler takeover bid, but raised its price target from 86 to 91 euros. There is little likelihood that the automotive supplier will increase its bid for the former Conti subsidiary and that another bidder will step in, analyst David Lesne justified his new investment recommendation in a study published on Monday. title: ERAMET  :  Oddo BHF raises its opinion
full_text: Oddo BHF raises its opinion on Eramet from 'neutral' to 'outperform', in view of the 38% upside potential for a share back to its mid-2021 levels, in relation to its new price target of 85 euros (vs. 89 euros previously).Even if the lowering of Weda Bay's low-grade ore target is a disappointment, we are comforted by the overall good third-quarter performance in terms of production and costs", the analyst reacted to the latest trading update.Oddo BHF also believes that the Investor Day on November 13 should help to improve perceptions of the Group, and that the share appears extremely cheap at just three times 2024 adjusted EBITDA, i.e. a 35% discount to other miners.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: Jefferies Lowers Target for Porsche AG to 90 Euro - 'Hold'
full_text: NEW YORK (dpa-AFX Broker) - Analysts Jefferies lowered its price target for Porsche AG to 90 euros from 95 euros and left its rating at "hold." It is not enough for the share price to rise if the sports car maker merely achieves the earnings targets launched at the time of the Porsche IPO, analyst Philippe Houchois wrote in a study presented on Monday. He moderately lowered his estimates. In doing so, he took into account the costs of launching new models as well as the continued high level of investment in products and the electrification of the vehicle fleet. According to the expert, this is likely to freeze profits at current levels at least until 2025./gl/edh      Original study publication date: 10/29/2023 / 17:11 / ET First disclosure of original study date: 10/29/2023 / 17:11 / ET----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: JPMorgan raises target for MTU to 240 euros - 'Overweight'
full_text: NEW YORK (dpa-AFX Broker) - U.S. bank JPMorgan has raised its price target for MTU from 235 to 240 euros and left its rating at "Overweight". He had revised his earnings estimates (EPS) for the engine maker slightly upward following the quarterly figures, analyst David Perry wrote in a research note presented on Monday. This means that he is still above the consensus forecasts. The operating profit margin (Ebitda) is expected to increase after 2025, which the consensus forecasts did not reflect. In addition, the new estimates took into account the strong euro against the US dollar./gl/edh      Original study publication date: Oct. 30, 2023 / 00:18 / GMT Original study first disseminated: Oct. 30, 2023 / 00:18 / GMT----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: SANOFI :  Oddo BHF confirms its recommendation after results
full_text: The Group presented its Q3 2023 figures and its strategic plan. Following this publication, Oddo BHF confirms its Outperform recommendation on the value and its target of 105 E.' Sanofi released its Q3 23 results this morning, which came in below expectations in terms of sales and Core EPS. Sanofi continues to be impacted by a deleterious exchange rate effect over the period (-7% on the top line and -9% on the bottom line)' says Oddo BHF. The analyst points out that the Group's total sales came to 11,964 ME versus 12,097 ME expected (-4.1%; +3.2% cc), its core EBIT to 4,028 ME versus 4,078ME expected (-10.4%; -1% cc) for a core EPS of 2.55 E versus 2.61 E expected (source: Vara Research).  On the Vaccines side, sales of seasonal flu were below expectations, due in particular to a sharp decline in the vaccination rate", says the research firm. Oddo BHF indicates that the market should focus on the announcement of the strategic plan presented this morning.The plan implies an exit from its Consumer business (at the earliest in Q4 2024), and cost savings of E2 billion between 2024 and 2025, which will be reinvested in full.  The disappointment comes from the initial guidance for 2024 and the announcement of the end of its MT guidance. Indeed, due to a higher-than-anticipated tax rate (up from 19% to 21% next year), the Group expects its Core EPS to fall in the low single-digit range. Consensus forecasts had previously been for a 6% increase next year. In addition, Sanofi will no longer target a Core EBIT ratio of 32% in 2025. An adjustment of expectations of the same order as in 2024 is to be expected' adds Oddo BHF.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: GTT :  Berenberg raises its price target
full_text: On Friday, Berenberg maintained its buy recommendation on GTT, while raising its price target for the stock from 139 to 140 euros.Following Q3 results that came in above expectations and a tightening of 2023 targets, now expected at the top end of the range, the analyst believes he has greater visibility on the group's business.Fundamentally, orders for new LNG-powered container ships are driven by the emergence of new projects in this field and, in the longer term, by a replacement cycle for the most polluting vessels", he explains.As for non-strategic activities in electrolysers and services, Berenberg points out that they all grew in the third quarter and could make a significant contribution to Group sales in the future.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: VALEO :  Oddo BHF remains cautious, lowers target price
full_text: Oddo BHF maintains its 'neutral' rating on Valeo shares, with a price target lowered from 17 to 15 euros. The analyst recalls that Valeo yesterday published Q3 sales of 5224 ME, in line with expectations, and believes that the absence of outperformance is explained in particular by the current weakness of momentum in BEVs (battery electric vehicles). In particular, the broker is cautious about 2024, and below consensus expectations (-6% on EBIT, -29% on FCF), notably due to difficult production momentum, a customer mix that is likely to remain unfavorable, and continuing strong cost pressure (wage inflation).  Nevertheless, despite the cautious messages heard from some competitors and even automakers, management is confident and has fully confirmed its annual targets (consensus in line)", stresses Oddo BHF, which believes that these factors should largely reassure the markets. The equipment manufacturer has therefore maintained its annual targets unchanged, and is still aiming for 1/ sales of €22-23 bn (cons. €22.2 bn); 2/ an operating margin of between 3.2-4.0% (cons. 3.6%), suggesting a mid-range adjusted EBIT of €810 m (cons. €802 m) and a FCF >€320 m (cons. €352 m). title: ALTEN :  Invest Securities lowers its target price
full_text: Invest Securities confirms its 'neutral' rating on Alten shares, with a price target lowered from 136 to 118 euros. There's no drama, but confirmation of a downturn", stresses the broker.  After a long period of hyper-growth (7 quarters of organic growth >+10%), the trend reversal observed at the end of July is confirmed, with a slowdown in Q3 (in line with our expectations), but above all a slight warning on 2023 results and cautious talk of 2024", continues the analyst. Against this backdrop, Invest is more cautious than the consensus (notably on 2024 growth), and has revised its 2023-25 EPS to -3.6%/-7.4%/-2.1%.'However, given the short-term momentum, we feel it would be premature to raise our opinion, even if the quality of the management, the solid business model and the M&A leverage are solid assets', concludes the analyst. title: Fuchs gain - Short-term trend positive
full_text: FRANKFURT (dpa-AFX) - Fuchs shares reacted positively to business figures on Friday. On Tradegate, the MDax-listed shares gained 2.1 percent ahead of the Xetra close to 35.45 euros, which would take them above the resistance of the past few days at just over 35 euros in Xetra trading.      The lubricants manufacturer benefited from price increases in the first nine months of the year. On the earnings side, Fuchs performed better than expected, a trader said. In view of the results presented and the indications for the course of the final quarter, the group should be able to achieve its target for the year in terms of operating profit (Ebit), Baader Bank said.

title: NEXITY :  Oddo BHF reduces its price target
full_text: Oddo BHF maintains its 'underperform' rating on Nexity shares, with a price target of 21.5 to 17.1 euros. Last night, the real estate company reported sales of 915 ME, down 8%, in line with Oddo BHH's expectations (917 ME). Over 9 months, sales were virtually unchanged at ME2,958 (vs. an estimated ME2,960 and a consensus ME2,935). Nexity confirms its guidance for 2023, with expected sales of E4.3 billion and operating income of ME250.  In addition, we note that a 30 ME cost-savings program is underway, and should have a positive impact on 2024 for the most part", stresses the broker, who points out that, despite the undeniable "Value" character of the company, caution is still called for in the short term, given the current context and the low visibility for 2024.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: EUROFINS :  Deutsche Bank upgrades recommendation to 'hold
full_text: Deutsche Bank announced on Thursday that it had upgraded its recommendation on Eurofins from 'sell' to 'hold', albeit with a price target lowered from €54 to €50.In a note published in the morning, the analyst acknowledged that the bio-analysis specialist's shares were 'cheap' after a 32% decline this year, which it explained by the downward revision of its annual targets.The intermediary also points to persistent concerns about the Group's growth, earnings and cash flow."Our fears have been clearly stated in the past", recalls DB. These include limited cash flow generation, an unflattering track record in achieving sustainable profitability, and a complex business model that limits operating leverage", he continues."We believe that these elements are still in place, but they now seem better integrated by the market", concludes the professional.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: BIC :  UBS remains Buy after quarterly results
full_text: UBS leaves its opinion on the stock unchanged at Buy and confirms its price target of E70.The analyst believes that "earnings are above 1.5% thanks to stronger margins".' In the third quarter, Bic's LFL failure was more than offset by a better-than-expected improvement in operating margin, leading to a profit above 1.5% and earnings growth of 30% year-on-year ' says UBS.The group expects sales growth in fiscal 2023 of between 5% and 7% at constant exchange rates, thanks to the combined effect of price increases and mix improvements. It is also targeting an improvement in adjusted operating income and adjusted operating margin for fiscal 2023, as well as gross margin.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: WORLDLINE :  Oddo BHF drastically cuts its target
full_text: Oddo BHF maintains its 'outperform' rating on Worldline shares, with a drastically reduced target price, from 45 to 20 euros, after the stock lost nearly 60% of its value during the October 25 trading session. While the analyst considers this warning to be "very significant", particularly in terms of FCF (-30/60% on FCF 23/24), he believes that "it is above all the Group's communication that was punished yesterday". Oddo BHF believes that the accumulation of several issues (macro slowdown in Germany, quality of e-tailers) and the decision to proceed at the same time with a restructuring program (250 ME) have created confusion and fed the idea that Worldline could be suffering from more structural problems.Yesterday, following the publication of lower-than-expected sales, Worldline revised its 2023 guidance, now anticipating organic sales growth of 6/7% (vs. 8/10%), which implies growth of ~3% in Q4. In addition, the OMDA margin has been revised down by 150 bp (vs >+100 bp previously). The broker points to three key issues, namely the macro slowdown in Germany, the new restructuring plan and the termination of contracts by certain retailers.Oddo BHF's view is that an extremely gloomy scenario seems 'predicated'.  To justify the current price in our DCF (WACC of 13%), we would therefore need a very pessimistic (and not very credible) financial scenario of a 3% decline in annual sales, operating margins down by 100 bp a year, a cash generation profile well below that of the past, and a zero long-term growth rate", concludes the broker. title: DASSAULT SYSTÈMES :  Invest Securities adjusts its target
full_text: While remaining 'neutral' on Dassault Systèmes, Invest Securities has adjusted its price target from €40 to €38, 'in anticipation of finding an entry point for a stock whose fundamentals are far superior to those of other European Tech players, but which is appropriately valued'.Against a backdrop of deteriorating macroeconomic conditions, which are fuelling uncertainty and/or profit warnings, the excellent quarterly results published yesterday morning are reassuring and provide a cushion for full-year results", the analyst believes.The research firm also believes that the solid sales momentum of the third quarter is only partially reflected in the quarterly results, and will continue to fuel earnings in the coming quarters.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: DASSAULT SYSTEMES :  UBS confirms Neutral rating
full_text: UBS confirms its Neutral opinion on the stock and its E42 target after the announcement of Q3 2023 figures.The analyst believes that "good results help to reduce risks".' The strong performance of software in Q3 somewhat reduces risks for Q4 and should enable shares to advance, but the slowdown in life sciences is likely to remain the focus of concern ' says UBS.For 2023 as a whole, Dassault Systèmes confirms it is targeting sales growth of between 8 and 9% at constant exchange rates, and raises its adjusted EPS target to between 1.19 and 1.21 euros.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: WORLDLINE :  Invest Securities halves its target price
full_text: Invest Securities reiterates its 'buy' recommendation on Worldline, while halving its target price to 23 euros, after lowering its estimates and taking into account a higher beta for the payment solutions group.While the share price had already been divided by four in relation to its July 2021 highs, yesterday's stock market collapse (-59%) can only be explained for a third by the earnings warning", argues the analyst, who considers the stock market reaction "disproportionate".Knowing that there are no fears about the company's financial structure or risk of fraud, he explains this reaction by the risk of commoditization of the business, a scenario he does not believe in 'given the renewed interest of PE funds in the sector'.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: Siemens Energy shares fall - 'Wiwo' report on federal government guarantees
full_text: FRANKFURT (dpa-AFX Broker) - Siemens Energy shares, which had already been badly battered recently, fell further in early trading on Thursday morning following a report in "Wirtschaftswoche" (Wiwo) about negotiations with the German government on billion-euro guarantees.      On the Tradegate trading platform, the shares of the power engineering company slumped by around 6 percent to just over 10 euros compared to the Xetra close.       On Xetra, that would be a record low. "Without the guarantees, the company would probably have to do without major orders," writes the "Wiwo". "The ex-parent Siemens is also supposed to step in, but is reluctant." Siemens shares fell 1.8 percent on Tradegate. Siemens still holds shares in the former subsidiary.      Siemens Energy has long been assuming an annual loss of several billion euros because of massive problems in its wind business. With a minus of almost 40 percent, the shares are 2023 the Dax tail light./mis/zb----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: Rheinmetall rises further toward October interim high
full_text: FRANKFURT (dpa-AFX Broker) - Rheinmetall shares gained on Thursday following the surprising key data presented on Wednesday evening. In pre-market trading on Tradegate, they gained a little more than one percent to just under €270 compared to the Xetra close in a weak environment. This brings the interim high from October of over 275 euros closer.       Thanks to good business with weapons and ammunition, the defense group generated significantly higher profits in the third quarter. One trader initially criticized the lack of information on orders in the third quarter. In addition, the annual targets had only been confirmed. However, these did not yet include the figures for the acquired company Expal./ajx/zb

title: DZ Bank Raises Fair Value for Deutsche Bank - 'Buy'
full_text: FRANKFURT (dpa-AFX Broker) - DZ Bank has raised its fair value for Deutsche Bank from 12.30 to 12.50 euros after quarterly figures and left its rating at "buy". The financial institution presented an overall solid set of figures, wrote analyst Timo Dums in a study presented on Wednesday. title: SCOR :  Berenberg raises its price target
full_text: Berenberg announced on Wednesday that it had raised its target price for Scor shares from 34 to 35 euros, ahead of the French insurer's 3rd-quarter results to be published on November 10.In a research note, the research firm - which is maintaining its buy recommendation on the stock - says it expects a "solid" publication, which should put the group in a good position to achieve its annual targets.While pointing out that the stock has surged by 28.5% this year and by some 100% over the past 12 months, the firm says it continues to see upside potential on the basis of its current valuation multiples.In its view, the good quarter-on-quarter performance of the business, the achievement of the objectives of the 2024-2026 strategic plan and a possible return to dividend growth should encourage further share price appreciation.For 2023, its net profit forecast for the Group has thus been raised by 5.4% to 860 million euros.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: COVIVIO :  Invest Securities remains Buy, lowers its target
full_text: While maintaining its 'buy' recommendation on Covivio, Invest Securities has lowered its target price from 54.6 to 51.3 euros, believing that 'market conditions are heightening uncertainty over the property company's 2024 dividend'.'Risk-free rates remaining higher than our expectations and the extreme weakness of investment markets are heightening our concerns over the dividend's sustainability', says the analyst after the nine-month trading update."In view of our RNR trajectory (TCMA 2023/28 of -4.7%), the payout could fall as early as fiscal 2024", it warns, estimating nevertheless that "in this conservative scenario, the 2024 yield would remain above 9% on the basis of the current share price".Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: KERING :  price target reduced by Oddo BHF
full_text: Oddo BHF confirms its 'neutral' rating on Kering shares, with a price target reduced from 463 to 443 euros, reflecting the mechanical impact of less favorable earnings forecasts.Last night, Kering published Q3 group sales of 4464 ME, down 13% y/y and 9% y/y on an organic basis, while Oddo BHF was expecting 4515 ME.  The publication is therefore not really surprising, if not encouraging", says the analyst, who points out that his forecasts now include Creed, whose acquisition has just been finalized and which should be consolidated as of November."All other things being equal, Creed's contribution increases Group sales and EBIT by +1%/+2% on a full-year basis, but the impact is not significant in terms of EPS over 2024 and 2025", stresses the broker. At a time when the tone is clearly becoming cautious on margins and recovery on the topline is not imminent, Oddo BHF is lowering its EBIT forecasts for the stock by an average of 3%. title: VISIATIV :  Invest Securities lowers its target
full_text: Invest Secutities maintains its 'neutral' rating on Visiativ shares, with a price target reduced from 27 to 22 euros. The analyst reports that although the stock has dropped 16% in the space of a month, the downturn would not represent an opportunity in view of the low short-term visibility surrounding results (cf. Q3 and especially Q4 23) and financial structure. 'Committed to a plan focused on growth at the expense of profitability even as the macro environment deteriorates, Visiativ should see its results contract in 2023-24th (before a significant rebound in 2025), which could create stress with regard to the financial situation', stresses the broker. title: KERING :  UBS remains neutral on the stock
full_text: UBS confirms its neutral recommendation on the value and leaves its target price unchanged at E432 after the announcement of Q3 2023 figures.The analyst believes that "third-quarter results were as weak as expected, with a general decline in sales".' Third-quarter results, with sales down -9%, were as weak as expected and brought no negative surprises. We make no significant changes to our estimates and remain neutral ' says UBS.' The Group's organic growth in Q3 was -9% against a consensus of -7% (UBSe -10%), with sales of 4,464 million euros, -1% against the consensus of 4,515 million euros (in line with UBSe of 4,452 million euros) ' adds the analyst firm.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: Jefferies leaves Beiersdorf at 'Buy' - Target 152 euros
full_text: NEW YORK (dpa-AFX) - The analyst firm Jefferies has left Beiersdorf at "Buy" with a price target of 152 euros after quarterly figures. Organic sales growth in the consumer business, which was in line with expectations, should be enough to support the stock given the figures released by competitors so far, analyst Molly Wylenzek wrote in a research note published Wednesday. At the group level, however, growth is below Beiersdorf's published consensus estimate due to the weaker performance of its adhesives business./gl/ajx      Publication of the original study: 25.10.2023 / 01:59 / ET First disclosure of the original study: 25.10.2023 / 01:59 / ET----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: HERMÈS :  price target lowered by Oddo BHF
full_text: Oddo BHF reiterates its 'neutral' opinion on Hermès following the quarterly trading update, while adjusting its price target slightly downwards from 1953 to 1912 euros, its DCF valuation being impacted by the rise in the risk-free rate.  Hermès remains, for us, one of the finest franchises in the luxury goods industry (if not the finest), but we think that the resilient nature of the stock is a little overestimated by the market at present", warns the analyst in charge of the file.In his opinion, its sales are not completely immune to the slowdown in the sector, and the need to increase investments to satisfy customers should lead to a certain downward normalization of margin levels.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: Interparfums: in the red, a broker lowers its target
full_text: Interparfums is down more than 6% in Paris, as Oddo BHF confirmed this morning its 'neutral' rating on the stock, with a price target reduced from €70 to €50. Q3 sales came in at 214.6 ME, up 10% (+18% at constant exchange rates), a figure 'slightly ahead' of Oddo BHF's expectations.  All in all, Interparfums is on track (+13%e) with its full-year guidance (sales 23rd: 800 MEe), and the consensus (809 MEe) should therefore change little. For our part, we are looking at 810 MEe (vs. 815 MEe previously, which probably corresponded to a maximum)', says the analyst.In this context, Oddo BHF indicates that it has adjusted its WACC (weighted average cost of capital) to 9.4% vs. 8.4% previously, to reflect the prudence associated with the current macro/consumer context.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. All rights reserved.

title: Klépierre: share price up, broker confirms his recommendation
full_text: Klépierre gained nearly 2% in Paris this morning, as Invest Securities confirmed its 'buy' recommendation on the stock, with a target price of 26.2 euros, following the publication of what it described as 'very good' nine-month operating data."Centre tenants reported sales growth of +7%. At the same time, thanks to sustained rental activity, the occupancy rate has been maintained at the very satisfactory level of 95.8%, with no apparent deterioration in rents", points out the analyst."With a balance sheet that is not under pressure, the property company has not announced any further disposals, while access to liquidation remains satisfactory. Despite the expected fall in the CFNC, the dividend does not seem to us to be under threat', he continues. Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. All rights reserved.

title: HERMES :  Stifel confirms its recommendation on the stock
full_text: Stifel maintains its 'hold' rating on the Hermès share with an unchanged target price of 1,850 euros. The analyst reports that Hermès' third-quarter sales of +15.6% at constant exchange rates exceeded consensus expectations (+13%) and its own estimate (+14%). According to the broker, these figures reflect a gradual normalization of growth compared with the comparatively high +25% in Q3 2022. Stifel points out that, from a regional standpoint, the main drivers of the outperformance against analysts' expectations were Europe (+18% vs. consensus of +14%), the Americas (+20% vs. consensus of +10%) and Japan (+24% vs. consensus of +22%), while growth of +10% in Asia, excluding Japan, was in line with expectations. As for current trends, the company saw no change in October, reports the analyst. Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: UBISOFT :  Barclays slightly raises its price target
full_text: Barclays announced on Tuesday that it had raised its price target for Ubisoft from 29 to 29.15 euros, while renewing its 'weight online' recommendation on the stock.In a note dedicated to the European media sector, the analyst said he expected the video game group to update its annual targets at its quarterly publication on Thursday October 26.The intermediary now expects net bookings of €367.8 million for the three months to the end of September, compared with a previous forecast of €362.5 million.In its study, Barclays underpins this upward revision by the early release of "Assassin's Creed Mirage", available since October 5 and not since October 12 as initially planned.By way of comparison, Ubisoft had set itself a target of 350 million euros for its second fiscal quarter, it points out.Although the first half of the 2023/2024 fiscal year proved to be more intense than anticipated, with the launches of 'Assassin's Creed Mirage' and 'The CrewMotorfest', Barclays expects Ubisoft to post an operating loss, excluding exceptional items, of 70 million euros for the first half as a whole, recalling that the group's activity is heavily concentrated in the second half of the fiscal year.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. full_text: Oddo BHF is reiterating its 'outperform' rating on AXA shares, with the target price maintained at 37 euros, ahead of the insurance company's business indicators for the first nine months of 2023, scheduled for November 2 after trading."The Group's balance sheet remains very solid, and AXA continues to benefit from favorable operating dynamics, with a controlled risk profile and a marked improvement in AXA XL's structural profitability", the research house points out. title: SODEXO :  Stifel adjusts its target price
full_text: While maintaining its 'hold' recommendation on Sodexo, Stifel has adjusted its price target from 100 to 98 euros, ahead of the service group's publication of its annual results, scheduled for next Thursday.The broker continues to distance itself from the consensus's positive stance on the stock, believing that "the excitement surrounding the Pluxee demerger seems exaggerated" and retaining a structural concern about on-site services.Stifel points out that its cautious view "is offset by a relatively undemanding valuation, leaving only limited absolute downside potential" for the stock. Nevertheless, he continues to prefer Compass and Edenred within the sector.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: CARMILA :  Invest Securities remains Buy, reduces its target
full_text: Invest Securities has reaffirmed its 'buy' recommendation on Carmila, and lowered its target price from 18.8 to 18.2 euros, following a trading update which highlighted 'satisfactory operating performance against a backdrop of rising financial expenses'.Over nine months, operating activity remained buoyant (occupancy +3%, sales +8%), while continuing strong demand for the company's properties enabled occupancy to remain stable at the high level of 96%", said the analyst. title: VIRBAC :  opinion upgraded by Oddo BHF after sales figures
full_text: Oddo BHF has upgraded its opinion on Virbac from 'neutral' to 'outperform', with a target price raised from €275 to €290, in the wake of the company's quarterly trading update, which, in its view, "should be interpreted constructively".  We're among those who think that the fourth-quarter publication could be interpreted negatively, but the perception that the low point has passed now makes us think that we can come back to the stock", the analyst believes. After the annual publication for 2023, scheduled for March 2024, Oddo BHF believes that the animal health group 'should enter a more favorable Q1/Q2/Q1 2024 sequence, and therefore more buoyant on the stock market'.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: L'Oréal: in the green with brokerage comments
full_text: Bucking the trend in Paris, L'Oréal is up 1% on the back of positive comments from Barclays, which has reaffirmed its 'overweight' recommendation and raised its target price for the world's leading cosmetics company from 423 to 431 euros."The acceleration in other countries has more than offset the slowdown in luxury goods in China in recent quarters, leaving growth to be based on a broader base and better quality", the broker points out.While lowering its price target from 480 to 450 euros, Stifel also reaffirms its 'buy' recommendation on L'Oréal, pointing to 'the strength of the portfolio and its diversification in beauty' in light of the latest quarterly trading update.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: Downward trend of Merck KGaA accelerates
full_text: FRANKFURT (dpa-AFX) - Shares in Merck KGaA took last place in the leading Dax index on Monday with heavy price losses. Most recently, they fell 4.6 percent to 142 euros, reinforcing the downward trend that has been underway since early September. At 141.60 euros, they had marked their lowest level since May 2021 on Monday.      In a recent analysis, expert Richard Vosser of JPMorgan referred to detailed study data on the competitor products Padcev and Keytruda for the treatment of bladder cancer. These would have confirmed the risks with regard to sales of Merck KGaA's corresponding drug Bavencio. Up to 50 percent of these revenues could be lost in 2027.      Since the beginning of the year, the shares of Merck KGaA are among the weakest stocks in the Dax with a minus of more than one fifth. Information from the Darmstadt-based company's Capital Markets Day last week, according to which the chemicals and pharmaceuticals group intends to return to the road to success soon after 2023, which was marked by difficulties, only brought a temporary recovery in the share price.      In the European pharmaceutical sector, the shares were far behind on Monday. The sector as a whole has been under heavy pressure for several days. Negative corporate news, for example from laboratory equipment supplier Sartorius, weighed.       Positive news, such as from diabetes group Novo Nordisk, was interpreted negatively by investors for the shares of Fresenius and Fresenius Medical Care, which have since fallen sharply./ajx/la/zb

title: Sartorius continues to slide - low since April 2020
full_text: FRANKFURT (dpa-AFX) - The free fall of Sartorius shares following a reduction in annual targets from mid-October continued on Monday. In the morning, the shares of the pharmaceutical and laboratory equipment manufacturer were the tail end of a weak Dax, plummeting 3.50 percent to 231.60 euros. This marked a further low since April 2020 at the start of the week, after they had still risen to almost 632 euros during the biotech boom in the Corona crisis towards the end of 2021.      In mid-October, the Gottingen-based company had reduced its outlook for the year. The company is being hampered by a surprisingly long period of destocking following the end of the pandemic, as well as relatively low production levels at some customers. Added to this is generally subdued investment activity by customers, particularly in China and the USA.      Investors are also concerned about the medium-term outlook. About two weeks ago, Sartorius confirmed its "fundamentally positive medium- and long-term market outlook. However, it had also said that the medium-term targets were currently being reviewed and that an update would also be communicated at the beginning of next year. Until then, there is uncertainty, which is causing unease among investors.      Since the outlook was lowered, Sartorius' share price has already fallen by around 28 percent. In 2023, the share price is down 37 percent. This makes the shares the second-weakest stock in Germany's leading index, the Dax, which is currently still posting a gain of around six percent.      With the minus, the papers have also now eaten up almost all the gains from the Corona pandemic. At the end of 2019, the shares had still cost around 200 euros. Despite the losses since the record high, the share is significantly more expensive than ten years ago. In October 2013, the share was still worth less than 20 euros; 20 years ago it was less than 2 euros.      The company is currently valued on the stock exchange at just under 16 billion euros. Major shareholders are the heirs of the company's founder and the US company Bio-Rad Laboratories. The capital is divided into ordinary and preferred shares. The latter have been listed on the Dax since September 2021. Since the free float of preferred shares is now only just under six billion euros, membership of Germany's premier Borse league could again be at risk in the medium term./mis/ajx/zb/jha/

title: Technip Energies: up, broker confirms its recommendation
full_text: Technip gains nearly 6% in Paris as Oddo BHF confirms this morning its 'outperform' rating on the stock, with an unchanged target price of 27 euros.As a reminder, the stock gave up 13.75% yesterday after the publication of a Le Monde investigation entitled 'How France's Technip Energies assisted a Russian gas megaproject despite international sanctions'.Oddo BHF points out that Technip Energies has never concealed this contract or its desire for a controlled exit. The commitment has been respected, and the Group confirmed its exit from the ALNG2 project on July 27, 2023 when it published its half-year results", reports the analyst.The broker believes that the main financial risk lies in a possible fine for non-compliance with the sanctions, a fine that Oddo BHF estimates could potentially amount to between 50 and 100 ME, an amount deemed "easily affordable for the Group".However, the analyst also points to another commercial risk, rather localized to the US market, where Technip Energies could be penalized in future tenders in the region.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. All rights reserved.

title: Esi Groupe: in the green, one analyst upgrades to buy
full_text: The stock is in the green, while the CAC40 is losing more than 1%. This morning, Invest Securities raised its recommendation to buy (from neutral) on the stock, with a target price of 155E in line with the offer price.The analyst believes that the stock has fallen below 150E, and now offers significant potential in relation to Keysight's offer price of 155E, which should be launched in late 2023/early 2024.  Given that Keysight has secured the support of shareholders representing more than 50% of the capital, the risk of failure of the operation is very low, and there is even a possibility that Keysight will have to outbid us if it wants to obtain more than 90% of the capital and carry out the squeeze-out (cf. Alain de Rouvray's position with 4.1% of the capital).  In view of this favorable risk/reward, we are upgrading our opinion to buy.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. All rights reserved.

title: Hauck Aufhäuser IB lowers target for Dürr to 30 euros - 'Buy'.
full_text: HAMBURG (dpa-AFX Broker) - Hauck Aufhäuser Investment Banking cut its price target for Dürr to 30 euros from 37 euros after key data on the third quarter and a gloomy outlook for 2024, but left its rating at "buy." Due to weak fixed cost coverage at woodworking machinery subsidiary Homag, he reduced his earnings estimates for the equipment maker, analyst Christian Glowa wrote in a research note issued Friday. However, Dürr should continue to benefit from structural growth drivers, while the headwinds at Homag are only temporary, he added. The expected weakness in the share price should be seen as a buying opportunity./edh/ajx  Publication of the original study: 20.10.2023 / 08:36 / CEST First disclosure of the original study: 20.10.2023 / 08:36 / CEST----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: RENAULT :  Oddo BHF reduces its target price
full_text: Oddo BHF maintains its 'outperform' rating on Renault shares, with a price target lowered from 60 to 55 euros following the recent sector derating (more conservative multiples, estimates unchanged).Renault yesterday published Q3 sales of 10.5 billion euros, up 8% on a reported basis (+14% excluding currency effects) and in line with consensus expectations (10.5 billion euros). The automaker also confirmed its annual targets, as expected.  Despite yesterday's fall in the share price, the publication and management's comments reinforce our view that the automaker is still ahead of its targets, especially as the best is yet to come even though the product offensive is still in its early stages", says the analyst, who reminds us that the Losange remains one of his favorite stocks this year. title: L'ORÉAL :  UBS reiterates its buy recommendation
full_text: The analyst believes that the 3rd quarter is in line with forecasts despite the reduction in Travel Retail activity in Asia.Following the announcement of the 3rd quarter figures, UBS reiterates its Buy recommendation and leaves its price target unchanged at E495.This is another double-digit LFL quarter (in line with forecasts), despite the much greater-than-expected negative impact of inventory reductions in the Asian travel retail sector," says UBS.Group sales reached 30.57 billion euros on September 30, 2023 on a reported basis, representing growth of +9.4%. On a like-for-like basis, i.e. at identical structure and exchange rates, Group sales growth was +12.6%.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: RENAULT :  Berenberg reiterates its buy recommendation
full_text: On Friday, Berenberg reiterated its buy recommendation and price target of 47 euros for Renault, following a 7% fall in the share price after the presentation of Q3 sales figures.The financial intermediary attributes this penalty - highly exaggerated in its view - to the issues of destocking and restocking that affected dealers, elements which in its view were well known by the market.The analyst also points to a less favorable mix in terms of sales, not profitability, a dynamic he deems temporary.Berenberg prefers to retain from the publication the solidity of the automaker's prices and, a rarity within the sector, the confirmation of a trajectory of improved profitability for the second half, as well as the prospect of "resistant" margins in 2024.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: Barclays Raises Target for SAP to 145 Euros - 'Overweight'
full_text: LONDON (dpa-AFX Broker) - British investment bank Barclays raised its price target for SAP from 135 to 145 euros after figures and left its rating at "Overweight". With a confirmed outlook and a stable order cushion in the cloud business, the software group's quarter was not outstanding at first glance, analyst James Goodman wrote in a report published on Friday. However, given the current difficult environment and the increasing nervousness of investors, it was more than enough. He justified the new price target with a less risky outlook: The forecast in the cloud business seems to be within reach, and the development is also encouraging at the profit level and for cash./tav/edh  Original study publication date: 19/10/2023 / 15:57 / GMT. First disclosure of the original study: 19.10.2023 / 16:00 / GMT----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: GECINA :  Invest Securities lowers its target
full_text: Invest Securities confirms its buy rating on Gecina shares, with a price target lowered from €114 to €108. Gecina published 9M 2023 rental income up by a strong +6.1% on a like-for-like basis, driven by its office (+6.5%) and residential (+4.8%) properties. The analyst reports that the excellent rental performance has made it possible to secure all the space in the pipeline for the next 18 months.  The property company has therefore, unsurprisingly, reiterated its 2023 RNR target (up between +6% and +8%), which augurs well for distribution", stresses Invest, who points out that "even if further falls in asset values are highly likely, the company has one of the best risk/return profiles in our coverage universe". The broker believes that Gecina should be able to post smooth dividend growth over the medium term (TCMA 23/28th of +2.6%). Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: ESSILORLUXOTTICA :  UBS lowers guidance
full_text: UBS confirms its neutral recommendation on EssilorLuxottica but lowers its price target to 176 E (from 179 E) following the announcement of Q3 2023 figures.Following this publication, the analyst considers that visibility is limited for the end of the year.' There are no surprises on Q3 results, but the margin for H2 remains a major question mark. We are cutting EPS by 1%' says UBS.' The Group's total third-quarter sales of €6,294 million were 1% below forecasts and those of UBSe, with growth at constant exchange rates of +5.2% (vs. forecasts of +5.3%, UBSe +5.4%). In the third quarter, at constant exchange rates, professional solutions grew by +5.7% (consensus +4.4%, UBSe +5.4%)' stresses the analyst firm.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: TECHNIP ENERGIES :  Oddo BHF confirms its recommendation
full_text: Oddo BHF confirms its 'outperform' rating on Technip Energies shares, with an unchanged target price of 27 euros. Yesterday, the share price fell by 13.75% after the publication of a Le Monde investigation entitled 'How France's Technip Energies assisted a Russian gas megaproject despite international sanctions'. Oddo BHF believes that Technip Energies has never concealed this contract or its desire for a controlled exit. The commitment has been respected, and the Group confirmed its exit from the ALNG2 project on July 27, 2023 when it published its half-year results', reports the analyst.  The broker considers that the main financial risk lies in a possible fine for non-compliance with the sanctions, a fine that Oddo BHF estimates could potentially amount to between €50 and €100 million, an amount deemed 'easily affordable for the Group'. However, the analyst also points to another risk, a commercial one, rather localized to the US market, where Technip Energies could be penalized in future tenders in the region.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: ESI GROUPE :  Invest Securities raises its recommendation
full_text: Invest Securities has raised its recommendation to buy (from neutral) on the stock, with a target price of 155E, in line with the offer price.The analyst believes that the stock has fallen below 150E, offering significant potential in relation to Keysight's offer price of 155E, which should be launched in late 2023/early 2024.  Given that Keysight has secured the support of shareholders representing more than 50% of the capital, the risk of failure of the operation is very low, and there is even a possibility that Keysight will have to outbid us if it wants to obtain more than 90% of the capital and carry out the squeeze-out (cf. Alain de Rouvray's position with 4.1% of the capital)," says the research firm.  In view of this favorable risk/reward, we are upgrading our opinion to Buy.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: Jefferies leaves SMA Solar at 'Hold' - Target 68 euros
full_text: NEW YORK (dpa-AFX Broker) - Analysts Jefferies left its rating on SMA Solar at "Hold" with a price target of 68 euros after figures from competitor Solaredge. Unlike its competitor, the German inverter manufacturer is expected to post an excellent third quarter after raising its targets a few weeks ago, analyst Constantin Hesse wrote in a research note published on Friday. However, the expert is concerned about Solaredge's bleak outlook for the final quarter. The order intake in particular could possibly also be a problem for SMA Solar - according to Hesse, this is likely to have already weakened in the past quarter./tav/tih  Publication of the original study: 19.10.2023 / 17:25 / ET First disclosure of the original study: 19.10.2023 / 17:25 / ET----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: Berenberg leaves Sartorius at 'Buy' - Target 380 euros
full_text: HAMBURG (dpa-AFX Broker) - Private bank Berenberg left Sartorius at "buy" with a price target of 380 euros after meetings with investors. The topic of GLP-1 is currently dominating discussions, analyst Sam England wrote in a study on the medical technology sector presented on Thursday. This refers to the new class of antidiabetic drugs that are also suitable for people with weight problems and have become a multi-billion market. However, Sartorius is also in the focus of investors after its recent profit warning. Many among them believed that falling market expectations for 2024 were now already priced in. The analyst advises Sartorius to focus on 2025, which is not affected by inventories./ajx/edh  Publication of the original study: 18.10.2023 / 16:43 / GMT First disclosure of original study: Date not specified in study / Time not specified in study / Time zone not specified in study----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: Metzler reinstates Porsche AG with 'Buy' - Target 112 Euro
full_text: FRANKFURT (dpa-AFX Broker) - Bankhaus Metzler has reinstated a "buy" rating and a price target of 112 euros on Porsche AG following a change in analyst coverage. The success story of the German automotive industry is being challenged by two revolutionary forces: disruptive technological megatrends and the advance of new players, Pal Skirta, the analyst in charge from now on, wrote in an industry report available Thursday. He does not expect premium manufacturers to face a significant price or competitive war in China. He sees sports car maker Porsche as a particularly compelling buy./edh/tih  Publication of the original study: 19.10.2023 / 08:10 / CEST First disclosure of the original study: 19.10.2023 / 08:10 / CEST----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: Gecina: share price declines despite 'record' Q3 results
full_text: Gecina shares lost ground on the Paris Bourse on Thursday, despite the fact that the real estate company last night reported "record" rental activity for the 3rd quarter.On a like-for-like basis, the real estate group's rents rose by 7.3% to a total of 496.9 million euros over the first nine months of the year, accelerating compared with 2022 (+2%).On a like-for-like basis, the acceleration in performance exceeds that published for the end of 2022, with rents up by 6.1% overall, compared with +4.4% at the end of last year.According to Berenberg's analysts, who are Buy on the stock, these good figures provide a solid base for the 2024 financial year.It's a good thing that Gecina has concentrated in recent years on buildings in the center of Paris, enabling it to benefit from the relative shortage of modern, energy-efficient office space", explains the research firm.We continue to be positive on the stock in view of its solid balance sheet structure, high asset turnover this year and the robust performance of its offices", add the teams at Degroof Petercam, who are also Buy on the stock.Gecina also confirmed its forecast for net recurring earnings per share of between 5.9 and six euros in 2023, i.e. an increase of 6% to 8%.Despite this solid publication, Gecina shares lost 0.9% on Thursday morning on the Paris Bourse. It has lost 3% since the beginning of the year.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. All rights reserved.

title: Südzucker slips - Barclays brings GLP-1 issue into play
full_text: FRANKFURT (dpa-AFX) - Shares in Südzucker suffered significantly on Thursday as a result of a negative sector study by Barclays. The food group's papers fell by as much as 6.6 percent to 13.82 euros. The low for the year of 13.41 euros, which was only reached at the end of last week, has thus come back into focus.      The topic of GLP-1 is currently on everyone's lips. This refers to the new class of antidiabetic drugs, which have also proved to be a boon for people with weight problems. As a result, they have become a multi-billion dollar market. But one man's joy is another man's sorrow - because for food producers, curbed appetites are more of a curse.       In a recent industry study, Barclays expert Alex Sloane also addressed the burden of GLP-1, saying that the "bear scenario" caused by these drugs is difficult to assess. However, the increasingly negative perception of the health risks of highly processed foods could further depress growth forecasts. In any case, Sloane is becoming very cautious.      He lowered his Südzucker rating to "Underweight" with a target of only 12 euros. Südzucker is not directly affected by GLP-1, but could be if the wave of acceptance with the help of the funds spilled over into Europe. In addition, the expert sees a possible shift in the sugar market towards surpluses.       His earnings forecast for Südzucker for 2026 is more than a quarter below consensus./ag/tav/zb

title: Sartorius and subsidiary recover - JPMorgan praises biotech orders
full_text: FRANKFURT (dpa-AFX Broker) - After their recent slide, shares of Sartorius stabilized considerably on Thursday morning. The papers of the laboratory and pharmaceutical supplier recovered by up to 8.6 percent to 276 euros. The day before, at 251.50 euros, they had cost less than at any time since May 2020. Since the forecast reduction last Friday, they had lost almost 22 percent.      Now followed on the penultimate trading day of the week the complete quarterly report. JPMorgan expert Richard Vosser positively assessed the surprisingly good order situation in the Bioprocess Solutions (BPS) division. He expects the share price to recover by 5 to 10 percent - also in the shares of the subsidiary Sartorius Stedim Biotech, under whose umbrella the biotechnology business is largely managed. After plummeting 21 percent in the past few days, these shares had already recovered and recently climbed another 7.8 percent./ag/tav

title: SAP rally significantly - figures 'better than feared'
full_text: FRANKFURT (dpa-AFX Broker) - Shares in SAP rallied almost seven percent to 129.56 euros on Thursday after quarterly figures. They thus jumped above several chart averages pointing the way for the short- to medium-term trend and were among the biggest winners on the Dax. Since the beginning of the year, they have already gained more than a third in value.      The software group sees itself on course to meet its annual targets following significant growth, particularly in the promising cloud business. Reactions on the market were predominantly positive.      Jefferies analyst Charles Brennan commented that the Walldorf-based company had performed better than he had feared. Michael Briest of the major Swiss bank UBS also attested to SAP's "very respectable figures. However, he said that in order to achieve the confirmed annual targets, the company would have to increase cloud revenues by at least a quarter in the final quarter - up from 23 percent in the quarter just ended.       Knut Woller of Baader Bank saw the operating result (Ebit) above expectations thanks to the strong licensing business - only cloud revenues had disappointed a little. With a stock market value of almost 160 billion euros, SAP is by far the most highly valued company in Germany./gl/zb----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: Barclays cuts Südzucker to 'Underweight' - Target to 12 euros
full_text: LONDON (dpa-AFX Broker) - U.K. investment bank Barclays downgraded Südzucker to "underweight" from "equal weight" and cut its price target to 12 euros from 15 euros. The new weight-loss drugs pose a structural threat to food ingredient manufacturers, analyst Alex Sloane wrote in an industry report available Thursday. This is because the increasing public debate about health risks from highly processed foods could further weigh on market expectations for their growth prospects. Therefore, he sees the relevant companies increasingly cautious. Südzucker was still little affected by this due to its low US exposure, but as soon as the weight loss products became more common in Europe as well, this could change./gl/edh      Publication of the original study: 18.10.2023 / 16:19 / GMT First disclosure of the original study: 19.10.2023 / 04:10 / GMT----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: Franchetti, CEO: "We want to grow through internal and external ways"
full_text: (Alliance News) - Following the publication of Franchetti Spa's first-half results, Integrae SIM Spa upgraded its recommendations on the stock, raising its target price to EUR7.20 from EUR7.00, with recommendation unchanged at 'buy' and medium risk. The company also revised its estimates for both the current year and the coming years. Specifically, Integrae SIM has estimated for Franchetti a current-year value of production at EUR6.6 million and Ebitda of EUR2.6 million, corresponding to a margin of 38.9 percent. "We are confident that the targets we are trying to achieve are in line with the forecasts we had communicated, and especially those for the future-looking at a developing market-we expect them to follow our expectations," explained Paolo Franchetti, chairman and CEO of Franchetti Spa, who was met during the Next Gems event at the headquarters of Borsa Italiana in Milan, of which Alliance News is media partner. Despite international uncertainties, the company is not impacted: "Our sector is linked to the security of national transportation networks and prevention, so it escapes international dynamics," Franchetti added. Looking to the future, "We plan to grow through internal and external avenues. We have already equipped ourselves with professional management that has already contributed in the areas where we felt we had a need and to transit the company. For external lines, we managed to get a shortlist and we are working to materialize the first M&A results as soon as possible."  By Claudia Cavaliere, Alliance News reporterComments and questions to redazione@alliancenews.comCopyright 2023 Alliance News IS Italian Service Ltd. All rights reserved.

title: MERCIALYS :  Invest Securities confirms its Buy rating
full_text: Invest Securities maintains its buy rating on Mercialys shares, with an unchanged target price of 11.8 euros. The analyst reports that 9M 2023 operating data (footfall +2%, sales +3.4%) confirm the continuing attractiveness of the assets. Organic rental growth came in at +3.7%, and the good level of rental activity helped to limit the deterioration in occupancy (-50bp), which remains "very satisfactory (96.4%)", according to the broker. According to Invest Securities, in the medium term, the challenge will be to keep pace with the indexation of sales revenues, but we believe that the dynamics of supply and demand will be more decisive.  We do not see any change in the investment strategy. The progress of the investment plan will closely depend on the disposal of mature assets", concludes Invest.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: Freenet at highest level since May after price target increase
full_text: FRANKFURT (dpa-AFX) - Freenet shares climbed to their highest level since May on Wednesday at 23.54 euros. With a price increase of more than three percent, the shares of the telecom company also made it back above the simple 200-day line.      With his new price target of 30 euros, Berenberg analyst Usman Ghazi has even more confidence in the shares than before. "If the optimal case becomes the base scenario," is the title of his analysis.       The shares are likely to continue their above-average run, are enormously valuable and offer good returns. In addition, Ghazi sees possible price drivers in the Telefonica Investor Day at the beginning of November and the abolition of the ancillary cost privilege for cable fees from July 2024./ag/jha/

title: Berenberg raises target for Freenet to 30 euros - 'Buy'.
full_text: HAMBURG (dpa-AFX Broker) - Private bank Berenberg raised its price target for Freenet from 28 to 30 euros and left its rating at "buy". The recent above-average performance of the stock should continue thanks to numerous price drivers, analyst Usman Ghazi wrote in a research note presented on Wednesday. He said the wireless carrier has ample prospects for rising profits, thanks in part to a potential new deal with Telefonica Deutschland and the regulatory push to switch cable customers in Germany to new contracts. The papers also offered a high yield with low leverage./tav/zb  Original study publication date: 17.10.2023 / 16:45 / GMT First disclosure of original study: Date not stated in study / Time not stated in study / Time zone not stated in study

title: UBS leaves Adidas at 'Buy' - Target 210 euros
full_text: ZURICH (dpa-AFX Broker) - Swiss major bank UBS left its rating for Adidas at "Buy" with a price target of 210 euros. The trend at the Herzogenaurach-based company had clearly improved, analyst Zuzanna Pusz wrote on Tuesday evening after the preliminary figures with a more optimistic forecast. Investors could also still consider the lower loss expectation for the full year too high. After all, she said, it still implied a high loss for the fourth quarter despite the positive trend./ag/tih  Publication of the original study: 17.10.2023 / 17:21 / GMT First disclosure of the original study: 17.10.2023 / 17:21 / GMT

title: EUROAPI :  Berenberg reduces its price target
full_text: Berenberg announced on Wednesday that it had reduced its price target for Euroapi from 16.9 to 6.6 euros, while renewing its buy recommendation on the stock.In a research note, the German intermediary explains that it has completely revised its expectations following the profit warning issued on October 9.The company's difficult execution, lack of clear communication and poor visibility had led to a 60% fall in its share price following this announcement", the analyst recalls."We recognize that it will take time for the stock to recover in view of the market's loss of confidence, but we would like to point out that the case is not broken", he assures us in his note.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: TOTALENERGIES :  UBS confirms its buy recommendation
full_text: UBS reiterates its buy recommendation and price target of E71 following the Group's presentation of its key indicators, estimated financial data and items affecting the third quarter of 2023.' TotalEnergies has published its 'Main Indicators' for Q3 23, which are broadly close to consensus expectations in our view, and slightly below those of UBSe ' says the analyst.  We note a fall in gas prices, offset by an increase in refining margins", stresses UBS.The Group reported that hydrocarbon production is expected to be close to 2.5 Mboe/d, benefiting from the start-up of Absheron in Azerbaijan and the effective entry into the Ratawi field (GGIP) in Iraq. The Group also indicated that Downstream results would benefit from higher refining margins in Europe.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: CARMAT :  Oddo BHF slightly reduces its target
full_text: Oddo BHF maintains its 'outperform' rating on Carmat shares, with a price target lowered from 19 to 17 euros, as Carmat announced yesterday morning the completion of a capital increase in favor of historical shareholders. The issue of 1.9 million new shares at a subscription price of 3.6 euros will raise the capital by 7 million euros, and management believes that this operation will extend the company's cash flow horizon to early 2024.In this context, management is taking advantage of this financing to reiterate and confirm its targets, notably the development of sales in Europe and sales of between 4 and 6 million euros for the 2nd half of the year.  On the other hand, management still needs to find new financing sources quickly if it is to achieve its short-term objectives", says the analyst, who is nevertheless convinced of the positioning of Carmat's artificial heart, Aeson®.Oddo BHF believes that the share price could remain under pressure in the short term until financial visibility improves significantly. title: OSE IMMUNO :  Invest Securities confirms its recommendation
full_text: Invest Securities confirms its Buy rating on OSE Immunotherapeutics shares, with an unchanged target price of 8.3 euros. The analyst reports that he has spoken to the CEO about the company's short-term outlook, and that the company does not anticipate any negative impact on its cash burn in 2024, despite the initiation of the Ph III study with Tedopi. Invest Securities reports that the costs of the Ph III study should be "relatively contained", with the company confirming a total amount of around 30ME over 3 years, with a cash burn of 30ME/year which should remain stable.The broker nevertheless anticipates a refinancing requirement before the end of 2024, apart from any partnership signed before this deadline, of around 30ME.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: WENDEL :  Oddo BHF confirms its recommendation on the share
full_text: Wendel announced today that it has entered into exclusive negotiations with a view to acquiring a controlling stake in IK Partners from its partners. The deal is based on 383 ME for the 51%, according to the analyst.Following this announcement, Oddo BHF reiterates its Outperform recommendation, with a price target of 115 E.' The deal will i/ generate additional and regular sources of revenue and profit (target of 150 ME in management fees and 60 ME in pre-tax profit in 2024); ii/ create asset value (by helping the company to grow and thanks to Carried Interest); and iii/ mutualize certain central costs' says Oddo BHF.' IK manages 11.8 MdE on behalf of third parties and has invested in 180 companies since its creation in 1989, its positioning is pan-European small and midcap. The company invests in the business services, healthcare, consumer goods and industrial sectors in the Benelux countries, the DACH (Germany, Austria, Switzerland), France, the Nordic countries and the UK. title: DZ Bank raises Bayer stock to 'Equity Ideas' list - 'Buy
full_text: FRANKFURT (dpa-AFX Broker) - DZ Bank added Bayer shares to its "Equity Ideas" list. The rating was left at "buy" with a fair value of 59 euros. Analyst Peter Spengler expects the new CEO of the pharmaceuticals and agrochemicals group to present his own strategic concept by the next Annual Stockholders' Meeting in April 2024 at the latest. Bill Anderson needs to solve the problems of the risk discount for glyphosate as a result of the class action lawsuits in the U.S. and the valuation discount for the Consumer Health segment, he wrote in a study available Tuesday. In addition, he said, boron stripping of the two segments is conceivable to reduce risk for Bayer shareholders, improve valuation and lower debt./edh/tav      Publication of the original study: 17.10.2023 / 08:56 / CEST First disclosure of the original study: 17.10.2023 / 09:00 / CEST----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------
