title: SODEXO :  Oddo BHF reduces its target with the Pluxee spin-off
full_text: Oddo BHF confirms its 'outperform' rating on Sodexo shares, with a price target reduced from 118 to 113 euros, believing that the Pluxee spin-off (scheduled for 2024) and its rapid rerating offer powerful catalysts for the share price.While Sodexo will publish its FY 23 results on 26/10 before trading, the analyst anticipates 'another year of strong post-pandemic growth'.'We expect 2023e sales of 23,845 ME (consensus 23,723 ME), up 12.9% on a reported basis, of which 11.3% organic (consensus 11.5%), suggesting +8.3%e in Q4', says Oddo BHF. Sodexo is also expected to communicate differentiated 2024 guidance for OSS and Pluxee. At this stage, Oddo BHF expects organic growth of 7.7% for Sodexo over 2024e (consensus 6.3%), including +7.5% for OSS and +12.0% for Pluxee, and an EBIT margin of 5.8% (consensus 5.8%), including 5.0% for OSS and 32.8% for Pluxee.In addition to the catalyst linked to the Pluxee spin-off, which should drive the share's rerating over the coming months, we appreciate Sodexo's defensive profile in the current context, as 55% of its sales are generated in sectors that are not dependent on the macroeconomic context (healthcare, education, etc.)", concludes the broker, who adds that he is "broadly in line with consensus over 2023e, but 3% above on average over 2024e. title: WENDEL  :  Degroof Petercam skeptical about IK Partners rumor
full_text: Degroof Petercam on Monday renewed its 'hold' recommendation on Wendel, with a target price of 100 euros, in reaction to rumors surrounding a possible takeover of private equity firm IK Partners.According to Bloomberg, Wendel has its eye on this company, which operates in Benelux, the DACH region (Germany, Austria, Switzerland), France, the Nordic countries and the UK.Since its creation in 1989, IK has raised over €14 billion and invested in some 180 European companies.In its note, Degroof Petercam recalls that IK Partners was valued at around $1.5 billion last year, at the time of its planned IPO.While it believes that Wendel has the resources to complete such an acquisition following the sale of Constantia Flexibles, the analyst nevertheless feels that this is not a buoyant market segment, as evidenced by the current stock market difficulties of players such as Eurazeo, Tikehau Capital and GBL.Wendel is known for its investments in companies such as Stahl and Constantia Flexibles, and we believe that the company performs better in this segment," concludes the intermediary.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: ALD :  Deutsche Bank lowers price target
full_text: Deutsche Bank announced on Monday that it had lowered its target price for ALD shares from €16 to €12, while reiterating its buy recommendation.In a note published early this morning, the broker hails the resilience of the business of Société Générale's car rental subsidiary, which it nevertheless considers to be "undervalued" by the market.While it also highlights the company's solid credit rating, as well as its ability to continue raising funds at attractive interest rates, the broker explains that it has revised its estimates following the new targets communicated last month by the fleet manager's management.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: Hauck Aufhäuser IB upgrades MTU to 'Buy' - Target 196 euros
full_text: HAMBURG (dpa-AFX Broker) - Hauck Aufhäuser Investment Banking has upgraded MTU from "Hold" to "Buy", but lowered the price target from 198 to 196 euros. Analyst Jorge Gonzalez Sadornil justified the buy recommendation on Monday with the immense upside potential to his adjusted price target. In the interim report, all eyes are likely to be on the course and consequences of the engine recall in which MTU is involved. With regard to its annual targets, however, MTU remains on course./ag/tih  Publication of the original study: 16.10.2023 / 08:22 / CEST First disclosure of the original study: 16.10.2023 / 08:22 / CEST----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: JPMorgan upgrades Salzgitter to 'Neutral' and target to 27.60 euros
full_text: NEW YORK (dpa-AFX Broker) - U.S. bank JPMorgan upgraded Salzgitter AG to "Neutral" from "Underweight" and raised its price target to 27.60 euros from 17.60 euros. With steel prices under pressure in the short term due to higher imports and weaker demand, potential capacity cuts in the European steel sector are likely to remain in focus, analyst Moses Ola wrote in an industry report released Monday. He justified his new investment rating on Salzgitter by pointing out that the company is relatively dependent on European spot prices, which could accelerate short-term positive earnings momentum in the event of an upturn./edh/ag  Publication of the original study: 15.10.2023 / 21:30 / BST First disclosure of the original study: 16.10.2023 / 00:15 / BST

title: Heidelberg Materials still strong - Testing consolidation trend
full_text: FRANKFURT (dpa-AFX Broker) - Shares of Heidelberg Materials attempted a chart breakout on Friday even in a weak market. The papers of the building materials group gained almost 2 percent to 75.06 euros. This put them razor-thinly above the consolidation trend since the annual high of almost 78 euros in mid-August.       Analyst Pierre de Fraguier of Goldman Sachs was optimistic in his latest outlook for the quarterly report at the beginning of November. He expects a solid performance and raised his estimates for 2023 above market expectations and company targets. There is therefore room for a further forecast increase, said de Fraguier.       The Goldman expert increased his price target to 96 euros - to the interim high from 2018./ag/men----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: HSBC recommendation does not help Zalando above 21-day line
full_text: FRANKFURT (dpa-AFX Broker) - In a weak market environment, the initial momentum of an HSBC recommendation fizzled out for Zalando on Friday. The papers of the fashion online retailer still climbed by more than three percent to 22.45 euros in early trading. By midday, however, almost nothing remained of this, while the Dax lost almost one percent. The 21-day line continues to hold back a further recovery of the weakest index value of the current year.      Yet analyst Paul Rossington, with his price target of 28 euros, still has some confidence in them. In the meantime, the papers have priced in weaker gross merchandise volume (GMV) in the third quarter due to the weather - with typically better prospects for the fourth quarter of the year. Rossington remains optimistic about earnings performance overall and raised his estimates.      Zalando share certificates had once cost nearly 46 euros in February, before sliding 40 percent year-to-date at a little less than 20 euros in early October./ag/stk----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: Profit warning weighs heavily on Sartorius and subsidiary Stedim
full_text: FRANKFURT (dpa-AFX) - A renewed lowering of annual targets caused the pharmaceutical and laboratory equipment supplier Sartorius and its French subsidiary Sartorius Stedim Biotech to suffer a slump in share prices on Friday. Analysts had already feared a profit warning, but also pointed to the announced review of the company's medium-term targets. Richard Vosser of U.S. bank JPMorgan now expects consensus estimates to drop significantly not only for 2023, but also for the coming years.      Sartorius shares slipped 15 percent at the bottom of the Dax to a low since mid-2020 and were still down 11.7 percent to 284 euros at midday. Sartorius Stedim Biotech was down 15.7 percent at 189.55 euros, having at times been as cheap as they were last in April 2020. This dragged down the entire medical sector, with the European sector index, which had recently recovered, losing 1.3 percent.      The year-to-date performance of both stocks is also dismal. While Sartorius has lost around 23 percent, making it one of the weakest stocks in Germany's leading index, the subsidiary's share price has fallen by a good 37 percent. Compared to their record highs in the fall of 2021, Sartorius and Sartorius Stedim Biotech have lost more than half and almost two-thirds of their value, respectively.      With the publication of key data for the third quarter, it became known that Sartorius now expects sales revenue to decline by about 17 percent in 2023. Previously, the company had spoken of a decline "in the low to mid-teens percent range." For the operating Ebitda margin (earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization), Sartorius now expects to achieve slightly more than 28 percent, down from the previous figure of around 30 percent, which also means a more significant decline compared with the previous year's figure.      Sartorius expects to achieve profitable growth in 2024. However, investors will not know more details until January. However, the company also said that its medium-term targets are currently being reviewed and that an update will also be communicated at the beginning of next year.      JPMorgan expert Vosser saw the sales and even more so the operating profit development of both companies in the third quarter clearly below expectations. The same applies to the new annual outlook. Oliver Metzger of the investment bank Oddo BHF attested that Sartorius had a very weak third quarter and considered its medium-term targets to be too ambitious. At the same time, the share is still expensive, added Warburg analyst Michael Heider.      Some experts, however, already see light at the end of the tunnel. After the recent cautious comments by Sartorius and industry peers, the reduced annual targets do not come as a big surprise to him, wrote Odysseas Manesiotis of the private bank Berenberg. Investors should seize the slump in the share price as an opportunity to enter the market.      James Vane-Tempest of the U.S. analyst firm Jefferies predicts some fluctuations in Sartorius shares until the trends stabilize again and there is more clarity. However, he emphasized that the medium- to long-term growth trends in the industry are intact./gl/ag/stk

title: ALSTOM :  Oddo BHF confirms its recommendation on the stock
full_text: Oddo BHF confirms its 'outperform' rating on Alstom shares, with an unchanged target price of 32 euros. The research firm reports that Moody's has confirmed its Baa3 rating on Alstom, but with its outlook lowered to negative, reflecting Alstom's very limited room for maneuver in the Baa3 category.Moody's points in particular to 'weak credit metrics', impacted by the negative FCF expected in H1 and revised FCF forecasts for FY23/24, which are expected to be negative in the range of -500 ME to -750 ME (versus slightly positive in the previous estimate). Oddo BHF understands that Moody's seems prepared to give Alstom a few more months to restore its balance sheet, provided that the latter rapidly proceeds with disposals (Chinese JVs, US freight signaling business, etc.). Given the current pressure on Alstom (notably on the stock market, and now on credit), Oddo BHF expects the Group to react quickly and present a plan to strengthen its balance sheet. In addition to possible disposals, the Group could consider other measures (entry of a long-term shareholder, convertible bonds, etc.).' A capital increase, given the current share price, does not seem the most likely option in the short term', concludes the analyst. Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: PUBLICIS :  Oddo BHF raises its target price
full_text: Oddo BHF confirms its 'neutral' rating on Publicis shares, with a price target raised from 75 to 77 euros. The research firm believes that the 4th quarter should remain "dynamic", with Publicis continuing to benefit from its 2022/23 contract wins at Publicis Media and Epsilon, and with its cost base under control.In this context, Oddo BHF has raised its expectations for 2023, with organic growth expected at 6% versus +5.6% previously, which is at the top end of the Group's guidance range (between +5.5% and 6%). The broker thus anticipates growth of 4.8% in Q4, and estimates that the operating margin should reach 18.1% over the full 2023 financial year. title: HERMES :  Goldman Sachs reiterates its recommendation
full_text: The analyst expects a significant deceleration in momentum in Q3 2023 (+12% compared with +28% in Q2), which has also been confirmed by LVMH.He believes that the US should also slow down at Hermes during this period, but expects growth to outpace that of its peers on average.' Following LVMH's comments regarding a deterioration in European spending, we are reducing our growth forecast for Q4 2023 to +14% (from +15%) ' says Goldman Sachs. The analyst confirms his sell recommendation on the stock, with a price target of E1480. Hermès has an EV/EBIT of 28x in 2024E, compared with an average of 17x, stresses the research firm.' A premium to the sector is justified, in our view, given Hermès' more defensive business profile and best-in-class operating margins, but we see more opportunities on other luxury stocks when comparing growth-adjusted revenues valuation indicators (e.g. Richemont, LVMH) ' adds the analyst. title: Rheinmetall continue recovery - testing consolidation trend
full_text: FRANKFURT (dpa-AFX Broker) - Shares in Rheinmetall continued their recovery on Thursday. With the Middle East conflict heating up, the weekly gain is now almost 14 percent and at 265.80 euros they are testing the flat consolidation trend since the April record at just over 281 euros. Hensoldt also gained 14 percent over the week, but are still further from their high.      Analyst Daniela Costa of Goldman Sachs raised her earnings estimates for Rheinmetall for 2023 and 2024 after looking a bit more closely at Germany's defense plans ahead of the quarterly report. The planned defense budget would be a massive step forward - and Rheinmetall would double its share of it.       Costa sees both the quarterly report and the Capital Markets Day in November as possible share price drivers./ag/zb----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: Stabilus turns up after weak start - praise for US acquisition
full_text: FRANKFURT (dpa-AFX Broker) - Shares in Stabilus turned up on Thursday after a weak start. With a recent price gain of 6.8 percent, they not only conquered the MDax top, but also jumped above the 100-day line, which is important for the longer-term trend, and reached the highest level since June.      The fact that the automotive supplier expects the acquisition of the American industrial automation specialist Destaco to make a positive contribution to operating earnings from the outset and does not need to raise capital for this is positive, traders wrote.       JPMorgan analyst Akshat Kacker spoke of a "transformative acquisition" that was an important step in the implementation of the company's long-term strategy./gl/stk----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: RÉMY COINTREAU :  Stifel remains Buy, reduces its target
full_text: Stifel maintains its 'buy' recommendation on Rémy Cointreau, but with a price target reduced from 187 to 150 euros, expecting the wine and spirits house to lower its targets at its October 27 trading update."Cognac faces strong short-term challenges in the US", notes the broker, pointing in particular to weaker demand and promotional intensity in the lower categories, and sees a long-awaited recovery "probably postponed until 2024".We continue to value the strong exposure to the highly profitable and oligopolistic cognac category", says Stifel, which also believes that "the earnings potential of the smaller liqueurs and spirits division is underestimated".Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: LVMH: punished for disappointing growth
full_text: LVMH is down nearly 6%, making it the red lantern of the CAC40, the day after the world's number one luxury goods group published its activity report, which showed a slowdown in organic sales growth to +9% in the third quarter of 2023.Although it considers the disappointment to be "limited, excluding the currency effect and Cognac destocking", which it believes account for the bulk of the gap with expectations, Oddo BHF is lowering its EBIT estimates for 2023-25 by around 2% and adjusting its target price from €841 to €831.Nevertheless, the research firm remains 'outperform' on LVMH, which 'still seems capable of delivering EBIT growth close to +10% per annum over the medium term, and probably above the sector average'.Also maintaining a 'buy' recommendation on the share, UBS has reduced its target price from 837 to 829.4 euros, seeing in the publication confirmation of 'a rapid normalization of trends and limited short-term visibility in luxury goods'.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. All rights reserved.

title: LVMH :  Stifel confirms its recommendation following quarterly results
full_text: Following the announcement of Q3 2023 figures, Stifel confirms its buy recommendation on the stock, with a target of E850.Organic sales growth for LVMH's Fashion & Leather Goods business slowed sequentially to +9% in Q3 2023, a figure slightly below Stifel's +10% estimate.' LVMH achieved organic growth of +9%, 3 points below consensus ' says the analyst.' We observed broadly stable sequential trends in the United States (still weak) and Japan (still strong), but a greater-than-expected sequential deceleration in Asia ex-Japan and Europe' says Stifel.The analyst believes that Asia-Pacific slowed more than expected, to +11% in the third quarter compared with +34% in the second quarter, reflecting a more difficult situation.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: HERMÈS :  Oddo BHF slightly reduces its target
full_text: Oddo BHF maintains its 'neutral' rating on Hermès International shares, with a price target reduced from 1967 to 1953 euros. According to the analyst, Hermès' growth in Q3 should remain strong, with sales expected to rise by 11% to 13% at constant exchange rates. However, the stock's high valuation reduces its defensive appeal, the broker points out. For Q4, Oddo BHF is moderately lowering its growth forecast, from 12.5% to 11.5%, thus remaining well below the most recent consensus (Visible Alpha expects a little over 15%). For the full year, Oddo BHF is also lowering its expectations, with growth of +10.6%, compared with 11.8% in the previous estimate. The analyst also reduces its EBIT forecasts for 2024 and 2025 by 1%.  We have no doubts about the franchise's intrinsic qualities, but persist in thinking that its current valuation relative to other stocks in the sector tends to somewhat overplay its resilience in a slowdown phase", concludes Oddo BHF. full_text: NEW YORK (dpa-AFX Broker) - Canadian bank RBC cut its price target for Zalando to 44 euros from 50 euros, but kept its rating at "outperform." title: VISIATIV :  Invest Securities adjusts its target
full_text: Invest Securities reiterates its 'neutral' opinion on Visiativ, with an adjusted target price of €28 to €27, the day after the announcement of the acquisition of 1Life, which is 'fully in line with the Shift 5 plan strategy'.'The operation also enables the company to become an integrator for a new software publisher (in this case Open-Prod), thus slightly reducing its dependence on Dassault Systèmes', the research firm acknowledges.  However, the target is not very profitable, and the transaction is likely to fuel criticism of Visiativ's low short-term profitability and high debt levels', it warns, pointing to 'a context of rising interest rates and a worsening macro environment'.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: MAISONS DU MONDE :  Oddo BHF significantly reduces its target price
full_text: Oddo BHF maintains its 'neutral' recommendation on Maisons du Monde shares, with a price target reduced from 12 to 6.5 euros. In a press release published yesterday evening after the close of trading, the Maisons du Monde group indicated that Q3 sales had been disappointing.As a result, the group has lowered its expectations for the year as a whole, and is now forecasting a 10% drop in sales, so that Q4 should remain under pressure (around -10%). In terms of EBIT, while the initial guidance was based on a range of between €65m and €75m, this is now €40m to €50m. For its part, Oddo BHF is once again revising its EBIT expectations downwards by 30% (EPS 2023e: -47.6%) and indicates that 'new measures and a transformation plan are expected in the first quarter of 2024'.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: SFPI GROUP  :  A difficult H1-2023
full_text:
A difficult H1-2023EARNINGS/SALES RELEASESThe building-related activities (DOM & MAC) could not escape a sudden softening in the market even though they enjoy the nominal steadiness of renovation markets. The industry-related activities shone but accounted for less than 30% of revenues. The management is worried about H2 and slashed its sales guidance to €680m which now looks like a floor. We have cut our 2023 earning forecast by c.30%. FACTStrong organic sales (up 7.5%) were accompanied by a 200bp drop in the operating margin to 3.9% and a contraction in net earnings to €6.6m from €11m. 
With a still-demanding working capital requirement, the net cash situation (as per the SFPI definition) was down to €11.4m vs. €25.5m a year earlier. The balance sheet remains extremely sound with net cash expected to improve as excess inventories are run down.ANALYSISThe H1 earnings were not expected to be good as European building markets have hit the buffers of fast rising rates. Building is always the first to be impacted. Industry is unlikely to escape a degree of slowdown somewhat later. For 2023, SFPI’s industrial units are doing remarkably well in meeting the solid demand with a lean industrial base.
The negative surprise was the drop in the gross margin to 57.1% from 58.8%. This came from the building side and confirmed that demand has become price sensitive. With the renovation markets accounting for 80%-90% of revenues, MAC (mostly windows and doors) sales were somewhat cushioned  but it is reasonable to expect that this segment will tank as well at a later stage
Solid cost control at the payroll level was sadly not enough to offset the extra layers of miscellaneous costs including the in-depth reorganisation of the industrial bases of MAC. This was well flagged when SFPI released its 2022FY accounts thus should be regarded as costs incurred for a good cause.
The Industrial units were the H1 positive with MMD posting sales up 37% and Neu-JFK up 11.5%. There is no shortage of demand for heat exchangers and air treatment but these are businesses where order books are not very long so that the more than 6 months of business ahead is great to have. 
As with many other manufacturing businesses, SFPI has had to face a supply scarcity in the post-Covid recovery period. Building up inventories was unavoidable and presumably at higher costs than the going prices. This shows up in an increase of working capital requirement of c. €10m yoy but was contained to €2m vs. the close of 2022. After allowing for dividends and acquisitions in the H1, the gross cash position remains very healthy at €117m. This is largely due to strong cash from operations (€21m)IMPACTThe ever-cautious SFPI has slashed its sales guidance from €715m to €680m – a strong statement about the changing visibility. We see €680m as a floor that we have not adopted for our reduced forecast with sales resetting at €695m. Pressuring sales down further would probably imply a collapse of profits. On sales at €695m, our earnings forecasts reset 30% lower for 2023 and c.8% to 10% lower for the following 2 years. This does not change our target price that much (provided that the dividend does not take a hit). The news flow is however unlikely to be positive for the next few quarters.

title: SFPI GROUP  :  Difficult H1-2023 and more cautious about H2
full_text: Difficult H1-2023 and more cautious about H2EPS CHANGECHANGE IN TARGET PRICE€ 3.86 vs 3.99 -3.28%The H1-2023 could not hide a slowdown in volume from Building-related (renovation mostly) businesses. Price hikes are now a thing of the past while input prices remain elevated. Volumes are down. Conversely the two 'industrial' units catering to BtoB business are doing well to very well. Now allowing for lesser ambitions for 2023, our TP is down marginally leaving considerable upside potential.CHANGE IN EPS2023 : € 0.21 vs 0.30 -30.8%2024 : € 0.31 vs 0.33 -6.58%On the back of a weak H1 and lowered FY 2023 sales guidance from €715m to €680m, our 2023 earnings have been slashed by 30%. SFPI is battling with an eroding gross margin as high input costs cannot be immediately offset in current pricing. 2024 should see an end to margin pressure with earnings essentially unchanged.CHANGE IN DCF€ 3.36 vs 3.64 -7.66%The DCF has mechanically suffered from lower expected gross margins. Capex may be adjusted down later on, depending on economic developments. SFPI is keeping a close eye on its net cash position.

title: EIFFAGE :  Stifel lowers its target price
full_text: Stifel maintains its 'hold' rating on Eiffage shares, with a price target reduced from 111.5 to 102.5 euros. With Eiffage due to publish its quarterly results on November 8, the analyst expects trends in the second quarter of 2023 to continue.For fiscal 2023, the brokerage slightly increases its sales estimates by +1.1% to 21.8 billion euros (+1.0% vs. consensus), and its current operating profit estimate by +1.1% to 2,396 million euros (+1.1% vs. consensus), implying a stable margin. Nevertheless, Stifel feels that the stock looks 'oversold and cheap', which is not without reason, the analyst pointing in particular to the high level of bond yields and also questioning the long-term strategy. title: Deutsche Bank Research lowers target for Puma to 70 euros - 'Buy'.
full_text: FRANKFURT (dpa-AFX Broker) - Deutsche Bank Research cut its price target for Puma SE to 70 euros from 80 euros, but kept its rating at "buy." While investors have been very disappointed with the sporting goods maker's near-term outlook, Puma has maintained its full-year revenue and operating profit (Ebit) targets, analyst Adam Cochrane wrote in a research note Monday. However, he cut his Ebit forecasts for 2023 and 2024 by 6 and 7 percent, respectively, due to negative currency effects./edh/gl      Publication of the original study: 09.10.2023 / Time not specified in study / CET First disclosure of the original study: 09.10.2023 / 06:58 / CET----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: Hauck Aufhäuser IB upgrades Hugo Boss to 'Buy' - Target 72 euros
full_text: HAMBURG (dpa-AFX Broker) - Hauck Aufhäuser Investment Banking upgraded Hugo Boss from "hold" to "buy" and left its price target at 72 euros. The recent significant decline in the share price was exaggerated, analyst Christian Salis justified his buy recommendation in a study presented on Monday. Boss is expected to report positive third-quarter results, which should underpin the fashion group's relative strength and market share gains due to its dynamic brand renewal. He expects double-digit percentage growth and higher profitability./edh/la  Publication of the original study: 09.10.2023 / 08:10 / CEST First disclosure of the original study: 09.10.2023 / 08:10 / CEST----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: Armaments and oil in demand after Middle East terror - tourism weak
full_text: FRANKFURT (dpa-AFX) - The dramatically heated Middle East conflict left clear traces on some individual stocks on Monday morning. Thus, the arms shares of Rheinmetall and Hensoldt jumped in part double-digit upward. They thus recovered more than half of their correction from the September high. Oil stocks also performed strongly. "The flare-up of conflict in the Middle East has caught the financial markets on the wrong foot. Above all, fears of a disruption in the supply of crude from Iran are going around," said market analyst Christian Henke of online broker IG.      Significantly downward it went meanwhile for papers of airlines such as Lufthansa or for the share certificates of the tourism company Tui. The entire travel and leisure sector is under pressure. Lufthansa reduced its flight program to and from Tel Aviv.       Over the weekend, Hamas terrorists attacked Israel. The Israeli Air Force responds with attacks on Hamas targets in the Gaza Strip./ag/stk

title: ORANGE :  Oddo BHF remains positive ahead of business update
full_text: Oddo BHF reaffirms its 'outperform' rating and 12 euro price target on Orange ahead of the telecom operator's business update, expecting 'some improvement in the third quarter of 2023', but warning that 'OBS and wholesale still weigh'The research firm forecasts organic sales growth of 2.2% in the third quarter of 2023 to 1,147 million euros, still driven by Africa (+12% on a comparable basis) and Europe excluding France (Poland, Spain).Oddo BHF remains 'cautious on the corporate business, despite the new management in place which has launched an in-depth restructuring', but believes that the 2023 targets (1.1% EBITDAaL growth, FCF to 3.5 billion euros) should be confirmed.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: Berenberg lowers target for BASF to 45 euros - 'Hold'
full_text: HAMBURG (dpa-AFX Broker) - Private bank Berenberg cut its price target for BASF to 45 euros from 50 euros, but kept its rating at "hold." The chemical company is likely to lower its operating profit forecast this year within the next two weeks, analyst Sebastian Bray wrote in a research note Monday. The widespread admission of weak volumes in industrial chemicals and the lackluster performance of sector stocks in recent weeks suggest this is no secret. Dividend yields are high, he said, but dividends not covered by earnings are not a reason to hold cyclical stocks./la/edh      Publication of the original study: 06.10.2023 / 17:05 / GMT First disclosure of the original study: Date not specified in study / Time not specified in study / Time zone not specified in study----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: Barclays Commences Sartorius with 'Equal Weight' - Target 320 Euros
full_text: LONDON (dpa-AFX Broker) - U.K.-based investment bank Barclays has initiated its rating on Sartorius with an "Equal Weight" rating and a target price of 320 euros. There is little sign that headwinds in the life sciences segment will ease soon, analyst Charles Pitman wrote in an industry report Monday. He said customer destocking, lack of transparency, inadequate financing and competition from China are weighing on market expectations and thus valuations. However, shares of pharmaceutical and laboratory equipment maker Sartorius could recover if the ratio of order intake to sales revenue improved again in the third quarter./la/edh       Publication of the original study: 06.10.2023 / 17:43 / GMT First dissemination of the original study: 09.10.2023 / 04:10 / GMT----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: JPMorgan lowers target for Lanxess to 26 euros - 'Neutral'
full_text: NEW YORK (dpa-AFX Broker) - U.S. bank JPMorgan cut its price target for Lanxess to 26 euros from 32 euros, but kept its rating at "neutral." However, the third quarter is likely to have been tough again for the specialty chemicals group and most of its peers, analyst Chetan Udeshi wrote in a research note issued Monday. As a result, he cut his estimates for adjusted operating profit (Ebitda) and even more significantly for cash flow (FCF). In the final quarter, however, Lanxess should achieve adjusted Ebitda at the level of the third quarter, contrary to the usual seasonality, thanks to one-time savings effects./gl/edh      Publication of the original study: 08.10.2023 / 21:06 / BST First transmission of the original study: 09.10.2023 / 00:15 / BST----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: Scor: share price up, broker confirms its recommendation
full_text: Scor gains nearly 1.5% on the Paris stock exchange, as UBS reiterates its buy recommendation on the stock with a price target of E36.40.The analyst believes that the use of call options promotes corporate governance.' Scor is using 57% of its call option as part of an operation aimed at improving corporate governance' stresses the analyst firm.Scor announced yesterday the acquisition of nine million of its own shares, representing 5.01% of its capital, through the partial exercise of the call option granted by Covéa, and their subsequent sale to BNP Paribas Cardif, as part of an off-market transaction.Covéa has granted the reinsurer a firm and irrevocable call option on its entire stake in Scor - i.e. 8.8% of the capital - at a price of 28 euros per share.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: JPMorgan leaves Puma at 'Neutral' - Target 56 euros
full_text: NEW YORK (dpa-AFX Broker) - U.S. bank JPMorgan left its rating on Puma SE at "Neutral" with a price target of 56 euros ahead of third-quarter figures. Analyst Olivia Townsend updated her estimates for the sporting goods group in a research note issued Friday, based in part on recent industry insights. She continues to see more upside to market estimates for rival Adidas./tih/edh  Publication of the original study: 05.10.2023 / 21:26 / BST First disclosure of the original study: 06.10.2023 / 00:15 / BST----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: Deutsche Bank Research leaves SMA Solar at 'Hold'.
full_text: FRANKFURT (dpa-AFX Broker) - Deutsche Bank Research left its rating on SMA Solar at "Hold" with a price target of 85 euros after raising its forecast. Even though the solar group has set its targets higher for the third time this year, investors should not get too excited, analyst Mengxian Sun warned in a research note presented on Thursday. Since orders were probably processed faster in the past quarter, it could only be a case of bringing forward sales and profits from the subsequent quarters into the third quarter of the year. In the current year, that could have a positive impact on profits but dampen the outlook for 2024./tav/la  Publication of the original study: Date not stated in study / Time not stated in study / CET First disclosure of original study: 05.10.2023 / 06:45 / CET----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: Puma slide double digits - earnings worries in nervous market
full_text: FRANKFURT (dpa-AFX Broker) - In a battered market environment, shares of Puma slipped double digits at times on Thursday. They fell to their lowest level since mid-July. Most recently, the bills were quoted 8.5 percent lower at 54.54 euros. Next Monday marks the start of the black-out period, during which the Group will cease its financial communications with market participants ahead of its quarterly report at the end of October. Borsians are now worried that Puma will dampen expectations in final analyst rounds.       However, Puma has now once again announced that it is fully on track to meet its annual targets. However, this did not provide lasting relief, and the slight price recovery quickly collapsed again.      In mid-July, Puma had already confirmed its annual targets. In the meantime, however, there have been some negative signals from fashion retailers, for example, regarding September business. Adidas shares lost up to 4.6 percent to a low since the beginning of June.      Analyst Piral Dadhania of Canadian investment bank RBC sees the upper end of Puma's annual targets "probably out of reach," according to a recent outlook. However, he remains optimistic about 2024./ag/ngu

title: ACCOR :  Stifel confirms its Buy rating on the stock
full_text: Stifel maintains its Buy rating on Accor shares, with an unchanged target price of 41 euros. Accor has announced the issue of a new €500 million hybrid bond, to be used to redeem its existing €500 million hybrid bond dated January 24, paving the way for a share buyback program of over €400 million, according to Stifel.  We expect the third quarter to be another solid one, leading to further increases in forecasts", stresses the analyst, who believes that "the share's recent weakness is uncorrelated with the positive earnings momentum, and rather reflects macroeconomic concerns for next year". In this respect, Stifel believes that expectations for 2024 do not seem particularly high. Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: ALSTOM :  Stifel confirms its recommendation on the stock
full_text: Stifel confirms its recommendation to Hold and its price target of E22 following the downward revision of its outlook.The analyst points out that the group has published preliminary results for the 1st half which do not match Visible Alpha's (VAe) estimates for orders, sales and margins, but worse still, they reported an outflow of free cash flow of -1,150 ME against VAe's -152 ME.' According to the company, around half of the capital outflow is linked to a sharp increase in inventories that was not followed by an equally sharp increase in production. A further 30% of capital outflows are explained by delays in the UK Aventra program, while the remainder is explained by lower-than-expected order intake' says Stifel. For the year as a whole, the company now expects an improvement in FCF to -500/-700 million, compared with a VAe of 313 ME.Stifel also points out that sales amounted to 8.3 MdE, or -2.4% below a VAe of around 8.5 MdE, while orders of 8.4 MdE were -8.7% below the VAe of around 9.2 MdE. title: VIVENDI :  Oddo BHF lowers its target slightly
full_text: Oddo BHF maintains its 'outperform' rating on Vivendi shares, with a price target lowered from 13.8 to 13.5 euros. While Vivendi will publish its quarterly results on October 19, the analyst anticipates slight group-wide sales growth for Q3 (+1.3%), after +4.2% in Q2 and +3.3% in Q1.We don't expect any strategic changes on the back of these results", says Oddo BHF, which does, however, point out that its 2023 EPS has been "adjusted slightly downwards", due to an update in Multichoice's results. The analyst believes it will be interesting to follow the company's message on a possible disposal of its UMG shares (10% of the capital) and possibly a resumption of share buybacks."Even if it still seems to us that Bolloré should ultimately increase its exposure to Vivendi, we do not expect any decision in the very short term", adds the broker. title: KERING :  Oddo BHF reduces its price target
full_text: While reiterating its 'neutral' opinion on Kering, Oddo BHF has reduced its price target from €498 to €463, in the wake of a lowering of its earnings forecasts for the luxury group, for which it sees 'really difficult times ahead'.'On the basis of our new forecasts, the stock reflects an average multiple discount of around 30% to the LVMH sector benchmark, which is not out of the ordinary over the recent period', the analyst believes.In view of the turnaround at Gucci, which may require a more radical overhaul, and the unflattering trend for the Group's other brands as the market slows down, it seems early to expect this discount to come down.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: ALSTOM :  price target lowered by Oddo BHF
full_text: Oddo BHF reaffirms its 'outperform' rating on Alstom, with an adjusted price target of €34 to €32, the day after the company's preliminary half-year results fell well short of expectations in terms of FCF, which was strongly negative at €-1.15 billion.The Group has lowered its 2023/24 FCF target and now expects FCF to be between -500 and -750 million euros, compared with 'significantly positive' previously (consensus +313 million)", the analyst points out.We have to admit that this is a major warning, that it's not the first, and that it doesn't help our confidence in the Group's ability to generate FCF over the long term", says Oddo BHF, which now expects FCF for 2023/24 to be -616 million.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: WORLDLINE :  Invest Securities remains Buy, reduces its target
full_text: Invest Securities reaffirms its 'buy' recommendation on Worldline, while reducing its target price from 56 to 46 euros, adopting a more cautious scenario for 2024-25 and integrating the new interest rate paradigm into its DCF valuation.'Unlike other companies on which we have concerns about the end of the year, Worldline should achieve the lower end of its 2023 targets, with a third quarter in line with the first half', it judges. While the potential relative to its new price target remains 'extremely significant (+85%)', the analyst 'is unable to identify any catalysts that could trigger a rerating, as the sector in Europe arouses total indifference on the part of investors'.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: JPMorgan lowers target for Auto1 to 9.70 euros - 'Overweight'
full_text: NEW YORK (dpa-AFX Broker) - U.S. bank JPMorgan cut its price target for Auto1  to 9.70 euros from 9.90 euros ahead of third-quarter figures, but left its rating at "Overweight." Analyst Marcus Diebel expects the online used car dealer to stay on track with its profitability improvements. However, the focus will remain on the development of traded vehicles until the end of the year, he wrote in a study presented on Thursday. For the third quarter, he viewed this metric with caution./tih/edh  Publication of the original study: 05.10.2023 / 03:52 / BST First disclosure of original study: 05.10.2023 / 04:15 / BST----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: ESSILORLUXOTTICA :  Stifel confirms its recommendation on the stock
full_text: Stifel maintains its Buy recommendation on EssilorLuxottica shares, with an unchanged target price of 210 euros. Although EssilorLux is not immune to the ups and downs of the global macro-economic environment, Stifel believes that the company should have limited the damage - the first indications are expected on October 19, the day of the publication of 3rd quarter sales figures. After +8% in Q2, Stifel expects organic growth of 4.8% in Q3 (consensus is +5.4%). The analyst cites moderate growth in North America (+1% in Q3, after +2% in Q2) and more dynamic activity expected in Europe (+8.5%), Latin America (+12%) and Asia-Pacific (+5%).  We believe the mix will remain solid, driven by recent launches (Varilux XR, Ray-ban Reverse...) and by the continued strength of Stellest (myopia) lenses in China", concludes the broker, who adds that Ray-Ban Meta lenses are expected to hit the shelves in mid-October.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: AIR FRANCE-KLM :  Oddo BHF remains 'neutral' on the stock
full_text: Oddo BHF maintains its 'neutral' rating on Air France-KLM shares, with an unchanged target price of 17.5 euros. As a reminder, the company announced yesterday that it had been selected from a consortium as the winning candidate in the financing solicitation process launched by SAS.Air France-KLM's investment would amount to $144.5 million, of which $109.5 million in ordinary shares and $35 million in secured convertible bonds. In all, the consortium and the Danish government would invest $1.175 billion, of which $475 million in shares and $700 million in convertible bonds. On completion of the transaction, AFKL would hold a minority stake of up to 19.9% in SAS.  While it is still difficult to quantify the benefits of such an agreement, we feel that the investment is limited (1.8% of gross cash at the end of June) to obtain a stake in a strong brand that will have been able to upgrade its cost base by going through the Chapter 11 process', analyzes Oddo BHF. The analyst is now waiting for the Investor Day scheduled for November 7 to initiate a possible rerating of the share. In the meantime, the analyst continues to prefer Ryanair in the sector. full_text: ZURICH (dpa-AFX Broker) - Major Swiss bank UBS downgraded Zalando to "Neutral" from "Buy" and lowered its price target to 26.50 euros from 48 euros. title: Eramet: share price shrinks, broker lowers target
full_text: Eramet is down more than 3% in Paris, as Oddo BHF this morning cut its target for the stock from 91 to 89 euros, with its 'neutral' opinion unchanged. The analyst points out that while major mining groups (Rio Tinto, BHP, Anglo American) are currently benefiting from high copper and especially iron prices, "this is not the case for Eramet, which is mainly exposed to manganese and nickel".While Eramet will publish its Q3 sales on October 26, Oddo BHF expects sales of ME899 (excluding ETI sold on September 21), down 29% year-on-year due to the fall in raw materials prices.Oddo BHF has nonetheless revised its 2023 forecasts slightly upwards to incorporate a slightly more optimistic scenario for nickel, with the recent rise in ore prices and higher production figures for SLN.On the other hand, 'beyond 2023, we have revised our forecasts downwards quite drastically (-28% on average) to incorporate the fall in manganese and especially lithium prices', concludes the analyst. title: Barclays upgrades Nemetschek - opportunities and risks now more balanced
full_text: LONDON (dpa-AFX) - After share price losses in the third quarter, the British investment bank Barclays sees several European software and IT stocks supported by increasingly attractive valuations. According to analyst James Goodman, this is particularly true for measurement technology and geoanalytics specialist Hexagon and construction software provider Nemetschek.      However, the earnings potential for the majority of the shares is limited in view of the continuing difficult economic environment, according to a sector study published on Tuesday. Therefore, Goodman only upgraded the two shares from "Underweight" to "Equal Weight". He left the price targets at 100 Swedish kronor and 60 euros, respectively. He thus grants Nemetschek a potential of around two percent based on Monday's closing price - which the share exploited on Tuesday.      After a decent first half of the year, rising interest rates and the fading hype surrounding artificial intelligence (AI) have weighed on technology stocks worldwide, Goodman explained. Hexagon was the worst hit in Europe, but Dassault, Nemetschek and Amadeus also saw double-digit percentage declines.      At Nemetschek, the analyst now noted a more resistant market environment. The headwind from the second quarter, caused for example by orders being brought forward, should no longer have such a strong impact on the third quarter, which Nemetschek will report on October 26.      Goodman does expect another weak quarter. But the expected acceleration of growth in the final quarter and the outlook for 2024, which is not as bad as feared, make the ratio of opportunities to risks appear more balanced. He also assessed the risks to the double-digit percentage increase in sales targeted for the current year as lower than originally thought.      For Teamviewer, the expert raised the earnings estimates due to the announced end as main sponsor with the English soccer club Manchester United. He raised the price target from 17 to 18 euros, which implies a potential of almost 14 percent on yesterday's closing price. The securities of the remote maintenance software specialist continue to be rated "Overweight", as do those of SAP.      In line with the "Equal Weight" rating, the analysts at Barclays Capital expect the share to develop more or less in line with the other stocks in the sector under review over the next twelve months. In the case of "Overweight", the analysts expect an above-average development compared to the sector./gl/tih/jha/      Publication of the original study: 02.10.2023 / 14:57 / GMT First disclosure of the original study: 03.10.2023 / 04:10 / GMT  Analyzing Institute Barclays Capital.

title: EDENRED :  Oddo BHF maintains its Outperform rating
full_text: Oddo BHF has reaffirmed its 'outperform' rating and €70 price target on Edenred, despite government announcements that have rekindled the regulatory risk of commissions paid by restaurant operators in France's meal voucher market."The impact of a cap on merchant commissions may seem limited at first glance, but this issue has rekindled fears of adverse regulatory developments in the Employee Benefits business", the analyst acknowledges.  Nevertheless, the group's growth momentum and the strength of its business model remain unchanged in our view, despite the short-term risk, and the group's stock market track record plays in its favor', he nevertheless judges.Oddo BHF specifies that its positive opinion on Edenred is underpinned by high growth prospects linked to the under-penetration of its markets, still significant margin improvement potential and strong free cash flow generation.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: ERAMET  :  Oddo BHF reduces its target on the stock
full_text: Oddo BHF maintains its 'neutral' rating on Eramet shares, with a slightly reduced price target, from 91 to 89 euros. The analyst points out that while major mining groups (Rio Tinto, BHP, Anglo American) are currently benefiting from high copper and especially iron prices, "this is not the case for Eramet, which is mainly exposed to manganese and nickel". With Eramet due to publish its Q3 sales on October 26, Oddo BHF expects sales of €899 million (excluding ETI, sold on September 21), down 29% year-on-year due to the fall in commodity prices.Oddo BHF has nonetheless revised its 2023 forecasts slightly upwards to incorporate a slightly more optimistic scenario for nickel, with the recent rise in ore prices and higher production figures for SLN. On the other hand, 'beyond 2023, we have revised our forecasts downwards quite drastically (-28% on average) to take into account the fall in manganese and especially lithium prices', concludes the analyst. title: BOUYGUES :  Stifel confirms its recommendation on the stock
full_text: Stifel maintains its 'Hold' rating on Bouygues shares, with an unchanged target price of 32 euros. The analyst updates his estimates for Q3 and FY 2023, but points out "only marginal changes" from his previous estimates. Thus, for Q3, Stifel anticipates Group sales growth of +32.2% (+0% LFL) to €14.8 billion, mainly thanks to the consolidation of Equans, but impacted by the unfavorable real estate and TV advertising environments. Stifel also estimates that the buyout of Colas' minority stakes should cost the Group some 180 million euros by Q4, while the sale of district heating and cooling systems in the UK should bring in around 260 million pounds (~302 million euros) before the end of the year. full_text: Stifel initiates coverage of Robertet with a 'buy' recommendation and a price target of 1,000 euros, implying a potential upside of 24% for the share of the French flavors and fragrances group.The company, the world's seventh largest producer, operates in a fundamentally dynamic, low-cyclical market, and benefits from the pricing power of a highly concentrated sector", emphasizes the broker"Within the sector, Robertet benefits above all from its unique positioning and leadership in natural raw materials and luxury fragrances, which are the envy of all its major competitors", he continues.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: ELIS :  price target raised by Oddo BHF
full_text: Oddo BHF reiterates its 'outperform' rating on Elis, with an adjusted target price of €22 to €24.5, pointing to 'a discount of over 30% on these comparables, despite the fact that in recent months the group has demonstrated excellent FCF resilience'.  In 2023, we note a good capacity to pass on price increases and significant productivity effects. These factors, coupled with the easing of energy prices, will support 2024 results', says the analyst in charge of the file.The research department also highlights a reduction in the leverage ratio (DN/EBITDA 2024 at 1.8 times versus 2.1 times in 2023) compatible with an investment grade rating, which it believes 'will enable the Group to resume a more aggressive acquisitions strategy'.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: SCHNEIDER ELECTRIC :  Oddo BHF confirms its recommendation
full_text: Oddo BHF maintains its 'outperform' rating on Schneider Electric shares, with an unchanged target price of €186. The analyst reports that he expects organic sales growth of 10.7%, slightly above consensus (10.4%) in Q3. Demand remains buoyant overall, and we anticipate a 7% rise in volumes in Q3, while price increases will ease significantly", the broker believes. Oddo BHF adds that Q3 should enable the Group to confirm these objectives, with organic growth of 13.6% expected over nine months.According to the analyst, the Group should continue to benefit from its excellent positioning in electrification and energy efficiency, which will support volumes in 2023 and the medium term. title: Barclays upgrades Stroer to 'Overweight' and target to 55 euros
full_text: LONDON (dpa-AFX Broker) - U.K.-based investment bank Barclays upgraded Stroer to "overweight" from "equal weight" and raised its price target to 55 euros from 52 euros. The German outdoor advertising business is one of the most attractive advertising models in the media sector, which Stroer sometimes loses sight of because of its diversified portfolio, analyst Julien Roch wrote in a research note presented Monday. With the expected portfolio simplification, this area should provide even more momentum. To this end, the attractive valuation of the stock supports./gl/edh      Publication of the original study: 30.09.2023 / 00:24 / GMT First disclosure of the original study: 02.10.2023 / 04:10 / GMT----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: JPMorgan lowers target for Deutsche Borse to 183 euros - 'Neutral'
full_text: NEW YORK (dpa-AFX Broker) - U.S. bank JPMorgan cut its price target for Deutsche Borse to 183 euros from 203 euros ahead of the borse operator's capital markets day on Nov. 7 and left its rating at "neutral." The downside risk at Deutsche Borse appears slightly more pronounced than the opportunities, analyst Enrico Bolzoni wrote in a research note presented on Monday. However, this is already reflected in the valuation, as the stock is trading at a discount of 16 percent to its historical average, he added. He justified the new price target mainly with his revised valuation model./edh/gl      Publication of the original study: 29.09.2023 / 21:09 / BST First dissemination of the original study: 02.10.2023 / 00:15 / BST----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: Jefferies starts Kion with 'Buy' - Target 48 euros
full_text: NEW YORK (dpa-AFX Broker) - Analysts Jefferies initiated Kion with a "buy" rating and a target price of 48 euros. Economic worries had recently weighed on valuations of forklift maker shares, with an overly negative scenario now priced in, analyst Lucas Ferhani wrote in an industry report Monday. Producers should benefit from massive order backlogs at higher prices through the end of the year. A clear focus on price and cost control should also limit margin erosion./edh/gl      Original study publication date: 09/29/2023 / 16:08 / ET Original study first disseminated: 10/01/2023 / 12:00 / ET----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: PERNOD RICARD :  Barclays remains 'Underweight
full_text: On Friday, Barclays reiterated its 'Underweight' recommendation and 168-euro price target for Pernod Ricard shares, stating that it expects the spirits group to have a difficult start to the financial year."We expect the short-term bout of weakness, particularly in the US and China, to penalize results for the first quarter of the 2023/2024 financial year", stresses the broker.In its research note, Barclays forecasts a 1.7% organic sales decline for the company in the current quarter, the first of its fiscal year.Pernod Ricard will publish its sales for the first quarter of 2023/2024 on October 19.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: GFT shares jump above chart lines - focus on AI pulls
full_text: FRANKFURT (dpa-AFX Broker) - GFT shares jumped in price ahead of the weekend in response to the software company's accelerated efforts in the artificial intelligence (AI) business. The company said Friday it plans to set up a marketplace for AI applications, among other things, due to "rapidly growing customer demand."       The shares climbed to their highest level in seven weeks in response to the news, bouncing back above the 50- and 100-day lines, each of which are popular indicators of medium- to longer-term trends. Most recently, the share price gained almost six percent to € 26.44, which meant one of the top places in the small-cap index SDax.       Over the year, however, GFT investors are still sitting on a share price loss of more than a fifth./tav/tih/zb

title: Nike's inventory reduction gives hope to Adidas and Puma
full_text: FRANKFURT (dpa-AFX) - The positively received quarterly report of sporting goods manufacturer Nike also rubbed off on the papers of its German competitors on Friday. Adidas was among the biggest winners in the slightly recovered Dax with a 5.8 percent gain, while Puma shares led the MDax with a nearly six percent gain.      Nike shares themselves had already made strong gains in after-hours U.S. trading. The Americans disappointed the expectations of Wall Street analysts in terms of sales, but the gross margins turned out better than expected. In addition, according to Borsian, Nike made progress in reducing its high inventory levels - an issue where the German competition is currently also "feeling the pinch". In most cases, manufacturers have to offer high discounts. Adidas also still has to get rid of the remaining stocks of the "Yeezy" range after the end of the cooperation with the scandal rapper Kayne West.      Meanwhile, Jefferies expert James Grzinic wrote that Nike is in "shining armor", probably also alluding to its competitor Under Armour. He spoke of great relief at the first fiscal quarter report, which was much better than feared.      "European competitors should benefit from the fact that the market leader is not experiencing any further negative surprises on the sales front," the expert continued. Gross margin, inventory reduction and Nike's slight sales increase forecast for its second fiscal quarter also send positive signals for further profit development at Adidas and Puma, Grzinic said.      According to experts at investment house Bryan Garnier, Nike's confirmed outlook for the full year also reassured investors. "The modest revenue miss was not enough to dampen investors' positive sentiment after solid margin performance in the first quarter," they wrote in a research note available Friday. They believe the downward trend in market expectations seen in recent months should now stop. Nike shares should also benefit from robust consumer demand in China. However, Bryan Garnier also warned, "Given the fragile mood of the U.S. consumer, black clouds are not far away."/tav/ag/stk

full_text: While maintaining its 'hold' recommendation on Pernod Ricard, Stifel has lowered its price target from 202 to 185 euros, in the wake of a 5% average reduction in its 2024-26 EPS estimates for the French spirits group."Fiscal 2024 has started on a weak note against a backdrop of caution among wholesalers, who are taking less inventory due to macroeconomic weakness and pressure on household disposable incomes", points out the broker.Stifel expects the first quarter to put pressure on investor perception of annual targets, but does not expect Pernod Ricard to change its full-year outlook, which will depend on an acceleration in the second half of the year.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: Adidas, Puma and also Zalando profit from Nike report
full_text: FRANKFURT (dpa-AFX Broker) - Nike's quarterly report also had profiteers in the German market on Friday morning with Adidas, Puma and Zalando. Adidas, for example, jumped a good 7 percent back to its exponential 200-day line. Puma even climbed back above it by almost 6.5 percent. Zalando recovered somewhat after a double-digit weekly loss.       Nike is in a "shining armor" ("Nike In Shining Armour"), wrote Jefferies expert James Grzinic, probably also in allusion to the competitor Under Armour. Investors were likely to react with great relief to the report on the first fiscal quarter - which then also happened.       Met margin expectations, the outlook for the second quarter and full year, and progress on inventories also sent positive earnings signals for Adidas and Puma, Grzinic said. For Zalando, according to Borsian, the reduction of inventories plays a role above all. According to experts, however, current sales trends are poor, which also led to the recent slide in the share price./ag/stk----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: Barclays lowers target for DHL Group to 52 euros - 'Overweight'
full_text: LONDON (dpa-AFX Broker) - U.K.-based investment bank Barclays cut its price target for DHL Group to 52 euros from 55 euros, but kept its rating at "overweight." Global trade remained weak in the third quarter, analyst Alexia Dogani wrote in an industry report released Friday. European logistics groups continued to suffer from negative currency effects and high fuel costs. The main focus now, she said, is on the fourth quarter and whether robust consumer demand will lead to rising inventories and spark a recovery in trade. Air freight could benefit from this in the short term./edh/tih  Original study publication date: 28.09.2023 / 22:57 / GMT First disclosure of the original study: 29.09.2023 / 04:10 / GMT----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

full_text: NEW YORK (dpa-AFX Broker) - U.S. bank JPMorgan left Commerzbank at "Neutral" with a price target of 14.20 euros after issuing new targets. The after-tax return on equity target of more than 11 percent for 2027 appears ambitious given the consensus estimate of 9.3 percent for 2025, analyst Kian Abouhossein wrote in a research note issued Friday. He said the medium-term capital payout policy, which calls for a payout ratio of more than 50 percent from 2025 to 2027, implies an attractive yield. But the corresponding expectations of investors are already comparatively high./gl/tih      Publication of the original study: 28.09.2023 / 22:07 / BST First disclosure of the original study: 29.09.2023 / 00:15 / BST----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: JPMorgan leaves Thyssenkrupp at 'Neutral' - Target 6.30 euros
full_text: NEW YORK (dpa-AFX Broker) - U.S. bank JPMorgan left Thyssenkrupp at "Neutral" with a price target of 6.30 euros after news on the steel division. In a study published on Friday, analyst Moses Ola rated a report that the industrial group was able to sell half of the division to Czech billionaire Daniel Kretinsky as strategically sensible. After all, he said, thyssenkrupp wants to make its European steel business completely independent of coal-fired power, and Kretinsky is head and major shareholder of energy group EP Holding, which wants to become one of the leading producers of green hydrogen. Thyssenkrupp could provide details of the strategic benefits of a possible transaction at the presentation of figures due on November 22./gl/tih      Publication of the original study: 28.09.2023 / 22:35 / BST First disclosure of the original study: 29.09.2023 / 00:15 / BST----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: CROSSJECT  :  H1 23: no surprises before the release of the detailed accounts in October
full_text:
H1 23: no surprises before the release of the detailed accounts in October SIGNIFICANT NEWSThe company released preliminary H1 23 results, in line with our expectations.
Financing is secured for FY22 at least, with no dilutive instruments in sight.
Crossject will release more detailed numbers for H1 23 before the end of October.FACTCrossject released H1 23 results.  Revenues reached €7,926k vs €3,374k, operating result €-6,535k vs €-6,959k, and net result €-4,462k vs €-5,874k. Gross cash at the end of H1 23 amounted to €5.4m vs €5.7m a year ago and €8m at the end of FY23.ANALYSISAs we regularly write, the numbers are of little relevance at this stage since the story of Crossject is based on the future launch of Zeneo. That said, we see as good news that the operating result is about the same as year. In short, the revenues are covering rising costs “as much” as last year, despite a strong increase in depreciation (+2.3m).
The cash burn looks reasonably contained even if net debt is not released at this stage (it includes a €1.2m tax receivable due to a delay in VAT reimbursement as well as an increase in inventories), so not bad news on that front (at least before we have more details) and the liquidity is preserved. Note the group has cashed in €8m from the €14m non-dilutive financing (bank debt). Note also that the group will publish a full set of accounts before the end of October, on which we will comment of course, and that will give even better visibility on Crossject’s financing going forward.
The successful audits in Europe and the US are also supporting the case. The former confirms that the group is getting nearer a clearance from US health authorities concerning the deal with BARDA (Biomedical Advanced Research and Development Authority). H1 23 revenues include US$3.2m as part of this cooperation (note the contract could be worth US$155m in revenues in total for the French group). Also, see our Latest dated 20 June 2022 concerning the cooperation with BARDA.
More recently (July), we remind that the company announced the signing of an Australia & New Zealand commercial agreement for ZENEO® Midazolam (treatment of epileptic crisis) with AFT Pharmaceuticals, to cover this region of the world (i.e. a total population of around 30m). AFT is a listed New Zealand Pharma with sales of about NZS130m (c. €65m), addressing Australasia. AFT’s product portfolio comprises both proprietary and in-licensed products (skin care, supplements, allergy).IMPACTAll in all, this set of results looks ok, even if we lack the details on the accounts at this stage (to be released before the end of October; only a short simplified P&L has been made public so far). We will of course revert to these numbers for H1 23 once the full set of results is released, again before the end of October. Expect no change to our numbers at this stage.

title: Warburg sees majority of positive surprises for the reporting season
full_text: HAMBURG (dpa-AFX) - Despite a weak outlook for the domestic economy, experts at Warburg Bank expect the majority of surprises from companies in the Dax family to be positive in the upcoming quarterly reporting season. In view of the extremely unpredictable economic situation worldwide, the leading managers in German companies are currently setting their targets rather conservatively, wrote analyst Michael Heider in a study published on Thursday.      Therefore, this time around twice as many companies are likely to exceed market expectations as there will be groups where annual targets are likely to be in jeopardy. According to Heider, he came to this conclusion after an intensive screening of the 200 stocks monitored by Warburg.      In his list, 11 companies with negative surprise potential are compared with 21 stocks with good prospects. According to the list, the sporting goods manufacturer Adidas, the cosmetics group Beiersdorf and Deutsche Borse should surprise positively from the Dax.      Surprisingly good results should also be achieved by Deutz, Drägerwerk, Elmos, Freenet, Fresenius Medical Care (FMC), Fuchs, Hugo Boss, Jost Werke, Jungheinrich, Kion, SFC Energy, Traton and Vectron from the MDax and SDax.      On the other hand, reports from leading index members Brenntag and Continental were negative, as were those from Adesso, HHLA, Hypoport, Lanxess, New Work, ProSiebenSat.1 and Secunet./tav/jcf/he

title: ALSTOM :  Oddo BHF maintains its Outperform rating

title: IDI  :  Masters the value creation playbook
full_text:
Masters the value creation playbookM&A /CORP. ACTIONIDI announced today that it has completed, alongside Andera Partners, the sale of Flex Composite Group to Michelin. This operation, unveiled in June, will enable IDI to realise a capital gain of around €255m and to pocket close to €278m, corresponding to an investment multiple of 12 times the initial €23.2m outlay. Not only will this deal fill IDI’s pockets, it also further demonstrates IDI’s ongoing ability to create value.FACT
IDI made its first investment in Flex Composite Group for €23.2m back in 2015. 
At the end of 2022, IDI held 63.39% of the group alongside Andera Partners – a minority investor.
IDI and Andera Partners announced an agreement to sell the entire Flex Composite Group to Michelin for an enterprise value of €700m on 18 June 2023.
IDI and Andera Partners completed the sale agreement on 27 September 2023.
With this transaction, IDI achieves a multiple of 12x and an IRR of 38%.ANALYSISA masterstroke which radically changes IDI’s investment power
After announcing an agreement to sell Flex Composite Group alongside Andera Partners on 18 June, IDI reported today that it has completed the transaction. Flex Composite Group will join Michelin’s portfolio for an enterprise value of €700m. As a reminder, IDI acquired a stake in the group back in 2015 for €23.2m and holds, as of December 2022, 63.39% of the group alongside Andera Partners as a minority shareholder. With this operation, IDI will complete a stellar cash-on-cash multiple of 12x its initial investment, i.e. around €278m, corresponding to a capital gain of €255m and an IRR of 38%. This deal will therefore significantly line IDI’s pockets, enabling it to finance new investments. We estimate that, after this transaction, IDI should have a net cash position of around €352m.
Back to Flex Composite Group 
As mentioned in our last paper, Flex Composite Group is a European leader in the design, manufacture and distribution of advanced composite materials. The group is now made up of three divisions: i) Engineered fabrics, the technical coated fabrics division, ii) Carbon fabrics and technical composites Composite Materials, and iii) a thermoplastic films division, Technical Films, all of which have enabled it to achieve sales of c.€200m in 2022. Starting in 2015 up to 2022, through IDI’s support of its development, FCG has generated an operating margin of between 25% and 30% and average organic growth of 11%. 
Michelin’s acquisition of FCG and integration into its High Tech Materials division is in line with Michelin’s ambition to create a world leader in advanced composite materials. Michelin aims to combine the strengths of FCG and Michelin in R&D, but also geographically.
FY 2023 outlook 
Since 1 January 2023, IDI has completed or announced 14 transactions, including 5 disposals, 4 external growths and 5 acquisitions: the acquisition of a 40% stake in Omnes’ energy transition and innovation activities, the creation of 100% IdiCo (now fully consolidated), the disposal and subsequent reinvestment in Freeland, the investment in Natural Grass as well as in Prévost Laboratory Concept, and external growth transactions for Talis Education, CDS, and Groupe Positive. 
With a net cash position expected to reach €350m or so, IDI will have considerable firepower to finance new investments, and who knows, maybe redistribute some of the money through dividends. This is not unlikely as IDI has a focused investment strategy (less than 20 lines) and prefers its assets to fund their growth autonomously with IDI’s support only for bigger strategic deals. IMPACTWe will incorporate the capital gain from the sale of FCG into our estimates. Our model is currently being revised to incorporate the H1 23 figures.

However, the resulting slide in the share price appears to him to be exaggerated, so that a buying opportunity has arisen for investors./edh/tih  Publication of the original study: 27.09.2023 / 08:18 / CEST First disclosure of the original study: 27.09.2023 / 08:18 / CEST----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: KION RECOVER - UBS :  Phase 1 of the turnaround probably over
full_text: FRANKFURT (dpa-AFX Broker) - Shares of Kion recovered somewhat on Wednesday morning after the recent slide. With plus 2.5 percent to 35.35 euros, the papers of the forklift group returned to their simple 200-day line. The day before, they had slipped to a low since July at 33.12 euros. Jungheinrich even eased from the low since the beginning of January.       UBS expert Sven Weier believes that phase 1 of the turnaround at Kion appears to be almost complete. The next step is for order momentum to pick up, especially in the supply chain solutions (SCS) sector, Weier said. He attributes the recent share price weakness to weak purchasing managers' indices. The share could therefore still have a hard time for the time being./ag/zb

title: KWS gain on Tradegate - figures and outlook convincing
full_text: FRANKFURT (dpa-AFX Broker) - Positively received business figures and an encouraging corporate outlook drove up the shares of KWS Saat in pre-market trading on Wednesday. The seed producer's securities were quoted on the Tradegate trading platform 3.6 percent above the Xetra close on Tuesday.      At KWS, business was good in all segments. Expert Charlie Bentley from analyst firm Jefferies was correspondingly positive: the seed manufacturer had posted a smaller operating loss than feared in the seasonally less important final quarter of the current fiscal year. In addition, the company's sales growth target for the new fiscal year is above its forecast, which is reassuring in view of increasing concerns about agricultural sales markets.      Just on Tuesday, biofuel producer Verbio had disappointed with its earnings outlook. High energy and raw material costs as well as lower sales prices had weighed heavily on the company in the past fiscal year./la/zb----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------
