title: IDI  :  Shielded against macro-economic turmoil
full_text:
Shielded against macro-economic turmoilEARNINGS/SALES RELEASESThe uncertain macro-economic environment has left IDI unscathed, with NAV growth of 12.4% in H1 23 to €97.73 per share. The first half was particularly active for IDI, which announced 14 transactions, including the sale of Flex Composite Group to Michelin for more than 12x IDI’s initial investment, representing an IRR of 38%. All in all, these are outstanding results for IDI, which ended H1 23 with shareholders’ equity of €730m (+8.6%), investment capacity of €74.1m, and net income of €77.5m (vs. €30.1m in H1 22).FACT
IDI’s NAV per share rose by 12.4% ytd to €97.73 compared to €86.95 at the end of 2022, bringing the NAV discount to 31% (from 42% in H1 22). On an absolute basis, NAV rose from €672.8m to €730.7m in H1 23. 
In H1 23, IDI’s shareholders’ equity reached €730m (+8.6% ytd) and IDI’s investment capacity (net of debt) amounted to €74.1m, plus an undrawn investment credit of €30m and an overdraft facility of €5m.
Ytd, IDI has announced 14 transactions: 5 disposals, 4 external growths and 5 new acquisitions. In particular, IDI and Andera Partners sold Flex Composite Group for an EV of €700m in June, representing an investment multiple of 12x IDI’s initial investment and an IRR of 38%. 
The net result (group share) came in at €77.5m in H1 23, substantially above the €30.1m reported the year before.ANALYSISA commendable performance in a persistently challenging environment
The persistently uncertain macro-economic environment failed to dampen IDI’s resilience in H1 23, with NAV per share up 12.4% ytd to €97.73 compared to €86.95 at the end of 2022. The positive development of NAV is explained by the solid operating performance of IDI’s investment portfolio and, above all, by the integration of the sale value of Flex Composite Group. A feat in a context of fast-declining valuations. 
H1 23 was a particularly busy period for IDI, which announced 14 transactions, including 5 disposals, 4 external growths and 5 acquisitions. IDI continues to thrive, as demonstrated by the main deal of Q2 23: the sale of Flex Composite Group to Michelin for an EV of €700m, i.e. 12x its initial investment and an IRR of 38%. Beyond this transaction, IDI also finalised i) the acquisition of 40% of Omnes’ energy transition and innovation activities, ii) the disposal and subsequent reinvestment in Freeland to MML for a cash on cash multiple of 2.2x and an IRR of 24%, and iii) the disposal of Fidinav, a group specialising in the maritime transport of dry bulk, for an IRR of 6%. IDI also acquired a significant minority stake in Natural Grass, a major European player in the hybrid turf market, and carried out two external growth operations for Talis, a network of post-baccalaureate schools. 
The solid performance of the private equity business, with the successful sale of Flex Composite Group enabled IDI to post a sizeable investment result of €89.5m compared with €34.4m in H1 22. 
Solid balance sheet to face the challenges ahead
As of June 2023, IDI’s balance sheet is stronger than ever, with equity of €730m up 8.6% ytd, crossing the €700m threshold. The group’s investment capacity remains healthy at €74.1m, with an additional €30m of undrawn investment credit and €5m of undrawn overdraft facility. As a reminder, the value of the sale of Flex Composite Group was included solely in the NAV and was not included in the group’s liquidity position. Including the sale of Flex Composite Group, IDI should be sitting on a considerable liquidity hoard, which should enable it to finance new investments.
Looking ahead to the full year 2023 
IDI had an excellent H1 23, with buoyant investment activity at a time when the private equity landscape was expected to be hit by the slowdown in dealflow and cutbacks in financing. As was the case in H1, H2 23 is looking particularly good for IDI, with five deals already in the pipeline or completed post-close including the acquisition of Prévost Laboratory Concept, the sale of B2B telecoms operator VOIP, two external growth deals and the winding-up of Dee Tech. 
Clearly, the macro-economic environment remains lacklustre for private equity players, whose valuations are likely to suffer from rising interest rates alongside persistently high inflation. Yet, with a discount to NAV of around 31% and an undeniable track record of creating value, we remain positive on the stock, which we believe is a long-term hold. IMPACTWe will revise our estimates in line with the H1 23 publication. Our figures will include the consolidation of IdiCo from 2023 and we will treat the stake in Omnes’ infrastructure business like the other financial investments. We will also include in our figures the capital gain on the sale of Flex Composite Group, which should boost our EPS for 2023.

full_text: Stifel reiterates its 'buy' recommendation on LVMH, but lowers its price target from €950 to €850, 'based on a lower target P/E multiple, reflecting decelerating growth expectations in 2024 and rising bond yields'.The broker expects organic growth for the luxury group and its fashion and leather goods division to normalize at +10% in the third quarter of 2023, and assumes a more cautious +7% for 2024.However, Stifel remains positive on LVMH, 'given the resilience of its fashion and leather goods division, a diversified portfolio with relatively defensive characteristics, and a substantial share devaluation since mid-July'.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: KERING :  RBC maintains 'outperform' rating after Gucci fashion show
full_text: RBC on Monday reiterated its 'outperform' rating and 665 euro price target on Kering following Gucci's spring/summer 2024 fashion show, held this weekend in Milan.In a research note, the broker points out that the collection was christened 'Gucci Ancora', which can be translated as 'again', with the aim of opening a new chapter for the Italian brand.RBC evokes a style inspired by Italian urban fashion, easy to wear and contemporary, an approach tending to distance itself from the directions previously taken by Alessandro Michele.From the analyst's point of view, this low-risk approach could enable Gucci to better position itself over the coming quarters and months.With regard to Kering's next quarterly publication, scheduled for October 20, the intermediary expects the luxury group's figures to disappoint, given the current slowdown.Despite this, Kering remains its best investment idea within the luxury sector, due to both its valuation and Gucci's turnaround potential.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: KLÉPIERRE :  RBC downgrades to 'underperform
full_text: RBC on Monday downgraded its recommendation on the stock of commercial real estate group Klépierre to 'underperform' from 'in line with sector performance'.According to Royal Bank of Canada, Klépierre's risk/reward profile is now 'less attractive' than those of other players in its sector.'We believe that Klépierre benefits from a sound strategy and good operational execution', says RBC in its note.However, after outperforming the rest of the European real estate sector by 45% over the past year, the stock is trading on multiples that are more demanding than its five-year historical average for the sector", explains the Canadian bank.RBC adds that the slowdown in economic growth, combined with rising interest rates, raises the risk of a downward revision of earnings expectations for the shopping center operator over the next few years.Its price target has nevertheless been revised upwards, to 25 euros.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. All rights reserved.The information and analyses published by Cercle Finance are intended solely as decision-making aids for investors. title: KERING :  BofA downgrades its opinion to 'underperform
full_text: Bank of America on Monday downgraded its opinion on Kering shares from 'neutral' to 'underperform', with a price target reduced from €600 to €430.In a study devoted to the luxury sector, BofA believes that the current climate of economic uncertainty is likely to complicate Kering's task of turning around Gucci.The American bank points out that the Italian brand experienced periods of great success during the Tom Ford era and before 2019, under Alessandro Michele, followed by phases of slowdown, but that success has always been achieved when the brand was able to take risks.Since 2020, however, its market share losses have accelerated, notes BofA, with sales at constant exchange rates up just 5% in 2022 compared to 2019, against an average of 41% for the rest of the sector.In a market environment tending to normalize, the brand's turnaround will be complicated, warns the Wall Street firm.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: Bernstein leaves BMW at 'Market-Perform' - Target 110 euros
full_text: NEW YORK (dpa-AFX Broker) - U.S. analyst firm Bernstein Research left its rating on BMW at "Market-Perform" with a price target of 110 euros after speaking with a McKinsey auto expert. The focus was on the auditor's latest research into the behavior of Chinese consumers, analyst Daniel Roeska wrote in a study presented on Monday. According to the study, in the field of electromobility, technology is decisive for them and no longer the brand image. As preferences change, traditional carmakers will have to reinvent themselves. title: SAINT-GOBAIN :  Oddo BHF reiterates its buy recommendation
full_text: Last Friday, Saint-Gobain organized a visit to its Norwood asphalt tile plant and Northborough research center in the United States. Following this visit, Oddo BHF confirms its Outperform recommendation on the stock, with a target of E70.' More than ever, the North American market will continue to be a strategic priority for Saint-Gobain. As a bonus, trends are expected to remain positive in the United States and unchanged in Europe', says Oddo BHF. The analyst points out that North America is now the Group's biggest contributor, accounting for 30% of EBIT. The Group estimates housing needs at 20m units over the next few years (housing starts at ~1.5m) '. Oddo BHF remains fully convinced that the changes of recent years have not yet been integrated at their fair value (green deal, ESG profile, strong pricing power, change in profile via acquisitions).  At ~5.0x EV/EBITDA 2023e, Saint-Gobain has significant potential to catch up with its peers, which are trading between 15x and 20x," adds Oddo BHF. Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: Klépierre share price penalized by RBC downgrade
full_text: Klépierre shares were among the biggest decliners on the SBF 120 on Monday's Paris Bourse, penalized by a recommendation downgrade from RBC.This morning, analysts at the Canadian bank downgraded their recommendation on the commercial real estate group's shares to 'underperform' from 'in line with sector performance'.However, their price target has been revised upwards to 25 euros.According to Royal Bank of Canada, Klépierre's risk/return profile is now 'less attractive' than those of other players in its sector.'We believe that Klépierre benefits from a sound strategy and good operational execution', says RBC in its note.  However, after outperforming the rest of the European real estate sector by 45% over the past year, the stock is trading on multiples that are more demanding than its five-year historical average for the sector", explains the Canadian bank.RBC adds that the slowdown in economic growth, combined with rising interest rates, is likely to lead to a downward revision of earnings expectations for the shopping center operator over the next few years.At 12:15 pm, the share price was down 2.7% at 136 euros, having lost more than 3% in the course of the morning.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. All rights reserved.

title: Barclays sees plenty of upside potential for Jungheinrich - Kion fairly valued
full_text: LONDON (dpa-AFX) - British investment bank Barclays expects better times for forklift manufacturers Jungheinrich and Kion soon. However, analyst Timothy Lee still sees significant upside potential for the Jungheinrich share. However, he considers the Kion share to be fairly valued, not least because its debt is higher than the industry average. This means that his assessment differs from that of the market, which considers the Frankfurt-based company to be undervalued following the share price slide last year, he wrote in two studies published on Friday.      Accordingly, he started Jungheinrich at "Overweight" with a price target of 36 euros. Lee took up the valuation of Kion shares with "Equal Weight" and a price target of 37 euros.      The Barclays analyst contrasted the two companies' warehouse automation business in particular. In general, a bottoming out is emerging here, from which Kion could benefit strongly as the global market leader in the event of a subsequent recovery. A further recovery in orders should take place in 2024, even if the Barclays expert does not yet expect such a rapid return to the levels seen before the Corona pandemic. As a result, his estimate for adjusted operating profitability in 2025 remains below consensus expectations.      At Jungheinrich, meanwhile, he sees a lot of potential in the still small but growing warehouse automation division, which has not yet been priced into the market. The acquisition of the Storage Solutions Group announced by the Hamburg-based company in January could increase the value of the business fourfold.      Lee also likes Jungheinrich's financial position better. He praised a strong balance sheet with manageable debt. Kion's debt level, on the other hand, is higher than its peers, he said. It should come down as sales and margins recover, but the Frankfurt-based company will still have to work hard to meet its obligations. It will take time for profitability to improve.      In the forklift business, Lee said both companies can rely on a strong order backlog. This should secure sales into 2024. In parallel, the analyst expects a gradual recovery in orders. Currently, the weak economic environment is weighing on both MDax companies. Jungheinrich is also very dependent on the European market and retail customers. At Kion, price increases should ensure stable margins in the rest of the year, but there is hardly any further upside potential here in 2024.      According to Barclays Capital, shares rated "Overweight" are likely to outperform the other stocks in the sector under review over the next twelve months. With an "Equal Weight" rating, the bank expects the stock to perform roughly in line with other sector stocks over the next twelve months./niw/ck/zb  Analyzing institute Barclays Capital.      Publication of the original studies: 21.09.2023 / 13:18 and 14:37 / GMT First disclosure of the original studies: 21.09.2023 / 15:45 / GMT

title: IMERYS :  Berenberg lowers its price target
full_text: Berenberg announced on Friday that it had lowered its price target for Imerys from 51 to 46 euros, even though the financial intermediary continues to maintain a buy recommendation on the stock.In a research note, the analyst states that he expects the French group's exposure to the construction sector, which stands at 40%, to penalize its results significantly in the second half of the year.The professional adds that he is becoming progressively more pessimistic about the prospect of a turnaround by the end of the year in the industrial compounding business, forecasting demand at half-mast for some time to come, whether in Europe or the USA.At the same time, the recovery of the Chinese economy has quickly run out of steam, says Berenberg, who does not foresee any upturn in growth in the immediate future.In this context, the intermediary considers that the Ebitda target of between €630 and €650 million announced for this year could prove 'difficult to achieve'.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. full_text: HAMBURG (dpa-AFX Broker) - Private bank Berenberg left its rating for Rheinmetall at "Buy" with a target price of 300 euros after a meeting with the group's CEO at an in-house corporate conference. title: Bernstein leaves Delivery Hero at 'Outperform' - Target 60 euros
full_text: NEW YORK (dpa-AFX Broker) - U.S. analyst firm Bernstein Research left its rating on Delivery Hero at "Outperform" with a price target of 60 euros, given the negotiations on a possible partial sale of the Asian brand Foodpanda. Southeast Asia is a difficult market for the food delivery service due to strong competition from Grab, a weak market position, lack of profitability and the boycott in Thailand, analyst William Woods wrote in a research note released Thursday. Therefore, a sale would be very positive for the stock and the company's earnings performance. However, investors should not rely on a sale actually happening in the end./mis/ag  Publication of the original study: 21.09.2023 / 05:53 / UTC First disclosure of the original study: 21.09.2023 / / UTC

title: KERING :  Jefferies now prefers 'Hold
full_text: Jefferies announced on Wednesday that it had lowered its recommendation on Kering shares from "buy" to "hold", with a price target revised downwards from €655 to €500.In a note dedicated to the luxury goods sector, the research firm points out that the 2023 financial year has so far been characterized, for the French group, by pressure on its earnings forecasts well in excess of that experienced by its peers.Of course," he continues, "the central debate continues to be Gucci's turnaround and the brand's ability to recapture its magic and thus return, as expected, to a margin of over 41% in the medium term.While recognizing that Kering owns some of the sector's most iconic brands, Jefferies points out that the market's attention is now increasingly focused on valuation levels, especially in comparison with expected earnings.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: LVMH :  Jefferies downgrades recommendation to 'hold
full_text: Jefferies announced on Wednesday that it had lowered its recommendation on LVMH from 'buy' to 'hold', with a price target lowered from 960 to 780 euros.Given the considerable size of the French group - whose activities in fashion and leather goods and watches and jewelry alone account for almost 40% of the global market - Jefferies expects its fate to remain linked, over the coming months, to major trends in the sector.From this point of view, the broker believes that the spending ambitions of Americans and Europeans, but above all of Chinese consumers, will be decisive for the major players in the business.And while it recognizes that LVMH shares remain attractive from a long-term perspective, the broker believes that the outlook for the next six to 12 months are the considerations that should take precedence in the immediate future.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: Hauck Aufhäuser trusts Delivery Hero share price doubling
full_text: FRANKFURT (dpa-AFX Broker) - After Delivery Hero 's significant share price drop, patient investors could be rewarded, according to Hauck Aufhäuser Investment Banking. The bank included the stock in its valuation with a buy recommendation ('Buy') and a price target of 65 euros. This would give the stock the potential to double in value.         A share investment in the delivery platform operator has been a rather nerve-racking affair in recent months. Since the beginning of the year, the stock has gone up and down. The result of all the fluctuations is sobering: the share price has lost almost 30 percent since the beginning of the year.     However, Hauck & Aufhäuser analyst Christian Salis was confident in a study presented on Wednesday that Delivery Hero will reap the rewards of its good positioning in the future. He said the company offers the most comprehensive online platform for meal delivery and benefits from its strong market position with over a hundred million customers in more than 70 countries - with the MDax member even being the market leader in 56 countries. This not only gives the delivery service major advantages, but also means a significant barrier to entry for competitors.      Salis also sees the focus on emerging markets as an advantage. The strong economic growth of the emerging nations and their pronounced affinity for the Internet are just as favorable as the lower intensity of competition. Added to this is the increasing urbanization of the emerging markets.       According to the industry expert, Delivery Hero should succeed in convincing with positive news in the future thanks to the efficiency measures taken.      Revenue growth had already begun to recover in the second quarter. Profitability should then also improve noticeably in the second half of the year. Hauck Aufhäuser therefore believes that the stock is a buy.      With its "Buy" rating, Hauck & Aufhäuser Investment Banking sees a sustained sees a sustainable upside potential of more than ten percent on a twelve-month horizon./mf/tav/mis  Analyzing institute Hauck Aufhäuser Investment Banking  Publication of the original study: 20.09.2023 / 07:17 GMT First disclosure of the original study: 20.09.2023 / 07:55 / GMT

Gross orders over this period totaled 117. The number of deliveries to date is 433 to 77 customers.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: TALANX WEAK - TRADER :  Placement at 61.50 euros per share
full_text: FRANKFURT (dpa-AFX Broker) - A capital increase dragged the shares of Talanx down sharply in pre-market trading on Wednesday. On Tradegate, the insurer's papers lost 5.6 percent to 62.15 euros.      With its capital increase of up to 300 million euros, the MDax group wants to drive up the proportion of its shares in free float and also increase its capital resources for further acquisitions and business growth from its own resources.       In addition, Talanx's majority shareholder HDI, a mutual insurance company, intends to offer its own shares worth up to 100 million euros for purchase, it was reported.      Commenting on the share price losses, a trader pointed out that Talanx had placed 4.88 million new shares at a price of 61.50 euros each, 4.30 euros below the previous day's closing price./ck/mis/zb

title: AIR FRANCE-KLM :  Barclays lowers its target price
full_text: On Tuesday, Barclays lowered its price target for Air France-KLM from €26 to €22, but renewed its 'overweight' recommendation on the stock.In a note devoted to European air transport, the research firm points out that shares in the sector have been out of favor for some time, against a backdrop of warnings from US airlines, rising oil prices and difficulties encountered by the GTF engine.Although Barclays points out that European carriers are hedged against fuel prices, and that the grounding of GTF-equipped aircraft should limit capacity and support fares, the analyst prefers to lower his earnings estimates and targets on sector stocks, with the sole exception of Norwegian.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: ALD :  Stifel remains Buy, lowers its target
full_text: Stifel has reiterated its 'buy' recommendation on ALD, with an adjusted target price of €20 to €19, following the presentation by the vehicle rental group of a strategic plan for 2026 that it deems 'prudent and realistic'.While this plan is perfectly in line with its estimates for growth and gains in vehicle value, the broker has lowered its EPS forecasts for 2023 and 2024, to take into account higher restructuring costs.Nevertheless, Stifel considers ALD to be 'fundamentally undervalued', pointing out that it 'is the leader in its market and benefits from highly recurring service and rental margins, as well as a very favorable second-hand market'.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: SAINT GOBAIN :  'a buying opportunity' according to Stifel
full_text: Saint Gobain will be organizing a site visit in the USA this week, which will be attended by senior executives from both the Group and the country.Ahead of this meeting, Stifel confirms its Buy recommendation and price target of E68 on the stock.Investors and analysts are hoping that management will take this opportunity to provide an update on the current activities of the Group and its North American businesses.  Just as important, if not more so, we'd like to get a sense of how the various newly acquired businesses are progressing. The Group has invested a not inconsiderable amount of capital over the past two years, and the completion of these investments would contribute to the share's revaluation' says the analyst firm.  The volatility of the share price linked to housing would offer a new buying opportunity, in our opinion.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: VINCI :  UBS reiterates its buy recommendation
full_text: UBS confirms its buy recommendation on the stock with a target of E127 following the announcement of August 2023 traffic figures.The analyst believes that ' airports are stagnating while freeways are weakening slightly '.' Airports' recovery holds at 96% compared with 2019, while Autoroutes were affected by heat waves across France in August ' says UBS.Vinci Autoroutes' traffic recorded a slight decline of -1.4% in August. For the first eight months of the year as a whole, all-vehicle traffic remained on the rise, despite high fuel prices and negative calendar effects for heavy goods vehicles.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: SOCIETE GENERALE :  Oddo BHF remains positive after Plan 2026
full_text: Oddo BHF maintains its 'outperform' opinion and 33 euro price target on Societe Generale, following the presentation by the banking group of its strategic plan and financial targets to 2026.The research firm has adjusted its forecasts to take into account the new guidance on Boursorama and additional restructuring costs (and has revised its cost of risk forecast slightly downwards).  However, the analyst considers that "the strategy presented is certainly highly value-creating in the medium term, as it will enable a reduction in the cost of risk applied to the share (which is trading at less than 0.4 times its tangible equity)".While the fall in the return of capital to shareholders in the short term has weighed on Societe Generale's share price, Oddo BHF believes that "future disposals could support the share price by accelerating the improvement in the Group's CET1".Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: DZ Bank lowers fair value for Krones to 135 euros - 'Buy'.
full_text: FRANKFURT (dpa-AFX) - DZ Bank has lowered the fair value for Krones from 140 to 135 euros, but left its rating at "buy". Even though the bottling plant manufacturer's stock has now dropped out of the MDax, the investment case remains intact, analyst Thorsten Reigber wrote in a study presented on Monday. The business model is largely cyclically robust and the outlook for the future in a difficult macro environment is very good, he explained, among other things. In this regard, he pointed to the strong order book with capacity utilization into the first quarter of 2025. He also praised the structural cost savings and successfully implemented price increases./ck/niw      Publication of the original study: 18.09.2023 / 14:33 / CEST First disclosure of the original study: 18.09.2023 / 14:45 / CEST

title: SOCIÉTÉ GÉNÉRALE :  RBC maintains 'in-line performance' rating
full_text: Royal Bank of Canada on Monday reiterated its 'in line with sector performance' opinion and 35 euro price target on Société Générale shares, following the presentation of the French banking group's strategic plan.In a reaction note, the Canadian broker hails a plan that "makes sense", but implies limited potential for upward revision of market forecasts."SG's strategic plan appears solid, with the objective of increasing capital generation, improving efficiencies and maintaining a low cost of risk by 2026", explains the broker.RBC adds that both the financial targets and the capital distribution plans implied by the capital trajectory presented by the bank seem 'prudent', and do not suggest an upward revision of consensus forecasts at this stage.Execution will therefore prove to be a key element in demonstrating that market estimates are likely to be revised upwards, it concludes.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: SAVENCIA :  Oddo BHF confirms its recommendation
full_text: Oddo BHF confirms its neutral recommendation on the value, with an unchanged target of E60, following the announcement of first-half figures.The 19% organic increase in H1 sales for Other Dairy Products reflects a volume mix of 3.3% and a price effect of 15.7% (of which +12.6%e in Q2 vs. 19.2% in Q1).' Sales continued to benefit from previous price increases, particularly in the retail and food service businesses overall," says the analyst.  Cheese sales remain positive in France, despite the price increases, while the volume mix is declining in Europe, with consumers preferring products at more affordable prices". Oddo BHF has raised its estimate for organic growth from 4% to 9.3%, due to a higher-than-expected price effect in H1. Overall group sales have been adjusted by 2.5% after updating the currency impact. ROC 2023 is reduced by only 1% to 206.7 ME. Net income is reduced by nearly 8% to 88.7 ME (+29.7%), due to higher financial expenses. Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: SOCIÉTÉ GÉNÉRALE :  KBW maintains 'market perform' rating
full_text: On Monday, analysts at Keefe, Bruyette & Woods (KBW) maintained their 'market perform' opinion on Société Générale shares, following the strategic plan presented this morning by the French banking group, which was deemed 'disappointing'.In a reaction note, the American investment bank says it is notably uninspired by the objective of a return on tangible equity (ROTE) of between 9% and 10% by 2026.The New York-based firm adds that Boursorama, the bank's online banking arm, will continue to accelerate customer acquisition - a decision that will weigh on the Group's results until 2025 - which should also penalize market sentiment.In its study, KBW also expresses its frustration at the lack of details regarding potential asset disposals.'Overall, this roadmap is unlikely to drive any significant change in earnings trajectory', says the investment bank, which considers that long-term structural problems remain firmly entrenched.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: PEUGEOT INVEST :  discount 'still very high' according to Oddo BHF
full_text: Following the publication of Peugeot Invest's results last Friday, Oddo BHF has reaffirmed its 'outperform' opinion and its price target of 145 euros, highlighting a 'still very high' discount for the stock.By updating its model, and at the current share price, the research department has recalculated a discount of -55%, high by historical standards, on the NAV it currently calculates at 230 euros.Oddo BHF believes that the company, an investment vehicle of the Peugeot family, has posted a good start-of-year NAV, up 12% in the first half to 221.3 euros per share, driven by Peugeot 1810 (unmanaged part of the portfolio).Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: ASSYSTEM :  Invest Securities remains Buy, adjusts its target
full_text: While adjusting its price target from 56 to 54 euros with the drop in its John Wood comparable, Invest Securities reaffirms its 'buy' recommendation on Assystem, following the publication of the engineering group's half-year results last week."The nuclear cycle is still extremely buoyant, but it is a long-term business, even though organic growth is already accelerating (+15.8% in the first half of 2023)", stresses the analyst in charge of the file.  Similarly, while there are no major targets in the nuclear sector, management is showing patience regarding the disposal of its stakes in Framatome and Expleo", continues Invest Securities, which is only adjusting its assumptions at the margin.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: Goldman lowers target for Mercedes-Benz - 'Conviction Buy List'
full_text: NEW YORK (dpa-AFX Broker) - U.S. investment bank Goldman Sachs lowered its price target for Mercedes-Benz to 97 euros from 99 euros, but kept the shares on its "Conviction Buy List." It is the general view of investors that the European automotive industry is facing a period of subdued sales and price trends, analyst George Galliers wrote in an industry report available Monday. However, he took a more constructive approach to the sector. Stronger business performance among automakers could continue and should be rewarded. Mercedes-Benz is his sector favorite here, ahead of Porsche and Stellantis./tih/ck  Publication of the original study: 18.09.2023 / 04:59 / BST First disclosure of original study: Date not specified in study / Time not specified in study / Time zone not specified in study----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: CHARGEURS  :  Adjustments to our FY 23-24 outlook following the H1 results
full_text: Adjustments to our FY 23-24 outlook following the H1 resultsTARGET CHANGECHANGE IN EPS2023 : € 0.39 vs 0.80 -51.8%2024 : € 0.74 vs 1.20 -38.2%We have revised our estimates for 2023 and 2024 downwards following H1 23. We were over-optimistic about top-line growth and now estimate sales of €702m with an underlying operating profit of 5%, compared with 6.1%. The downward revision comes mainly from the Chargeurs Advanced Materials division, where we were too enthusiastic about the prospects for a rebound in volumes in a macro-economic environment that remains unfavourable. We have also lowered our estimates for the Fashion Technologies division, which, despite the catch-up effect of the fashion and luxury goods sector, recorded a fall in sales in H1 due to the devaluation of the Argentinian peso. Top-line growth was also impacted by our downward revision of estimates for Chargeurs Luxury Fibers, whose growth was adversely affected by a cyclone in New Zealand. Lastly, our EPS forecasts were penalised by the rise in financial expenses in H1 23.CHANGE IN NAV€ 32.2 vs 41.1 -21.5%Given that we have based our NAV estimate on EV/EBITDA multiples with an average estimated EBITDA for 2023, 2024 and 2025, our downward revision of EBITDA particularly for Chargeurs Advanced Materials has penalised our NAV. We now value the division at around €300m, compared with €452m previously. The downward revision of the estimated EBITDA for Fashion Technology has also had a slight negative impact on our NAV. Lastly, the increase in net debt from €174.4m at the end of 2022 to €194.4m in H1 23 contributed to the fall in our NAV.CHANGE IN DCF€ 17.3 vs 26.3 -34.1%The sharp fall in our DCF comes from our downward revisions to the FY 23-24 EPS forecast (see EPS commentary). We expect revenues of €702m (vs. €789m) with an underlying profit of €35m for 2023 and revenues of €788m (vs. €872m) with an underlying operating profit of €49m (vs. €53m). In addition, as with NAV, the increase in estimated net debt weighs on our DCF.

title: UBISOFT :  Morgan Stanley initiates 'weight in line' coverage
full_text: Morgan Stanley initiated coverage of Ubisoft on Friday with a 'weight in line' recommendation and a price target of 31.5 euros, explaining that it prefers to stay away from the stock.In a note published in the morning, the research firm acknowledges that the video game publisher has a vast market and potential cost leverage, but also that it is well placed, both culturally and technologically, to benefit from the emergence of AI.Morgan Stanley also points out that the company's operating performance has been disappointing recently, while competition in its market remains as fierce as ever.For the research firm, the group's short-term profile is not without risk, at a time when it is trying to revive its growth momentum with new securities.It is also possible that the evolution of consumer tastes will lead to a shift away from Ubisoft's historical positioning, which has become known for its vast, detailed and open universes", it concludes.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: Ubisoft: share price declines, Morgan Stanley holds back
full_text: Ubisoft suffered the second biggest drop in the SBF 120 index on Friday, penalized by cautious comments from Morgan Stanley analysts, who explained that they preferred to stay away from the stock.At around 2:10 pm, the video game designer's shares were down 2.3%, while the SBF 120 was up 1.5%.Analysts at Morgan Stanley initiated coverage of the stock this morning with a 'weight in line' recommendation and a price target of 31.5 euros.In a note, the research firm acknowledges that the French group not only has a vast market and potential cost leverage, but is also well placed, both culturally and technologically, to benefit from the emergence of AI.Morgan Stanley also points out that the company's operating performance has been disappointing recently, while competition in its market remains as fierce as ever.For the research firm, the group's short-term profile is not without risk, at a time when it is trying to revive its growth momentum with new securities.It is also possible that the evolution of consumer tastes will lead to a shift away from Ubisoft's historical positioning, which has become known for its vast, detailed and open universes", it concludes.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. All rights reserved.

title: IPSOS :  Oddo BHF slightly reduces its target
full_text: Oddo BHF maintains its 'outperform' rating on Ipsos shares, with a slightly reduced target price, from 66 to 65 euros. This change of target comes on the heels of Ipsos' announcement of a downward revision of its organic sales growth target for 2023, which is now expected to be +3-4% compared with the +5% previously targeted.' This disappointment is due first and foremost to the absence of a recovery in revenues this summer among major Tech customers', says Oddo BHF, adding that the Group is also held back by its activity in China (3rd country - 7% of 2022 sales), as a result of disappointing macroeconomic indicators.All in all, the downward revision of EPS does not exceed 2%, says Oddo. The analyst believes that this is "a mini warning, a priori cyclical", which does not call into question the acceleration of organic sales growth in H2 "even if it will be a notch below initial expectations", according to the broker.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: UBS leaves FMC at 'Neutral' - Target 40.50 euros
full_text: ZURICH (dpa-AFX Broker) - Swiss major bank UBS left its rating on FMC at "Neutral" with a price target of 40.50 euros. Two things are currently the focus of debate in the medical technology sector: potential measures against corruption in China, and opportunities and risks with a new generation of the intestinal hormone GLP-1, analyst Graham Doyle wrote in a research note presented on Friday. title: Bernstein leaves Bayer at 'Outperform' - Target 78 euros
full_text: NEW YORK (dpa-AFX Broker) - U.S. analyst firm Bernstein Research left its rating on Bayer at "Outperform" with a price target of 78 euros. A team of analysts led by Bayer expert Gunther Zechmann looked at the efforts of freight forwarders and airlines to reduce greenhouse gas emissions in a report published Friday. One quick way to do that, he said, is to switch to renewable diesel or sustainable aviation fuel. The first effect of that, he said, is the need for greater soybean acreage. Increasing soy volumes would benefit the agrochemical and pharmaceutical company, although a move away from corn would be negative for the Leverkusen-based company./tih/la      Publication of the original study: 14.09.2023 / 14:27 / UTC First transmission of the original study: 14.09.2023 / 23:00 / UTC----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: Bernstein rates RWE 'Outperform' - Target 48.50 euros
full_text: NEW YORK (dpa-AFX Broker) - U.S. analyst firm Bernstein Research left its rating on RWE at "Outperform" with a price target of 48.50 euros. Renewable energies are undoubtedly the technologically most important driver of the energy transition, analyst Deepa Venkateswaran wrote in an industry report published on Friday. However, investments would have to be increased significantly to achieve this, with at least $18 trillion needed by 2050. The key question for investors, she said, is whether the high growth potential can be realized in a value-enhancing way. RWE is one of their key stocks for this issue./tih/la  Publication of the original study: 14.09.2023 / 20:00 / UTC First disclosure of the original study: 14.09.2023 / 20:00 / UTC----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: BUREAU VERITAS :  Berenberg resets to buy
full_text: Berenberg announced on Friday that it had reinitiated its Buy recommendation on Bureau Veritas shares, with a target price of 29 euros.In a research note, the analyst points out that growth in the testing, inspection and certification (TIC) market has been slowing steadily over the past ten years.Before the financial crisis, most businesses were growing faster than GDP, with a trend towards diversification among players who were developing faster than their competitors", recalls the intermediary.While the sector's stock market valuations reached all-time highs in the wake of the Covid crisis, Berenberg now advocates a "more selective" approach to the sector.However, he believes that, from a long-term perspective, ICT professionals should benefit from a buoyant structural dynamic, notably linked to the development of ESG themes, even if they risk facing headwinds in terms of growth and margins in the medium term.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: SÉCHÉ :  Oddo BHF remains positive, adjusts its target
full_text: Oddo BHF reaffirms its 'outperform' rating on Séché Environnement, despite an adjusted price target of €135 to €130, following the group's half-yearly publication, which was judged to be 'solid', and the roadshow organized with its management.The research firm notes that 'the second half of the year should see the same momentum, with an improvement in profitability, a targeted M&A policy and continued growth momentum in 2024 and beyond, reflecting the resilience of the model'.After a "faultless" stock market performance, Oddo BHF considers that the valuation remains moderate, with a 21% discount to historical ratios, while it anticipates a 2022/25 TMVA of +8.5% for EBITDA and +12.6% for ROC.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: VIVENDI :  Oddo BHF raises its target slightly
full_text: Oddo BHF maintains its 'outperform' rating on Vivendi shares, with a price target raised from 13.5 to 13.8 euros. The analyst reports that since the beginning of the summer, the share prices of TI and UMG have risen by 20% and 21.5% respectively: these two assets represent a value of 5.6 billion euros, or 67% of the group's current market capitalization. Meanwhile, Vivendi's share price remained virtually stable (+1%).  While the valuation of other assets, notably Canal+ Group and Havas, has no reason to have changed, this leads to an increase in the discount. We estimate this to be 55% at present", stresses Oddo BHF. The broker believes that the current 'particularly low' level is attractive for taking a position on Vivendi.  Visibility on the speculative agenda is limited, but the strategic outcome remains unchanged in our view: Vivendi will be acquired, sooner or later, by Bolloré (and therefore at a premium, since Bolloré holds only 30% of the capital)', adds the analyst. title: Berenberg leaves Symrise at 'Buy' - Target 124 euros
full_text: HAMBURG (dpa-AFX Broker) - Private bank Berenberg left its rating on Symrise at "buy" with a target price of 124 euros after an industry conference. All companies had talked about further destocking along the value chain, but it could come to an end here and there, analyst Samantha Darbyshire wrote in a research note presented on Friday. Looking at costs, relief is expected in 2024, she added. Looking at fragrance and flavorings maker Symrise, the analyst said the company has focused primarily on growth in the past, but is currently also focusing on a recovery in profitability for now. The analyst expects this to succeed./mis/la      Publication of the original study: 14.09.2023 / 17:05 / GMT First disclosure of the original study: Date in study not specified / Time in study not specified / Time zone in study not specified----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: Baader Bank starts Baywa with 'Buy' - Target 52 euros
full_text: MUNICH (dpa-AFX Broker) - Baader Bank has added Baywa to its rating with a "buy" rating and a price target of 52 euros. In a study presented on Friday, analyst Rene Rückert sees several price drivers for the shares of the agricultural trading group, which in his eyes is often overlooked by investors and is also undervalued. The new Baywa CEO is focusing on return on capital employed and cash flow, he said. In addition, profits in the agricultural business should recover. Furthermore, with a view to the operating profit target for 2025, a large part should come from the renewable energies business. Another share price driver would be the sale of the solar trading business./mis/la  Publication of the original study: 14.09.2023 / 15:43 / CEST First disclosure of original study: Date not stated in study / Time not stated in study / Time zone not stated in study----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: CARREFOUR :  Oddo BHF confirms its 'outperform' recommendation
full_text: Oddo BHF maintains its outperform recommendation on Carrefour shares, with an unchanged target price of 20 euros, the day after the publication in bookshops of a book dedicated to the retailer.In 'Carrefour, la grande arnaque', Jérôme Coulombel, a former employee of the group, describes the franchising system as 'a way for Carrefour to extract value on the backs of its franchisees'. According to Oddo BHF, the main question raised by this book from an operational risk point of view is the Group's ability to continue recruiting franchisee candidates.  If the controversy were to take hold, the short-term financial risk would be that the Group would agree to redistribute a little value to disgruntled franchisees", says the broker. The book also discusses negotiations with suppliers and certain tactics, some of which are reprehensible and condemned (such as RCD on the Carrefour side, or cartels on the supplier side). Finally, the book describes the loss of benefits linked to the transition from integrated to franchised stores, and the decline in the number of Carrefour employees in France. While this configuration may be reminiscent of the Orpéa case (a group of retirement homes which found itself at the center of a national controversy after the publication of an investigative book), the risks here are 'much less', according to Oddo BHF. The analyst points to the small number of potentially dissatisfied franchisees (a few hundred, according to the book), as well as Carrefour's financial situation, which is not as indebted as Orpéa was. title: RÉMY COINTREAU :  Barclays downgrades its recommendation
full_text: Barclays downgrades its recommendation on Rémy Cointreau directly from 'overweight' to 'underweight', with a price target reduced from 220 to 128 euros, in a note devoted to the group and its peer Pernod Ricard, also downgraded to 'underweight'.In the summary of its note, the broker points out that "China has benefited from the demographic dividend over the last 20 years, when the key consumer population aged 25 to 45 reached its peak". However, Barclays points out that this population cohort is now in decline, 'which, combined with slower economic growth, is likely to lead to a slowdown in high-end spirits'.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: URW: share price falls, analyst lowers target
full_text: On Thursday, Unibail-Rodamco-Westfield (URW) shares posted one of the biggest declines in the SBF 120 index, as Deutsche Bank lowered its target price for the stock.Shortly before 2:30 pm, the commercial real estate group's shares fell by 0.9%, while at the same time the SBF 120 index advanced by 0.3%.In a sector note, Deutsche Bank explains that it has adjusted its price targets on several players in the sector following the half-year earnings season, while maintaining its recommendations.The broker points out that its recommendation to focus on German residential real estate specialists since January has so far yielded good results, prompting it to renew its buy on Vonovia and Instone.For the rest, the broker maintains its preference for the most defensive stocks in the commercial real estate segment, namely Gecina, Klépierre and CA Immobilien.In this context, Deutsche Bank has lowered its target price for Unibail-Rodamco-Westfield from 55 to 50 euros, while maintaining its 'hold' recommendation on the stock.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. All rights reserved.

title: LVMH :  Barclays lowers recommendation to 'underweight
full_text: Barclays announced on Thursday that it had lowered its recommendation on LVMH shares from 'online weighted' to 'underweight', after a trip to China made it more cautious about the sector.In a research note, the analyst says he spent the whole month of August in China and Hong Kong, talking to brands, experts and investors, and surveying luxury boutiques and distribution networks.As a result, the intermediary explains that weakening demand in the region has made it more cautious about the sector, leading it not only to downgrade LVMH but also to lower its opinion on the sector from 'positive' to 'neutral'.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: SODEXO :  Deutsche Bank raises its price target
full_text: On Thursday, Deutsche Bank maintained its buy recommendation on Sodexo, but raised its price target for the stock from 114 to 117 euros, which it considers "still attractive" and likely to benefit from a number of catalysts.With the foodservices group due to publish its third-quarter results on October 26, the analyst now expects organic growth of 11.1% for an adjusted operating margin of 5.6%.He points out that the consensus is for organic growth of 11% for an operating margin of around 5.5%.In its note, the intermediary believes that Sodexo is on track to achieve the targets it has set itself, i.e. organic growth of 6% to 8% for the 2024/2025 period, accompanied by an operating margin of over 6%.However, due to the planned spin-off of its benefits and rewards business, Deutsche Bank expects the Group to adjust these forecasts to 5% to 7% growth and a margin of between 5.3% and 5.5%.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: Hauck Aufhäuser IB starts Basler with 'Hold' - Target 12 Euro
full_text: HAMBURG (dpa-AFX Broker) - Hauck Aufhäuser Investment Banking has added Basler to its rating with a "hold" and a price target of 12 euros. Analyst Christian Glowa praised the company's position as a global market leader for industrial cameras and image processing solutions in a study available on Thursday and highlighted the high opportunities for structural growth. However, the high investments made during the Corona pandemic have not borne fruit so far, and the group is also suffering from customer restraint. Only after demand and production volumes return should Basler benefit from strong leverage, which should lead to a rapid increase in operating margins./tav/la Publication of the original study: 14.09.2023 / 07:41 / CEST First disclosure of the original study: 14.09.2023 / 07:50 / CEST----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: PERNOD RICARD :  Barclays downgrades its recommendation
full_text: Barclays downgrades its recommendation on Pernod Ricard directly from 'overweight' to 'underweight', with a price target reduced from 241 to 168 euros, in a note devoted to the group and its peer Rémy Cointreau, also downgraded to 'underweight'.In the summary of its note, the broker points out that "China has benefited from the demographic dividend over the last 20 years, when the key consumer population aged 25 to 45 reached its peak". However, Barclays points out that this population cohort is now in decline, 'which, combined with slower economic growth, is likely to lead to a slowdown in high-end spirits'.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: Deutsche Bank Research raises target for Vonovia to 27 euros - 'Buy'.
full_text: FRANKFURT (dpa-AFX Broker) - Deutsche Bank Research raised its target price for Vonovia to 27 euros from 25 euros and left its rating at "buy". He updated his valuation models for the real estate groups after the half-year figures in view of the higher rental growth and continues to be positive on the German residential real estate stocks, analyst Thomas Rothäusler wrote in a sector report available on Thursday. He said most companies had confirmed their earnings outlooks and some had even raised them. His favorites remained Vonovia and Instone./gl/la      Publication of the original study: 14.09.2023 / Time not specified in study / CET First disclosure of the original study: 14.09.2023 / 07:05 / CET----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: LVMH :  RBC lowers price target
full_text: Royal Bank of Canada on Thursday renewed its 'outperform' rating on LVMH, while lowering its target price for the stock from €940 to €890.In a research note published early this morning, the Canadian investment bank explains that it expects the luxury giant's organic growth to slow for the second consecutive time in the third quarter, compared with its two-year average.According to analysts, this proves that the group has entered a phase of decelerating growth after almost seven years of uninterrupted upward cycle, with the exception of the Covid-19 crisis.RBC adds that it sees limited potential for margin appreciation in 2024, which leads it to believe that the consensus is currently too high, and that downward revisions to market forecasts are looming.Finally, the Canadian institution points out that the stock is trading on the basis of a 2024 PER of 21x and an Enterprise Value/Ebit ratio of 18x, two figures above their long-term average.The share is also trading at a 70% premium to the MSCI Europe index, compared with an average of 60%.The investment bank nevertheless maintains a favorable opinion on LVMH, given the group's flexibility in terms of costs and the good protection enjoyed by its margins.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. All rights reserved.The information and analyses published by Cercle Finance are intended solely as a decision-making aid for investors. title: BOUYGUES :  Stifel initiates neutral coverage
full_text: Stifel initiates coverage of Bouygues with a 'neutral' position and a price target of 32 euros, seeing the conglomerate as 'complex, underperforming and requiring a restart to crystallize value'.'The stock could potentially benefit from a turning point in the rates cycle. In the longer term, however, the group will need a significant reorganization of its structure and a cultural renewal', believes the broker.Stifel considers Bouygues to be well valued, but believes that 'margin improvements, as well as a removal of its holding and strategy discounts could potentially unlock some additional value at a later stage'.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: JPMorgan lowers target for MTU to 235 euros - 'Overweight'
full_text: NEW YORK (dpa-AFX Broker) - U.S. bank JPMorgan cut its price target for MTU to 235 euros from 265 euros, but kept its rating at "Overweight". The cost of an unplanned overhaul of GTF engines turned out to be significantly lower than feared, analyst David Perry wrote in a research note presented Thursday. He did lower his estimates for cash generation (FCF) and is now applying lower valuation metrics due to the increased risk profile. However, the share still has 35 percent upside to the new target after its significant decline./gl/zb      Publication of the original study: 14.09.2023 / 02:08 / BST First disclosure of the original study: 14.09.2023 / 02:30 / BST----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: Barclays cuts BMW to 'Underweight' and target to 92.50 euros
full_text: LONDON (dpa-AFX Broker) - U.K. investment bank Barclays downgraded BMW to "underweight" from "equal weight" and cut its price target to 92.50 euros from 107.50 euros. Analyst Henning Cosman wrote of "fear of price normalization" in his research report released Thursday. The signals for the operating profit margin in the second half of the year, which are significantly below the first, support the thesis of a peak in prices and profitability. Contrary to market consensus, Cosman does not expect margins to increase in 2024 and 2025./ag/zb  Publication of the original study: 13.09.2023 / 14:38 / GMT First disclosure of the original study: 13.09.2023 / 15:45 / GMT----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: DASSAULT SYSTÈMES :  share price falls, broker lowers target
full_text: Dassault Systèmes is down nearly 1% in Paris as Barclays today reaffirmed its 'weight in line' recommendation on the stock, with a price target cut from 40 to 37 euros, assessing the competitive risk that Veeva's progress would imply for the life sciences software group's prospects.The broker concludes that the risk of disruption to Dassault's Medidata division is not immediate, but warns that if Veeva were to take a larger share, Medidata might find it difficult to continue outperforming market growth.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: Bernstein leaves BMW at 'Market-Perform' - Target 110 euros
full_text: NEW YORK (dpa-AFX Broker) - U.S. analyst firm Bernstein Research left its rating on BMW at "Market-Perform" with a price target of 110 euros in light of an EU investigation into Chinese e-car subsidies. Concerns over Chinese competition could ease somewhat for European automakers, but there is a retaliation risk conversely, analyst Daniel Roeska wrote in a research note available Wednesday. Renault and Stellantis are likely to benefit particularly as mass-market manufacturers. It's more complicated for Volkswagen, he said, as the Wolfsburg-based company would be hit hardest by countermeasures. Premium manufacturers would also be worse off./tih/la  Publication of the original study: 13.09.2023 / 12:05 / UTC First disclosure of the original study: 13.09.2023 / 12:05 / UTC----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: DZ Bank raises fair value for Lanxess to EUR 29 - 'Hold'.
full_text: FRANKFURT (dpa-AFX Broker) - DZ Bank raised its fair value for Lanxess to 29 euros from 28 euros and left its rating at "hold." Currently, there are no signs that the weak demand for chemical goods will pick up in the short term, analyst Peter Spengler wrote in a study presented on Wednesday. To that extent, he said, "cash is king," so the board is focusing on cash management. Lanxess shares are currently trading well below their book value of 64 euros, which could make the specialty chemicals group an interesting takeover target, similar to Covestro./tih/la      Publication of the original study: 13.09.2023 / 12:46 / CEST First disclosure of the original study: 13.09.2023 / 13:37 / CEST----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: ALSTOM :  Barclays initiates 'underweight' watch list
full_text: Barclays began monitoring Alstom shares on Wednesday, with an 'underweight' recommendation and a price target of 16.5 euros.In a note released this morning, the British investment bank's analysts believe that many problems still persist around the manufacturer of metros, streetcars and high-speed trains.We see a disconnect between a high valuation on the one hand, and businesses in difficulty, factors likely to weigh on cash flow, a high level of debt and a vulnerable credit rating on the other", explains the London-based bank.Against this backdrop, Barclays warns that the slightest disappointment surrounding the stock could have a heavy impact on its share price.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: CRIT :  Oddo BHF remains positive after half-year results
full_text: Oddo BHF has reaffirmed its 'outperform' rating and 88 euro price target on Groupe Crit, following the company's solid first-half results, which support the research firm's estimates for net income attributable to equity holders of the parent.The analyst also considers that 'valuation remains as modest as ever', with a 35% discount to historical ratios. The discount to comparables is over 60%, compared with an average historical discount of less than 40%", he points out.  Despite being smaller than the sector's leaders, Crit's positioning in France and its international expansion do not justify such a discount, especially as its financial structure is particularly solid", adds Oddo BHF.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: JPMorgan leaves Siemens at 'Overweight'
full_text: NEW YORK (dpa-AFX Broker) - U.S. bank JPMorgan left its rating on Siemens at "Overweight." Analyst Andrew Wilson reviewed his expectations for the second half of the year for capital goods companies in a report released Wednesday. He concluded that after a robust first half, outlooks have become more cautious. In most cases, however, this year's expectations remain achievable, he said. In general, he takes a cautious approach to the sector because of a relatively demanding valuation by historical standards. Among the major electrical groups, the expert favors Siemens over Schneider Electric and ABB for the rest of the year./tih/la  Publication of the original study: 12.09.2023 / 23:06 / BST First disclosure of the original study: 13.09.2023 / 00:15 / BST----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: Alstom: share price weighed down by Barclays rating
full_text: On Wednesday, Alstom shares posted the biggest drop on the CAC 40, penalized by an unfavorable note from Barclays analysts, who gave the stock an "underweight" rating.At 1:50 pm, the rail equipment manufacturer's share price was down 4.6% in a Paris market that was also clearly bearish, with the CAC losing 0.6% at the same time.In a note published in the morning, Barclays analysts consider that many problems persist around the manufacturer of metros, streetcars and high-speed trains.We see a disconnect between a high valuation on the one hand, and struggling businesses, factors likely to weigh on cash flow, a high level of debt and a fragile credit rating on the other", explains the British investment bank.Against this backdrop, the London-based bank warns that the slightest disappointment surrounding the stock could have a heavy impact on the share price. Its price target is therefore set at 16.5 euros.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. All rights reserved.

title: JPMorgan leaves BASF at 'Overweight' - Target 58 euros
full_text: NEW YORK (dpa-AFX Broker) - JPMorgan left its rating on BASF at "Overweight" with a price target of 58 euros after a conference held by the US bank. He concluded from a conversation with Group CEO Martin Brudermüller that he believes demand has bottomed out, analyst Chetan Udeshi wrote in a research note issued Wednesday. Demand in August, a rather dull month due to seasonal factors, had apparently been slightly above the chemical group's expectations. However, the manager said he expects the first half of 2024 to remain difficult and not to see a quick V-form recovery./tih/la  Publication of the original study: 13.09.2023 / 00:34 / BST First disclosure of the original study: 13.09.2023 / 00:34 / BST----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: Accor: in the green after a credit rating upgrade
full_text: Accor is up 2%, outperforming the trend in Paris, the day after S&P upgraded its credit rating to investment grade from BB+ to BBB-, with its outlook reduced from positive to stable, according to Stifel.This should pave the way for management to implement its capital allocation plan", says the broker, who reaffirms his "buy" recommendation and price target of 41 euros on the stock, his favorite value in the hotel sector.We would now expect the first tranche of a share buyback program to be implemented in the coming months", says Stifel, pointing out that "the cash distribution of three billion euros is not linked to asset disposals".Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: Hauck Aufhäuser IB leaves Deutz at 'Buy' - Target 8.60 euros
full_text: HAMBURG (dpa-AFX Broker) - Hauck Aufhäuser Investment Banking left its rating for Deutz at "Buy" with a target price of 8.60 euros after a capital market day of the engine manufacturer. title: ENGIE :  favorable outlook, Oddo BHF confirms its recommendation
full_text: Oddo BHF maintains its 'outperform' rating on the share, with an unchanged target price of 18.5 euros, and a favorable outlook, including for the medium term. Following a roadshow organized yesterday by Engie for US investors, Oddo BHF reports that growth targets, particularly in renewable energies (80 GW by 2030), have been confirmed.The analyst also reports that there is no risk of impairment in the US offshore market, where Engie has three projects, held through Ocean Wind (a 50/50 JV between Engie and EDPR). Finally, the analyst cites 'appreciable visibility in nuclear power', where 'the agreement on nuclear liabilities is progressing in line with initial expectations'.Against this backdrop, the broker believes that 2023 results are heading 'at least towards the top end of guidance'. title: Bernstein leaves Lufthansa at 'Underperform' - Target 8 euros
full_text: NEW YORK (dpa-AFX Broker) - U.S. analyst firm Bernstein Research left its rating on Lufthansa at "Underperform" with a price target of 8 euros. A year ago, after a strong summer, he had already asked himself whether a collapse was imminent in the airline industry in the winter, analyst Alexander Irving wrote in a study presented on Tuesday. Early signals now suggest it will be another respectable winter, he said. But airlines entered this period in better shape than a year ago./tih/la  Publication of the original study: 11.09.2023 / 20:48 / UTC First disclosure of the original study: 12.09.2023 / 05:00 / UTC----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: CHARGEURS  :  Solace in museums
full_text:
Solace in museumsEARNINGS/SALES RELEASESChargeurs reported results well below our expectations and aligned with consensus regarding both the top-line and profitability for H1 23, solely due to the cyclical weakness of the industrial protection film business. On the other hand, the Museum Studio division is firmly establishing itself as a group’s new growth lever within the Luxury division. Also worth noting is the good momentum of the group’s new growth drivers, which now account for nearly 60% of group revenue. The drop in profitability, compounded by a significant increase in financial expenses (net debt reaching €194.4m secured by ample credit lines), led to a sharp fall in the group’s net profit to €3.3m (vs. €10.2m).FACT
Chargeurs posted H1 total sales of €352.8m, down 12% organically yoy, driven by a 23.1% organic decline in Advanced Materials (new name for industrial protection film) sales to €146.7m and the pullback of Healthcare Solutions, now irrelevant. 
The Chargeurs Museum Studio division reported a strong increase in sales (+48.5% organic growth yoy) to €61.2m. 
In H1 23, Chargeurs reported a 44.5% fall in operating profit to €14.1m, against a consensus of €15.8m. 
Chargeurs recorded an increase in CFO to €4m versus €0.3m due to lower working capital requirements than in H1 22. 
After capital expenditures and dividends paid for FY-22, cash flow was down by €18m, bringing net debt to €194.4m at the close, corresponding to a leverage ratio of 3.5x. 
Despite these disappointing  results, Chargeurs cautiously expects a gradual rebound in its Advanced Materials division, which should enable it to achieve group global sales of €800m by 2024 and an EBITDA margin in the range of 9-10%.ANALYSISLet’s start by prefacing that Chargeurs Advanced Materials (CAM) division is a macro proxy. In 2021, the division had an exceptional year, with inventories built up by customers wishing to manage supply-chain disruptions in a post-COVID environment. CAM has since faced a significant destocking effect. Although the destocking trend seems to be over, industrial customers remain cautious about the near-term outlook with two pain points: construction at large and Germany. Group sales down 12% organically led to a 44.5% yoy fall in operating profit to €14.1m in H1 23.
Turbulent environment weighs on Chargeurs Advanced Materials 
Chargeurs Advanced Materials reported a 23.1% yoy organic decline in sales to €146.7m. The contraction in sales, in H1 23, was due to lower industrial volumes from customers in the context of energy and inflationary shocks. The division was also penalised by the crisis in the real estate and new construction markets (which account for 25% of its sales). As a result, CAM recorded a 74.4% fall in operating profit to €4.1m, although it successfully remainded positive thanks to a flexible organisation and a breakeven point lowered during recent years. Nevertheless, Chargeurs remains confident that business will inevitably pick up again, as the structural demand for industrial film protection is high and will be driven by i) the end of customer destocking, and ii) growth levers such as industrial equipment, renovation, mobility equipment, high-end household appliance and industrial building markets. It looks as if CAM has not pushed prices beyond the mix effects.
Fashion Technologies margin picks up again
While Chargeurs Fashion Technologies (CFT-PCC) excluding Healthcare Solutions recorded a slight decline in sales 1.3% lfl to €100.5m, the division posted a slight improvement in margin of 0.4ppt to 7.2%. CFT PCC benefited from a favourable customer/product mix coupled with pricing power that enabled it to pass on raw material and energy costs to customers. The division is clearly being pulled by technical textiles for the garment industry among the end-markets and pulled by profitability gains in the organisation.
Museum Studio gains ground as new growth driver
Chargeurs Museum Studio (CMS) achieved a clear beat on our expectations, with organic sales growth of 48.5% to €61.2m against €50.5m expected (€51.9m consensus). Top-line growth was driven by the gradual start-up of projects won in 2021 and 2022. The division’s operating income doubled in H1 23 (vs. H1 22) to €3.8m (vs. €1.8m), bringing the operating margin to 6.2% (up 1.2 ppt). The outlook is promising for the division, which should feel the full effect of the projects won in late 2021 and 2022, with deliveries by late 2023, 2024 and 2025. Chargeurs has confirmed its sales outlook of €120m for 2023 and €150m for 2024. This is an impressive achievement for a business started from scratch.
Chargeurs Personal Goods on the rise
Chargeurs Personal Goods, Chargeurs’ new division representing its ambition towards Quiet Luxury through Altesse Studio and Cambridge Satchel, got off to a good start with H1 23 sales of €4.1m and an operating margin of 4.9%. Chargeurs expects the group’s visibility to increase with i) the opening of Swaine’s flagship store on New Bond Street, London, in June, ii) the use of its products by the film industry, notably Indiana Jones’ Stetson for Swaine, and iii) the visibility linked to the coronation of King Charles III.
Luxury Fibers top-line affected by cyclone 
All is not rosy for the Luxury division, however, with a 25.2% yoy organic decline for Chargeurs Luxury Fibers (CLF) which was negatively impacted by the cyclone that struck New Zealand in February 2023. Despite the decline in top-line growth, CLF nonetheless reported an increase in operating profit to €1.2m, corresponding to margin growth of 1.2 ppt. The division continues to be driven by the roll-out of NATIVA, its blockchain based tracking tools and associated confidence about origins, which is increasingly relied upon by major brands.
A growing level of net debt
Despite the 32.7% drop in EBITDA to €24.9m, the reduction in working capital requirement to €3.2m (vs. €17.8m) led to cash flow generation from operations of €4m, compared with €0.3m in H1 22. However, after capex and the dividend paid for 2022, the net debt position deteriorated from €174.7m in FY-22 to €194.4m in H1 23, increasing the leverage ratio to 3.5x. In addition, the environment of rising interest rates coupled with hyperinflation in Argentina resulted in an increase in financial expenses from €8.8m to €12.4m.  Chargeurs’ average interest rate on its debt might end up being a significant 10% for 2023 (Chargeurs, on the other hand, expects it to be 5%), presumably as the price to pay for ample credit lines. 
In line with higher financial expenses and lower profitability, Chargeurs posted net income down 69% yoy in H1 23 to €3.3m.
A solid 2024 outlook
Assuming a gradual recovery in CAM, Chargeurs aims to achieve sales in excess of €800m in 2024 with an EBITDA margin of 9-10%. 
All in all, notwithstanding the decline in CAM and in the group’s industrial activities, we regard Chargeurs’ paradigm shift and premiumisation in a very positive light, as demand and margin shocks on CAM activities such as the one recorded in H1 23 would have been of much greater stress less than 10 years ago.IMPACTWe will be trimming our FY23 estimates, particularly for CAM, following this release.

title: JPMorgan expects Hellofresh share price driver - 'Analyst Focus List'
full_text: NEW YORK (dpa-AFX) - U.S. bank JPMorgan positively highlighted the securities of Hellofresh on Tuesday. Analyst Marcus Diebel not only put them on the "Analyst Focus List" of particularly interesting investment opportunities. With the status "Positive Catalyst Watch", the expert expects on top of that positive price drivers with the upcoming report on the third quarter.      The cooking box shipper is "ready to exceed expectations," the expert stressed. He spoke of strong momentum in key business metrics (KPIs), low expectations and a still attractive valuation. The fundamental rating has been "Overweight" since April. At that time, Diebel had raised the stock by two investment levels. He had praised the planned expansion with ready meals.      With a price target raised from 31 to 38 euros in Tuesday's study, he sees further upside potential. The old price target had been reached last after a good run. In mid-June, the shares had still oscillated between 18 and 19 euros, but then they had started a rally of more than 70 percent.      His optimism for HelloFresh had been underpinned at a recent investor event in Berlin. He said management expects a strong second half of the year in terms of customer numbers and revenue and margin growth. This is also based on a new plant in the U.S. state of Arizona and a successful launch of ready-to-eat meals in European countries such as the Netherlands and Belgium, he added. As a result, HelloFresh is also likely to take market share from caterers and canteens.      The expert raised his earnings expectations for 2023 and 2024. He was thus up to 10 percent more ambitious than the consensus, although his estimate was thus still well below Hellofresh's 2025 targets. The stock's upside potential pairs with an attractive valuation. He anticipates a strong third quarter and encouraging final quarter statements.      In line with its "Overweight" rating, JPMorgan expects the stock to outperform its respective sector over the next six to 12 months./tih/la/mis      Analyzing institute JPMorgan.      Publication of the original study: 11.09.2023 / 22:33 / BST First disclosure of the original study: 12.09.2023 / 00:15 / BST

title: Delfingen: the post-results uptrend continues
full_text: Delfingen continued its upward trend on Tuesday, gaining nearly 4%, bringing to almost 8% its gains since Friday evening and the presentation of its first-half results.Following this publication, Euroland reiterated its buy recommendation on the automotive equipment supplier's share in the morning, while raising its target price from 62 to 67 euros.In its note, the brokerage firm points out that the specialist in on-board network protection and fluid transfer has once again exceeded its expectations, unveiling half-year results of 'very good quality'.Euroland points out that Delfingen has also revised upwards its current operating margin forecast for 2023, now expected at 6.5% compared with 6% previously.Its analysts also point out that the share is currently trading at eight times their current operating income estimate for 2023, compared with 11x for the sector as a whole.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. All rights reserved.

title: CARBIOS :  Berenberg initiates buy coverage
full_text: On Tuesday, Berenberg initiated coverage of Carbios, the French greentech company behind an enzyme-based biological process for deconstructing plastics and preventing pollution, with a buy recommendation.From the analyst's point of view, the technology developed by Carbios is likely to be a 'game-changer' within the polyethylene terephthalate (PET) packaging recycling industry, by improving the recyclability and circularity of products.According to the intermediary, the interest already shown in the company by several major groups such as L'Oréal, Nestlé Waters and PepsiCo suggests that its technology will soon be adopted.Its price target of 51 euros shows a potential upside of 108%.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: L'ORÉAL :  Deutsche Bank downgrades its recommendation to 'sell
full_text: Deutsche Bank on Tuesday downgraded its advice on L'Oréal to 'sell' from 'hold', with a price target lowered from 385 to 350 euros, concerned about the impact of the slowdown in the Chinese economy on the French cosmetics giant's business.In addition to the deceleration in growth expected in China over the medium term, the analyst explains that he fears a slowdown in the dermatological beauty division due to unfavorable demographic factors, leading him to anticipate "much more modest" growth for the branch.The intermediary points out that the decision to downgrade the stock was taken reluctantly, as he readily acknowledges that L'Oréal remains a 'one-of-a-kind' group capable of innovation and generating attractive profit margins.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com.
