title: SAFRAN :  Oddo BHF maintains its recommendation on the stock
full_text: Following the roadshow organized in Paris, which highlighted "still buoyant winds" for the stock, Oddo BHF confirms its "outperform" rating on Safran shares, with an unchanged target price of €171. Safran's CEOs and CFOs have also confirmed their 2023 targets of sales of at least €23 billion and adjusted EBIT of €3.1 billion.  Even if a lot of the good news we were expecting has been unveiled (share buybacks, price increases, etc.), the PW1100's difficulties certainly open up an optionality that the consensus is not taking into account today (price effect and/or market share evolution)", stresses the analyst. As a reminder, the PW1100 is a rival engine (developed by Pratt & Whitney) and equips the A320neo. This engine is currently experiencing difficulties after contaminants were detected in the powdered metal used in certain parts of the turbine. Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: Carbios: share price rises, Berenberg initiates a buy recommendation
full_text: Carbios is gaining ground on the stock market this Tuesday in the wake of a positive note from Berenberg, which has initiated a buy recommendation on the stock.The greentech company's stock, which has developed an enzyme-based biological process to deconstruct plastics and prevent pollution, gained 2.4% in a slightly down Paris market (-0.2%).The stock is still down 22% since the start of the year.For Berenberg, the technology developed by Carbios is likely to be a 'game-changer' within the polyethylene terephthalate (PET) packaging recycling industry, by improving the recyclability and circularity of products.In its view, the interest already shown in the company by several major groups such as L'Oréal, Nestlé Waters and PepsiCo suggests that its technology will soon be adopted.Its price target of 51 euros thus reveals a potential upside of 108%.Carbios completed a 141 million euro capital increase this summer, the largest carried out on Euronext Growth since 2015. The group is due to publish its half-year results on September 28.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. All rights reserved.

This exceeded Stifel's expectations, enabling it to raise its adjusted EPS estimate for 2023 by 10%.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: BIC :  opinion upgraded by Oddo BHF
full_text: Oddo BHF has raised its opinion on Bic from 'neutral' to 'outperform', with the target price maintained at 73 euros, 'given the undeniable value character of the stock (EV/ROC of six times, FCF yield of around 9%)'. The research department welcomes the update of the strategic plan, which it sees as "a good step towards reiterating the company's growth-oriented strategy", and points to good financial discipline geared towards FCF generation."The balance between reinvestment in growth and cash return to shareholders has been maintained. This plan reflects a certain degree of continuity with the initial plan, with a degree of confidence that remains unchanged", he continues.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. But there is still a lot of uncertainty about the timing, he added./gl/la      Original study publication date: 11.09.2023 / 19:05 / GMT First disclosure of the original study: 11.09.2023 / 19:05 / GMT----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: SOCIETE GENERALE :  Oddo BHF confirms its recommendation ahead of the CMD
full_text: Oddo BHF maintains its 'outperform' rating on Société Générale shares, with an unchanged target price of 33 euros, as the group's new CEO organizes the next CMD (investor day) on September 18. According to Oddo BHF, the day will provide an opportunity to review the implementation of the Group's strategy, with a particular focus on retail banking, Boursorama and specialized financial services. The expected evolution of the Group's capital should be at the heart of investors' attention. The Group is expected to explain the expected trajectory of its CET1 ratio, which stood at 13.0% at the end of last June on a fully loaded basis", stresses the analyst, who believes that "the policy of returning capital to shareholders should not be modified".  Beyond the announcements of the next CMD, which we believe are already widely expected by the market, we believe that the re-rating of the share should come in the coming months from the prospects of a strong rebound in NI in 2024 and 2025", adds the broker. Oddo BHF expects NI to rise by +35% and +14% respectively in 2024 and 2025, while the consensus is for +37% and +15%. Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: SCHNEIDER ELECTRIC :  Deutsche Bank raises its target
full_text: Deutsche Bank on Monday raised its target price for Schneider Electric shares from €170 to €175, believing that the automation sector has entered a "golden age"."Since the Covid, manufacturing specialists have been confronted with supply chain disruptions and labor shortages", the analyst recalls in a note.They have had to cope with increased volatility on the consumer demand side, as well as pressure to reduce waste and improve energy and resource efficiency", he adds.In Deutsche Bank's view, this greater fragmentation - combined with the need to make major investments - can only be solved by increasing reliance on automation and digitization of projects.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: Barclays starts Siemens with 'Underweight' - Target 122 euros
full_text: LONDON (dpa-AFX) - U.K.-based investment bank Barclays has initiated its rating on Siemens with an "underweight" rating and a target price of 122 euros. The investment rating on the industrial group's shares could run out of steam, analyst Vladimir Sergievskiy wrote in a research note issued Monday. The peak order and margin environment is normalizing, free cash flow is probably not as good as perceived by the market, and bold new structural measures seem complex or unlikely, he said. Siemens is a victim of its own success, the expert summed up. Moreover, Siemens' papers were expensive for such a large, complex and mature company./la/gl      Publication of the original study: 10.09.2023 / 21:09 / GMT First disclosure of the original study: 11.09.2023 / 04:10 / GMT----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: TOTALENERGIES :  RBC raises its price target
full_text: On Friday, Royal Bank of Canada raised its target price for TotalEnergies from €60 to €65, while maintaining its 'in-line performance on the sector' rating.With less than three weeks to go before the Group's Investor Day on September 27, RBC expects Total to unveil its medium-term outlook, including the growth potential of its upstream portfolio, which is likely to be extended."TotalEnergies shares have performed strongly in recent months, and this meeting should be an opportunity to confirm the Group's strategic discipline", says the broker.The analyst believes that the French energy giant could also take the opportunity to present some possible candidates for the succession of Patrick Pouyanné, its CEO for almost ten years.The intermediary believes that the meeting could also be an opportunity to question its continued development in low-carbon energies after the recent emergence of problems linked to the commissioning of its projects in this field.On the other hand, RBC does not expect the Group's shareholder remuneration policy to be called into question.However, the research firm maintains its 'in-line performance' opinion on the stock, seeing further opportunities within the sector after the stock's recent rise.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: Bernstein leaves BMW at 'Market-Perform' - Target 110 euros
full_text: NEW YORK (dpa-AFX) - U.S. analyst firm Bernstein Research left its rating on BMW at "Market-Perform" with a price target of 110 euros. Analyst Daniel Roeska took a closer look at the impact of European emissions regulations on Europe's automaker in an industry report released Friday. His forecast on the introduction of battery electric vehicles (BEVs) does not see an abrupt turnaround in market penetration in this area, but a steady increase over time. As a result, Roeska favors BMW's strategy of offering a balanced portfolio of BEVs and fossil fuel-powered cars well into the 2030s./ck/tih      Publication of the original study: 07.09.2023 / 19:49 / UTC  First disclosure of the original study: 08.09.2023 / 03:51 / UTC----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: CTS Eventim recovers strongly thanks to buy recommendation
full_text: FRANKFURT (dpa-AFX Broker) - Shares in CTS Eventim recovered at times by more than six percent to 59.20 euros on Friday following a buy recommendation from Bank of America (BofA). The papers of the ticket retailer and event organizer thus rebounded significantly from the chart support at 55 euros, to which they had almost fallen back on Thursday.      Analyst Daria Nasledysheva now rates the shares as "Buy", even though she significantly lowered the price target from 75 to 60 euros. With her earnings estimates, she is nevertheless up to 9 percent more optimistic than the market consensus.       The recent price correction offers a good entry opportunity in the shares of the market leader in the structurally growing live events segment. With a price/earnings ratio of 22, the shares are too cheap - both compared to the company's own history before the Corona crisis and the forecast growth in earnings./ag/jha/zb

title: SAP stable against the trend - record high in sight
full_text: FRANKFURT (dpa-AFX Broker) - SAP is swimming against the tide in the weaker market environment: the securities of the Walldorf-based software manufacturer gained up to one percent to 131.64 euros on Friday morning. In the chart, the path to the record high from 2020 at a good 143 euros is clear.      On Thursday, SAP had announced that the software management company LeanIX will be acquired. According to UBS expert Michael Briest, the solutions of the purchased company should make it easier for SAP customers to switch to the cloud. In his current commentary, Briest considers the possible valuation of 1.2 billion euros calculated by "Handelsblatt" to be plausible.       With a stock market value of just over 160 billion euros, SAP is by far the most valuable group in Germany. Siemens and Airbus follow in second and third place with just under 108 billion euros and 106 billion euros respectively. SAP has gained a lead of more than 60 percent since the interim low at the end of September./ag/zb

title: GENFIT :  Oddo BHF raises its target price
full_text: Oddo BHF reaffirms its 'outperform' rating on Genfit and raises its target price from 8.8 to 9.3 euros, despite good Phase III trial results unveiled the previous day by Cymabay, Ipsen/Genfit's main competitor in primary biliary cholangitis.There are real differences, particularly in terms of pruritus, but the primary endpoint of reduced ALP (alkaline phosphatase) is, after reprocessing, very good for French companies", he points out.In terms of time to market, elafibranor is therefore mechanically a few months ahead of schedule", continues the analyst, who does not alter his market assumptions, with a launch of this product in 2024 and peak sales of 411 million euros in 2030.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: RUBIS :  Oddo BHF lowers its target slightly
full_text: Oddo BHF maintains its 'neutral' rating on Rubis shares, with a target price reduced from 27 to 25 euros, as the company last night published half-year net earnings of 171 ME, up 1% but slightly below expectations (ODDO/consensus = 175/180 ME). Rubis was impacted by significant foreign exchange losses (-55 ME net). Oddo BHF nonetheless points out that, at operating level, "performance was satisfactory overall", with ROC up 32% to 323 ME.While Rubis confirms its objective of net income growth by 2023, Oddo BHF is more cautious, believing that the heavy currency losses justify greater prudence. The analyst is therefore lowering its net income forecast for 2023 by 7%, to 325 ME, but specifies that this estimate has 'no impact on its forecasts for subsequent years'. title: Berenberg raises target for BMW to 102 euros - 'Hold'
full_text: HAMBURG (dpa-AFX Broker) - Private bank Berenberg raised its price target for BMW to 102 euros from 99 euros after an analyst change and left its rating at "Hold". Supply chain risks eased in the auto sector, but demand concerns took center stage, analyst Romain Gourvil, who now covers BMW, wrote in a research note issued Friday. He revised his assumptions for manufacturers downward through 2025, citing economic concerns and price-mix erosion driven by competition. He said a lot of positives are priced in for BMW, while he prefers Mercedes-Benz for valuation reasons./ajx/zb      Publication of the original study: 07.09.2023 / 16:11 / GMT First disclosure of the original study: Date in study not specified / Time in study not specified / Time zone in study not specified----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

Vinci Energies and COBRA IS, in particular, seem to be in the right position for the long term", says Stifel.The analyst firm also reports that the succession issue has been discussed, pointing to continuity beyond 2025.Finally, "we believe that the tax problem facing the Group in its French freeway business is exaggerated", concludes the broker. full_text: Berenberg announced on Thursday that it had added SES-imagotag to its list of "EU mid-caps top picks", alongside six other stocks including Euroapi.From the German broker's point of view, the stock of the specialist in electronic labels for e-commerce is trading at an "attractive discount" following the Gotham City Research attacks, with a share price that does not fully reflect its status as a market leader.The broker also expects the French group to benefit from the growing adoption of electronic shelf labels, as well as from an improvement in its profit margins.Berenberg has therefore issued a buy recommendation on the stock, together with a price target of 215 euros.Berenberg's 'European Mid-Cap' list comprises the 15 analysts' favorite stocks among the 142 companies the brokerage firm currently tracks.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. full_text: ZURICH (dpa-AFX Broker) - Swiss major bank UBS has left Bilfinger at "buy" with a price target of 42 euros after announcing an acquisition. The industrial services provider is acquiring parts of the Stork Group in the Netherlands and Belgium as well as smaller units in Germany and the U.S. at a price that appears attractive, analyst Gregor Kuglitsch wrote in a research note published Thursday. title: DEEZER :  Euroland initiates coverage with a fair value of three euros
full_text: Euroland initiated coverage of Deezer shares on Thursday, with a fair value of just under three euros per share.In a research note, the brokerage firm points out that the pioneering music streaming platform, founded in 2007, now enjoys strong positions in France, where it is number two in the market, and in Brazil, where it is the third-largest player in the sector.While Euroland believes that the company now enjoys a 'central' position within the segment, its analysts also consider that it is well positioned to accelerate in its market.With a renewed management team, the group has set itself concrete targets for the coming years", they emphasize, pointing out that the company is aiming for significant annual growth over the next three yearsDeezer is also targeting positive cash flow generation in 2024 and positive adjusted EBITDA in 2025, they add.For the current financial year, Euroland expects sales of €492.8 million, representing growth of 9.2%.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. full_text: NEW YORK (dpa-AFX) - U.S. investment bank Goldman Sachs left Deutsche Telekom shares at "buy" with a price target of 27.20 euros after announced distributions from subsidiary T-Mobile US. T-Mobile US' cash burn was largely in line with expectations, analyst Andrew Lee wrote in a research note presented Thursday. At the same time, this should indirectly help the T-share to be revalued. After all, the subsidiary's plans are likely to support the parent company raising its own payout ratio from about 4 percent this year to a mid-to-high single-digit percentage amount in 2024 and beyond./ck/ajx      Publication of the original study: 06.09.2023 / 20:22 / BST  First disclosure of original study: Date not specified in study / Time not specified in study / Time zone not specified in study----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: BOIRON :  Oddo BHF raises its target price on the stock
full_text: Oddo BHF maintains its 'outperform' rating on Boiron shares, with its target price raised from €49 to €52.5. The analyst reports that net income came to 15.5 ME in the 1st half (vs. 12.5 ME in H1 22), benefiting in particular from the rise in investment income from 0.5 ME to 3.8 ME, thanks to higher interest rates.Although operating income came in at 17.8 ME - a little below expectations - the analyst believes that "the amounts are small enough to be of little significance in terms of a real disappointment, and without any real consequences...".According to Oddo BHF, the stock market issue is elsewhere, since a proposed takeover bid is underway (50 E or 39.64 E after payment of the 10.36 E dividend). What's at stake is more a question of blocking any withdrawal that certain shareholders might attempt, rather than momentum or the 2023 earnings sequence. Against this backdrop, Oddo BHF is raising its price target to reflect the fact that the stock is worth more than the current draft offer price. Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: SENSORION :  H.C. Wainwright initiates buy coverage
full_text: H.C. Wainwright initiated coverage of Sensorion shares this week, with a Buy recommendation and a target of three euros.In a research note published on Tuesday, the US research firm praises Sensorion's positioning in the hearing loss treatment market, which it believes has been strengthened by recent clinical studies and new financing.In its study, the research firm particularly hails the entry into the capital of Redmile, a Californian investor in the healthcare sector, now the company's largest shareholder.According to H.C. Wainwright, the arrival of this 'reference' investor sends a positive signal to the market, and could lead to the arrival of other US-based investors in the near future.The analyst also notes that two of Sensorion's direct competitor biotechs have very recently been acquired by 'big pharmas', namely Akouos taken over by Eli Lilly at the end of 2022, and Decibel acquired by Regeneron last month.For Wainwright, these transactions reinforce Sensorion's status as a potential takeover target, with the research firm considering Novartis as the most likely acquirer given its strong presence in Europe and its expertise in hearing loss and gene therapies.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. full_text: UBS reaffirms its 'buy' recommendation on Orange, while reducing its target price from 12.7 to 12.1 euros, a new target that leaves 17% upside potential for the shares of the incumbent French telecoms operator.'Orange offers visibility on FCF growth, low debt and M&A optionality at a price below the sector. The stability of EBITDAaL France from the first half of 2024 onwards is a key catalyst', argues the broker.UBS also points out that, like other companies in the sector, Orange has positioned itself to benefit from ESG trends, mentioning for example its initiatives to increase network efficiency and switch to renewable energy sources.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: CHARGEURS :  Oddo BHF lowers its target price
full_text: While maintaining its 'outperform' rating on Chargeurs, Oddo BHF has lowered its target price from 19 to 14 euros, following a half-yearly publication judged to be mixed, and given the rather limited visibility for the second half of the year.The research firm has lowered its 2023 scenario for Chargeurs, now anticipating sales of 735 million euros, with a sharper decline in the Advanced Materials division (-10%), as well as operating income of 34 million euros, representing an OMC of 4.6% (-150 basis points).  The end of the year will remain complicated, but base effects will become more favorable again, and the rebound in activity should be confirmed over 2024", moderates Oddo BHF, which also sees the planned acquisition in the luxury goods sector as "potentially a real catalyst in the medium term".Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: Bernstein leaves Beiersdorf at 'Outperform' - Target 130 euros
full_text: NEW YORK (dpa-AFX Broker) - U.S. analyst firm Bernstein Research left Beiersdorf at "Outperform" with a price target of 130 euros. Analyst Bruno Monteyne dealt with the costs that a turn towards "sustainable Palmol" would have in a study on the household and consumer goods sector available on Wednesday. Contrary to what many companies claim, Palmol's sourcing has not been sustainable to date, he said. In the medium term, the so-called RSPO certification (Roundtable for Sustainable Palm Oil) would have to be expanded with additional factors such as traceability and reforestation. This will eat into the profit margins of many companies. In the long term, the cost pressure will be even higher, as companies will sooner or later look for more expensive alternatives to palm oil. Reasons include rising prices for vegetable oils and lower yields due to climate change./ck/mis/la      Publication of the original study: 05.09.2023 / 16:20 / UTC  First disclosure of the original study: 06.09.2023 / 04:00 / UTC----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: VALLOUREC :  Oddo BHF confirms its recommendation on the stock
full_text: Oddo BHF maintains its 'outperform' rating on Vallourec shares, with an unchanged target price of 21 euros, as Vallourec holds its CMD (investor day) on September 12 in London.This will be the first CMD since the mid-2021 financial restructuring, which saw the Apollo fund enter the capital (via the conversion of debt into equity) as a reference shareholder (28.5% of the capital) and the arrival of new management.  As a reminder, Vallourec has decided to launch a process to sell or close its production units in Germany by the end of 2021", says the analyst, who points out that deleveraging is accelerating.  In Q2 23, net debt stood at 868 ME (around 1 MdE at the end of Q1 23 and 2.2 MdE at the end of 2020, before the financial restructuring) and Vallourec expects further deleveraging in H2 23', continues the broker. According to Oddo BHF, the Group could take advantage of this deleveraging to communicate on its future shareholder return policy, since Vallourec has not paid a dividend for almost 10 years.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: Goldman raises target for Adidas to 210 euros - 'Neutral'
full_text: NEW YORK (dpa-AFX) - Goldman Sachs raised its price target for Adidas to 210 euros from 195 euros, but left its rating at "neutral." Analyst Richard Edwards updated his models on households' available cash in an industry report on European retail available Wednesday. At the same time, he noted that concerns at the start of the year that fashion retailers would struggle to pass on cost pressures were not borne out in most cases. Rather, he said, sales growth had been strong and margins relatively stable. His "buy" verdicts focused on companies that are achieving particularly high sales growth or high free cash flows in an environment with little or no inflation. He highlighted Puma, Inditex, JD Sports and B&M in particular./ck/tih      Publication of the original study: 05.09.2023 / 20:06 / BST  First disclosure of original study: Date not specified in study / Time not specified in study / Time zone not specified in study----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: Rubis: the stock joins Portzamparc's 'High Five
full_text: Rubis shares are bucking the Paris market trend, rising on Wednesday morning as Portzamparc analysts added the downstream oil specialist to their 'High Five' list of preferred stocks.In its note, the research firm refers to "growth at a discount", as it forecasts growth of at least 30% in the Group's net income this year, while its Enterprise Value/Ebitda multiple stands at 4.9x, far from its five-year average of 9.2x.Portzamparc has issued a 'buy' recommendation on the stock, together with a price target of 36.6 euros, indicating a 70% upside potential.At around 10:40 am, the share price was up 0.4%, after having gained up to 0.7% at the start of the session.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: TotalEnergies: share price up, analyst confirms his recommendation
full_text: TotalEnergies gains more than 1.5% in Paris as Jefferies maintains its buy rating on the stock with an unchanged price target of 66 euros, three weeks ahead of the company's next CMD (investor day) on September 27.The analyst sees upside potential in relation to TotalEnergies' volumetric targets, particularly in oil, LNG and renewable energies.Excluding Russia, TotalEnergies currently plans to increase its LNG production to 18 million tons per year in 2027 and 25 million tons per year in 2030 (from 11 million tons per year in 2022), the analyst reports.According to Jefferies, TotalEnergies is also expected to provide information on its oil production in Namibia and Suriname at the CMD.Finally, following the acquisition of the remaining 69.4% of EREN in July, TotalEnergies should be able to improve its renewable energy capacity targets (gross capacity of 35 GW by 2025 and 100 GW by 2030), believes Jefferies. title: SANOFI :  Berenberg upgrades its recommendation to 'buy
full_text: On Tuesday, Berenberg raised its recommendation on Sanofi from "hold" to "buy", with a price target raised from 107 to 115 euros, judging the stock to be undervalued despite a "pipeline" that is tending to improve.In a note, Berenberg points out that the pharmaceutical group has had a discounted stock market valuation for over ten years now, due to its inability to build a portfolio of drug projects deemed attractive.The analyst, who points out that research and development (R&D) efforts take time to materialize, explains that he has nevertheless observed the first signs of improvement in the profitability of the laboratory's R&D investments.In view of the depressed valuation of the stock, Berenberg believes that the risk of disappointment regarding the 'pipeline' is now limited, while any good surprises are, in his view, not factored into the share price.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: Orsted Shares Fall Further After Moody's Downgrade
full_text:
By Dominic Chopping 
  Orsted continues to suffer a hangover from last week's large writedowns, with shares down 8% on Tuesday after credit rating agency Moody's downgraded the company's outlook to negative from stable. 

  The Danish energy company said on Aug. 30 that it would be taking impairments of up to 16 billion Danish kroner ($2.32 billion), mainly related to U.S. offshore wind projects, which sent its shares down 25% on the day. 

  Moody's said Tuesday that the projects haven't yet been given the go-ahead to proceed, but if they do, capital expenditure to build them will likely be higher and future internal rates of return will likely be lower than previously expected. 

  "Whereas the impairments don't change the company's earnings before interest, tax, depreciation and amortization guidance or expected investment levels in 2023, Moody's expects the headwinds that Orsted is currently facing in the U.S. to lead to its credit metrics being weakly positioned at least until the end of 2025," it said. 
  Write to Dominic Chopping at dominic.chopping@wsj.com 
  (END) Dow Jones Newswires

  09-05-23 0835ET

title: BARCLAYS :  Commerzbank's interest income under pressure - 'Underweight'.
full_text: LONDON (dpa-AFX) - British investment bank Barclays is critical of Commerzbank 's future earnings performance. The sharp rise in key interest rates had so far helped the financial institution become more profitable and significantly widened the scope for distributions to shareholders, analyst Amit Goel wrote in a research note published on Tuesday. In the meantime, however, the risks are increasing and the net interest income could disappoint investors.      Therefore, the expert downgraded the shares from "Equal Weight" to "Underweight". Thus, Goel expects them to underperform in the coming twelve months compared to other stocks in the banking sector. He also cut his price target from 12.50 euros to 10.80 euros.      In particular, the Barclays analyst expects net interest income to fall in Commerzbank's core business in 2024, as key interest rates have now stabilized after their sharp rise. Commerzbank has been a big beneficiary of rising interest rates so far, he said. Now, however, the risks outweighed the opportunities, although the stock's valuation still appeared undemanding. Goel's estimates for Commerzbank's earnings development in 2024 and 2025, for example, are around ten percent below the consensus estimates.      According to the Barclays expert, Commerzbank is likely to publish its medium-term targets for the period after 2024 at the beginning of November, with the figures for the third quarter. While this is certainly interesting, he does not expect any positive surprises.      On average, a return on equity (RoTE) of 9 to 10 percent is already expected for 2025, but "such a profitability level would still be below the industry average and is also highly dependent on the development of interest rates," he qualifies.      With regard to capital distributions, Goel is also critical of the fact that Commerzbank is not in a position to distribute more than 50 percent of its 2023 profit, part of which will also be returned by the end of the year in the form of share buybacks. In the medium term, distributions are likely to rise to 70 percent, but he sees "no positive surprise" in this either./ck/mis/jha/      Publication of the original study: 04.09.2023 / 23:12 / GMT First circulation of the original study: 05.09.2023 / 04:10 / GMT

full_text: LONDON (dpa-AFX Broker) - U.K. investment bank HSBC downgraded Fresenius to "hold" from "buy," but left its price target at 33 euros. The big question remains which parts of the company the healthcare group will divest as it restructures, analyst Sezgi Oezener wrote in a research note published Tuesday. She expects announcements with a financial volume of more than 5 billion euros in the coming six to twelve months. However, as there is still a lack of clear evidence for major restructuring measures, she rated the shares as "hold" for now. Moreover, the debt ratio would probably hardly improve even if the dialysis subsidiary Fresenius Medical Care (FMC) were sold./mis/ajx  Publication of the original study: 04.09.2023 / 13:06 / GMT First disclosure of the original study: 05.09.2023 / 01:00 / GMT----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: Sanofi: share price rises, Berenberg deems stock cheap
full_text: On Tuesday morning, Sanofi shares were the biggest risers on the CAC 40 on the Paris Bourse, while Berenberg considered the stock to be poorly valued despite a pipeline that is tending to improve.At around 11:30 am, the stock was up 1.2%, while at the same time the CAC 40 index was down 0.5%.In a note, Berenberg points out that the pharmaceutical group's share price has been at a discount for over ten years, due to its inability to build a portfolio of drug projects deemed attractive.The analyst, who points out that research and development (R&D) efforts take time to materialize, explains that he has nevertheless observed the first signs of improvement in the profitability of the laboratory's R&D investments.In view of the share's depressed valuation, Berenberg believes that the risk of disappointment regarding the 'pipeline' is now limited, while any good surprises are, in its view, not priced in.Against this backdrop, the intermediary raises its recommendation on the share from 'hold' to 'buy', with a price target raised from €107 to €115.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. All rights reserved.

title: Crédit Agricole falls back, Goldman Sachs upgrades to "sell".
full_text: Crédit Agricole shares fell on the Paris Bourse on Tuesday, after Goldman Sachs lowered its recommendation to "sell" from "neutral", citing an outlook inconsistent with the group's valuation.               On the Paris Bourse, at around 09:00 GMT, the stock was down 2.65%, the lantern of the CAC 40, down 0.84% at the same time.               "By 2023, Crédit Agricole has outperformed its peers and is currently trading at a premium to the sector," point out Goldman Sachs analysts in their note.               They justify their downgrade by the slowdown in earnings growth, the valuation premium and the lower capital payout compared with competitors.               Goldman Sachs notes that its outlook for 2024 and 2025 is down, whereas the consensus has been up since the beginning of the year, placing its EPS forecast for 2025 7% below consensus.               "When we compare Crédit Agricole to its Eurozone peers, taking into account growth prospects and current valuation, we find that Crédit Agricole's value is lower," the analysts write.               "Around 90% of the eurozone banks we cover are expected to grow earnings faster than Crédit Agricole over the next two years, while only around 20% are trading at a higher multiple" than Crédit Agricole, Goldman Sachs adds.               Of the 20 analysts covering Crédit Agricole, four recommend "Strong Buy" or "Buy", 12 "Hold" and four recommend "Strong Sell" or "Sell", according to data from LSEG. (Written by Clément Martinot, French version by Corentin Chappron, edited by Blandine Hénault)

title: THALES :  Jefferies upgrades its recommendation to 'buy
full_text: On Monday, Jefferies raised its recommendation on Thales from 'hold' to 'buy', with an upwardly revised target price of €140 to €160, representing a potential upside of 18%.In a note published this morning, the teams from the American research consultancy hailed the shift towards cybersecurity by the defense electronics group.According to its analysts, the French group now presents a 'more attractive' profile following the completion of two acquisitions that will enable it to accelerate its growth.Jefferies also highlights the accelerating momentum of the Rafale, to which it is highly exposed, with the receipt of 18 new orders from Indonesia this summer, not counting purchase options on a further 18 aircraft, ahead of the 26 units to be delivered to India in 2024.The research firm is also relieved by the materialization of factors that had been weighing on the stock, such as the loss of the Telesat contract, or the disappearance altogether of causes for concern, such as a possible acquisition of Atos.He also notes that the Group's share buyback program is now well underway, with an end not scheduled before March 2024.All these factors lead him to anticipate a "significant" improvement in the company's free cash flow (FCF) over the 2023-2025 period.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: Bernstein upgrades Siemens to 'Outperform' and target to 169 euros
full_text: NEW YORK (dpa-AFX Broker) - U.S. analyst firm Bernstein Research upgraded Siemens from "market perform" to "outperform" and raised its price target to 169 euros from 161 euros. The long-term outlook for the capital goods sector remains good, but investors should be prepared for a "hiccup" in the third quarter in the wake of a post-Corona normalization, analyst Nicholas Green wrote in an industry report available Monday. That's when orders are likely to fall in many sectors and price momentum will slow. In this environment, investors should focus on companies active in the electrical engineering and automation and software sectors. Here, Siemens is the most broadly positioned. Other favorites are Schneider Electric and Legrand because of their focus on the renewal of electrical engineering. ABB, on the other hand, first needs clearer communication in terms of strategy and software. The expert remains cautious on Siemens Energy due to the burdens from Gamesa and on Kion, as the growth expectations of many investors are too high here and the debt ratio has risen./mis/la  Publication of the original study: 02.09.2023 / 14:05 / UTC First disclosure of the original study: 04.09.2023 / 05:00 / UTC----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: IDI  :  Adjustment following Omnes acquisition
full_text: Adjustment following Omnes acquisitionEPS CHANGECHANGE IN EPS2023 : € 6.45 vs 2.20 +193%2024 : € 8.13 vs 2.57 +216%In line with the solid divestments made by IDI in 2023, we have revised upwards our estimates of the variation in fair value, which were too conservative for 2023 and 2024. title: AIR FRANCE-KLM :  Oddo BHF remains 'neutral', reduces its target price
full_text: Oddo BHF maintains its 'neutral' rating on the Air France - KLM share, with a price target reduced from 21 to 17.5 euros (post-capital reduction) in order to 'act a little more cautiously on unit costs'. The company carried out a reverse stock split of all outstanding shares and a capital reduction by reducing the par value of each share, with the exchange of 10 shares for 1 new share with a par value of E1.After a fine summer season, we anticipate a stable yield passage in Q3 2023 compared with Q3 2022 (but an increase of c25% compared with 2019, driven by the Americas) and a decline of c5% yoy over Q4 in order to integrate the slightly dilutive effect of the return of capacity', stresses Oddo BHF. The broker is now counting on the Investor Day to be held on November 7, believing that it 'will be key to restoring confidence in the company's ability to neutralize the effects of inflation'.Although Air France-KLM believes it has resolved its negative equity problems (via the transactions finalized with Apollo (500 ME based on MRO components and 1.5 MdE on the Flying Blue frequent flyer system), Oddo BHF continues to prefer Ryanair in this sector. title: RBC leaves BMW at 'Sector Perform' - Target 108 euros
full_text: NEW YORK (dpa-AFX Broker) - Canadian bank RBC left its rating on BMW at "Sector Perform" with a price target of 108 euros after meetings with the automaker's management. Contrary to some investors' fears, the momentum for electric vehicles is not slowing, analyst Tom Narayan wrote in a research note presented Monday. In addition, BMW is performing better than the Chinese market as a whole, where competition is fierce, especially in the mass market. Similarly, BMW is also not worried about Chinese e-car makers entering the European market, he added./mis/la  Publication of the original study: 03.09.2023 / 21:20 / EDT First disclosure of the original study: 03.09.2023 / 21:20 / EDT----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: Berenberg raises Telefonica Deutschland to 'Hold' - Target 1.80 euros
full_text: HAMBURG (dpa-AFX Broker) - Private bank Berenberg upgraded Telefonica Deutschland to "Hold" from "Sell," but lowered its price target to 1.80 euros from 2.00 euros. Shares fell by about 30 percent after the "black swan" event, when 1&1 announced a cooperation with Vodafone at the beginning of August - and this did not even reflect the full downside potential, analyst Usman Ghazi wrote in a study available Monday. Such a crisis, however, inevitably leaves compromises to be sought with a view to spectrum leasing and a bypass of Huawei, taking the worst-case scenario of a halving of the dividend off the table. The analyst now expects a 30 percent cut in the payout in 2024, which he sees as supporting his price target of EUR 1.80, which is largely in line with the current price./ajx/mis      Publication of the original study: 03.09.2023 / 09:44 / GMT First disclosure of the original study: Date not stated in study / Time not stated in study / Time zone not stated in study----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: Eramet: share price falls, broker lowers target
full_text: Eramet is down nearly 2% in Paris as AlphaValue lowered its recommendation on the stock on Friday, from 'accumulate' to 'lighten up', with a target price reduced from 76.5 to 68.9 euros.In a note issued midday, the research firm explains that the mining group's valuation will necessarily be affected by geopolitical risk.While acknowledging that the situation could change rapidly in either direction, AlphaValue considers its change of target to be moderate for the time being, wishing to give the company the "benefit of the doubt" in view of the uncertainties still surrounding Gabon's future and the evolution of its relations with the French group.However, the independent firm points out that these troubles come at a time when Eramet is already facing a difficult environment, with falling commodity prices in all its businesses, which had already led AlphaValue to lower its target price in early August.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. All rights reserved.

title: PERNOD RICARD :  Deutsche Bank reduces its price target
full_text: On Friday, Deutsche Bank reduced its price target for Pernod Ricard from 162 to 159 euros, while maintaining its 'sell' recommendation on the stock.While noting that the wine and spirits group's annual results came in above expectations in terms of organic growth, the analyst notes that both net profit and operating profit came in below expectations.Although Pernod reiterated its sales growth target at the upper end of a range of between +4% and +7%, and an expansion in operating margin before non-recurring items of between +50 and +60 basis points, he adds, its management team refused to endorse these forecasts for the 2023/2024 financial year.Its management has also spoken of a relatively slow start to the financial year, due to an unfavorable base effect and economic difficulties in China, continues DB.The intermediary is also concerned about the difficulties encountered by consumption outside the home in China, and in particular the bad patch experienced by the country's nightclubs, which add to concerns about activity in the United States.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: PERNOD RICARD :  Oddo BHF confirms its outperform rating on the stock
full_text: Oddo BHF maintains its Outperform rating on Pernod Ricard shares, with an unchanged price target of 217 euros. The broker believes that yesterday's market reaction (-6%) to the announcement of results can be explained by the publication of current diluted EPS, which came in 4% below expectations, and by a potential adjustment of -2% on the EPS24 growth rate."We therefore see no specific sanction behind this market reaction, even if some might see it as a reaction to a lack of visibility", says the broker. While Oddo BHF believes that the start of the year does not look promising, it continues to believe that the fundamentals of the sector and of the Group remain promising in terms of profitable growth.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: RENAULT :  UBS downgrades recommendation to 'sell
full_text: On Friday, UBS downgraded its recommendation on Renault shares to 'sell' from 'neutral' and sharply reduced its price target from 42 to 31 euros.In a note published this morning, the Swiss bank's analysts predict a "hard landing" for the automotive group, worrying in particular about the growing competition from Chinese manufacturers, but also from Tesla."With around 70% of its sales exposed to Europe and a 10% market share on the continent, Renault is one of the most vulnerable players", writes UBS.The Swiss bank also doubts that the planned IPO of the group's electric vehicle and software subsidiary, Ampere, scheduled for the first half of 2024, will create much value for shareholders.Finally, UBS notes that the group's residual activity ('stub') - i.e. the scope remaining post-Ampere spin-off - is around 16 euros, well above its five- and 20-year averages.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. All rights reserved.The information and analyses published by Cercle Finance are intended solely as a decision-making aid for investors. full_text: On Friday, AlphaValue lowered its recommendation on Eramet shares to 'lighten up' from 'accumulate', with a price target reduced from 76.5 to 68.9 euros.In a note issued at midday, the research firm explains that the mining group's valuation will necessarily be affected by geopolitical risk.While acknowledging that the situation could change rapidly in either direction, AlphaValue considers its change of target to be moderate for the time being, wishing to give the company the "benefit of the doubt". the company the 'benefit of the doubt' in view of the uncertainties still surrounding Gabon's future and the evolution of its relations with the French group.However, the independent firm points out that these troubles are occurring in an already delicate context for Eramet, faced with a downturn in raw material prices in all its businesses.This had already led AlphaValue to lower its price target in early August.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: UBS lowers target for Hugo Boss to 89 euros - 'Buy'
full_text: ZURICH (dpa-AFX Broker) - Major Swiss bank UBS cut its price target for Hugo Boss to 89 euros from 91 euros, but kept its rating at "buy." More and more data signaled that growth in the luxury sector is normalizing after several years of double-digit percentage sales growth, analyst Zuzanna Pusz wrote in an industry report available Friday. Together with less favorable exchange rates and the already achieved peak margins of most sector companies, this suggests that earnings momentum will now be rather muted, she added. The expert therefore reduced her forecasts sector-wide./edh/jha/  Publication of the original study: 01.09.2023 / 03:18 / GMT First disclosure of the original study: 01.09.2023 / 03:18 / GMT----------------------- dpa-AFX Broker - the Trader News from dpa-AFX-----------------------

title: PERNOD RICARD :  Stifel lowers its target after results
full_text: Seeing only limited catalysts in the dossier, Stifel reaffirms its 'hold' recommendation on Pernod Ricard, with a price target adjusted from 210 to 202 euros, mainly on currency effects, the day after the annual results.The broker notes that underlying operating margin came out ahead of expectations, when adjusted for currency and scope effects, and that management's tone was confident about profitability for the year ahead. According to Stifel, the main negative element of the annual publication came from management's focus on China, 'with on-trade activity struggling and sales expected to decline in its first quarter 2023-24'.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: ID Logistics added to Oddo BHF's conviction list
full_text: Oddo BHF has added ID Logistics to its 'Nextcaps S2 2023' conviction list, reiterating its 'outperform' recommendation and its price target of 350 euros, which offers potential upside of 45% for the contract logistics group's stock.The stock has returned to much more reasonable levels following this summer's decline, with an EV/EBITDA 2023 multiple excluding IFRS 16 of less than nine times", points out the analyst, who also believes that "momentum will become more positive again in the second half of the year".Indeed, he expects better organic growth following the overcoming of inflation peaks, leverage on margins with the accretive effect of M&A and the international sales mix, as well as the roll-out of significant contracts in the United States and the United Kingdom.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com.
